title: Senior Consultant - SDLC - DAL
job_description:
About YouI am consultative in nature and have a passion for and experience in helping my clients to succeed.I am an industrious team-player; I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves and work diligently on any task.I love to help plan or lead client-facing meetings.I enjoy guiding junior-level team members by reviewing their deliverables, and offering feedback about opportunities for improvement.I thrive when working with senior-level members of my team to ensure project goals are met.I am passionate about the company I work for and love to help with internal initiatives.I am thoroughly organized, have exemplary attention to detail, and demonstrate strong analytical and communication skills.I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every engagement.I excel when working with a team, even when faced with demanding deadlines.
Job SummaryAs an OnPrem Senior Consultant with systems development life cycle (SDLC) experience, you will engage in several technology and business consulting projects ranging from the implementation of technology solutions, to organization and process analyses. You will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and a project manager. You will identify risks and provide mitigation strategies, conduct initial reviews of deliverables and give feedback, provide project status to your Project Manager and/or client, and lead client meetings (e.g. stakeholder interviews, workshops, etc.) 
Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. In this role, you may have an opportunity to mentor junior resources.
About UsWe’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere. Requirements


3-5+ years Systems Integration, Implementation, SDLC, Project Management experience3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferredConsistent exposure to end-to-end SDLC (requirements analysis, design, development management, testing and delivery)Trained on process and/or technology methodologies (e.g. Lean Process Improvement, Six Sigma, Agile implementation, Waterfall model)Experience working with a project team on at least 2 package or custom solution implementation projectsExperience with presentation and spreadsheet tools such as PowerPoint, Visio, and ExcelBachelor's degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration, or other related fields


Preferred


Experience in Media & Entertainment and/or Consumer Products industriesExperience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)


Life at OnPremWe were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Currently 200+ people strong in four geographic territories, we’ve been recognized as a “Best Place to Work,” a “Great Place to Work,” “Fastest Growing,” and “A Jewel.”
Visa StatusApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).
Equal Employment OpportunityOnPrem Solution Partners ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: IT Sales Consultant
job_description:
Are you looking for a company where you can learn, grow, and have the potential to earn $60,000+ in your first year with the realistic opportunity of $85K - $100K+ as you meet and exceed your sales targets? Do you want to utilize your current sales/customer service skills, that we'll enhance with ongoing training, to go to the next level in a professional B2B sales career? Take the chance to turn your ambition and competitive spirit into a rewarding sales career with Access Systems. As we continue to grow, we are looking for highly motivated, success-oriented people to join the team as sales consultants.

In this role, you will be responsible for consulting with current and potential clients and selling them our IT products and services within an assigned geographic territory. You'll have technical engineering assistance, so you don't need to be an IT wizard in this role. You'll simply need to have a general knowledge of technology and the ability to learn and think on your feet. You need to be able to communicate to businesses, in layman's terms, what we offer and how it will benefit them in order to convince them to partner with Access Systems for their technology needs. If this sounds like the kind of career move you've been wanting to make, we want to talk with you.

Apply today and join one ofIowa's Top Workplacesfor the fourth year in a row!

What We Offer:

Base salary + uncapped commission with high earning potential.Car and cell phone allowance.Comprehensive benefitspackage, including 401(k) with company match.Initial and continuous training.All expense paid President's Club trips for top performers.

What You'll Be Doing:

New business development through prospecting and networking.Maintaining top level relationships with an assigned base of current clients. Consulting with businesses to understand needs; offer solutions.Manage all steps of the selling process; coordinate complex decision-making in order to overcome objections to closure.Close new business with current clients and net new businesses according to pre-defined targets, objectives, and plans.Through our CRM platform, you will be responsible for providing accurate activity notes, sales forecasts and reports to management in a timely and consistent manner.

What We're Looking For:

1+ year of sales experience, B2B sales experience is a plus.Associate's/Bachelor's degree preferred.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong relationship building skills.Self-driven, motivated and results oriented.Proven track record of meeting and exceeding goals.Valid driver's license and clean driving record.Proficiency in MS Office tools -- Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

title: Digital Transformation & Architecture - Director/Principal Consultant-REMOTE
job_description:
40% of ISG’s revenues come from our Go-Digital initiatives, and we have ambitious growth plans over the next three years. The Digital Strategy & Solutions Service Line spearheads our Digital solutions and offerings in the market is a key driver of this growth.

Our Digital Strategy & Solutions consist of 5 key domains:

a) Agility @ Enterprise Scale

b) Digital Backbone & Cloud Operating Models

c) Emerging Technology @ Enterprise Scale (Analytics, AI, Cybersecurity, Blockchain,…)

d) Digital Transformation & Architecture

e) Digital Engineering & Manufacturing

The Digital Transformation & Architecture Domain focuses on the transformation programs that ISG’s clients have defined under their digital agenda. The offerings include Business Model Innovation, Data Monetization and the ISG Digital Value Framework™.

To strengthen our Digital Transformation & Architecture domain, we are looking for a seasoned Director and Principal Consultant who will help ISG clients in defining, measuring and executing on how digital drives value and transforms their business models.

This position will play a key role in driving architectural decisions across projects with our clients, will help to shape our offering, and grow/lead a delivery/consulting team for application and solution architecture for business model innovation.

This position will participate as part of the Digital Strategy & Solutions leadership team – and guide a consulting team in sales solutioning, delivery of ISG methodology and tools, and in market-facing content development / thought leadership. You will lead in the development of initial assessments, strategies, workload and/or portfolio analysis, project plans, market capabilities, and roadmap development for the Digital Transformation & Architecture – and run large programs across multiple clients within this discipline.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

• 7-15 years recent consulting experience in enterprise and application architecture in customer-facing roles, or suitable experience within a corporate IT department in a variety of leadership positions across IT Operations, Architecture and Security.

• Expertise in defining target business capabilities and value maps/streams at enterprise level for the G500.

• Good understanding of platform business models.

• Strong understanding of organizational roles and responsibilities associated with enterprise IT and the nuances in B2B, B2C, asset-heavy and B2B2C industry segments.

• Good experience with IT service delivery and operations. Hands-on experience is a nice to have.

• Expert with application delivery models (DevOps and multimodal delivery) and ability to understand application architectures for cloud modernization with working knowledge of architecture of public and on-premise hybrid-cloud solutions

• Broad enterprise application experience with leading ERP stacks such as SAP, Oracle, etc. and other platform such as HRIS, CRM, etc.

• Knowledge and experience with DevOps processes and tools highly desired

• Broad exposure to major SaaS solutions like Workday, Salesforce as well as iPaaS / managed PaaS trends and offerings in the market.

• Knowledge of workloads and patterns for cloud migration and architecting.

• Technical proficiency and comfort with variety of operating system and database platforms

• Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders and C-level executives.

Education/Certifications:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field

• MBA/MS or other advanced degree(s) desirable

• ITIL Foundation Qualification desirable

• Cloud certifications desirable

• Agile, SAFe, Scrum, or Kanban certification(s) desirable

Travel:

• 80% - 100% required

Technical & Professional Traits:

• Fully understands, and has experience with the consulting lifecycle

• Has worked for Tier 1 consultancies at some point in their career at a Director or Associate Partner level or above for at least 3+ years across their overall professional career.

• The individual has led large, diverse, multi-disciplinary teams to solve complex technology related issues in real life industry relevant scenarios.

• Has hands on experience with specific practice competencies & themes through client engagement work in Tier 1 consultancies, or through direct employment with large global enterprises in the specific industry.

• Has strong 3+ years of experience across multiple industry segments, and is knowledgeable of critical success factors/issues that are emerging due to the impact of the Digital Industrial Economy for those industries.

• Is comfortable with working within a matrix management operating model.

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Leads offerings and solutions in the Digital Transformation & Architecture domain across the Americas – guides, shapes and leads a team.

• Leads the enterprise and application architecture practice at ISG.

• Provides consultation services to clients and suppliers in areas of enterprise and application architecture trends, usage of platforms, cloud migrations, management, cost transparency, service models and supplier transactions.

• Carries responsibilities for growing the practice.

• Gains an understanding of client’s current situation and environment by gathering needed information and using appropriate frameworks and models in the development of assessment material for decision-making purposes.

• Participates as a key contributor or engagement leader on client engagements SME focus area.

• Responsible for project management of small to medium sized engagements or major sub-project. Leads the planning and the development to all project deliverables and assumes overall responsibility for staffing, budget, work plans, scope, project milestones, issues management and risk management utilizing ISG’s project management methods, tools and templates.

• Guides and leads the creation and delivery of ISG methodology and tools in support of client cloud computing initiatives.

• Provides thought leadership in the formation and build of additional value-added consulting offerings and partnership opportunities to help drive the ISG Digital Transformation & Architecture business including the development of external content development and thought leadership.

• Assists in recruiting activities by identifying and interviewing candidates as well as informal mentoring and coaching of current staff.

• Contributes to the creation and refinement of ISG methodologies, tools, processes, and IP for cloud and other digital offerings.

title: Business Support Consultant 3
job_description:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as Personal Cell or Cellular in the contact information of your application.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wholesale Banking provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally. Our four major business lines include Corporate & Investment Banking, Commercial Banking, Commercial Real Estate, and Wells Fargo Commercial Capital. We also have groups in credit risk, group risk, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office that support our businesses.

This role will act as a consultant with Business Interruption Support team working with Operations, Technology and Product Partners supporting the Wholesale/Commercial Banking applications with a focus on strategy, projects and initiatives, release coordination support , implications of changes and facilitate resolution for business interruption issues.

The role will also be responsible for:

Participate and make recommendations on policy adherence via project and governance protocols. Utilize business SME, work within project/initiatives to recommend strategies implementation of changes, initiate or support projects and improvements. Engage appropriate partners and Lines of Business to understand impacts of proposed changes, and issues causing business interruption. Engage in resolution activities for production issues impacting business. Provide reporting and communication of production/project installations status and work with Lines of Business to coordinate the validations needed for changes being introduced into production systems. Facilitate Wholesale application Governance Forums, take minutes, capture documentation on SharePoint site. Responsible for updates of all application/Ops specific training. Work with projects and governance leadership to be aware of upcoming changes that could impact training materials and ensure alignment with agreed upon strategy.

Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.Required Qualifications

6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: administrative support, project management, implementation, business operations or strategic planning demonstrated through work or military experience

Other Desired Qualifications

Experience working within technology projects as SME, Business Analyst, Implementation Consultant Process design/development experience Ability to communicate effectively to senior levels of the organization

Street AddressNC-Charlotte: 1525 W Wt Harris Blvd - Charlotte, NC

IA-Des Moines: 800 Walnut St - Des Moines, IA

MN-Minneapolis: 90 S 7th St - Minneapolis, MNDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

title: Technical Consultant - Modern Data Practice
job_description:
The Productive Edge Data, Automation and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Practice provides advanced technology solutions and strategies that propel our clients into the modern data age. Our PE teams turn the promise of AI and Machine Learning into practical solutions that empower differentiated customer experiences, predictive insights, and transformational business outcomes. Likewise, PEs Modern Data Management Framework and Agile-centric methodology enable us to achieve impactful results rapidly and efficiently.

The Technical Consultant - Modern Data Practice, as part of the Data, Automation and AI team, will be responsible for partnering with business stakeholders and Product Managers to understand, analyze, refine, prioritize and communicate business needs to ensure the engineering team understands scope, requirements, and objectives.

Additional Responsibilities:

Partner with project leadership to understand client business processes
Work with client and internal stakeholders to gather functional and technical requirements on current and future systems and processes
Serve as a subject matter expert in the customer's business process and be able to break down processes into manageable steps
Collaborate with customers and technical team to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in the data
Provide technical analysis
Utilize Agile experience to drive projects and product decisions
Participate in collaboration sessions with customers to formulate creative and practical solutions to their challenges
Identify dependencies and remove impediments to ensure that deliverables are achieved on time and within budget
Interface and effectively communicate with both business and technical resources

To excel in these daily activities, the Technical Consultant at Productive Edge would possess the following experience and skills:

Experience delivering sophisticated technical solutions in a timely manner using Agile techniques
Ability to document system-level requirements like services, database models, integration points and server configurations
Ability to easily understand the business problem and serve as the SME for project sponsor needs
Knowledge of SQL and NoSql databases with diverse project experience.
Ability to perform data analysis and translate to requirements, including data mapping and gap analysis
Ability to cast the project vision, assembling and motivating a team to achieve it
Prior development or technical knowledge and skills (SOA, OOP, .NET / Java, SQL)
A natural leader who wants to grow their leadership and strategy skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills, working with both client and technical teams
Knowledge or experience with Machine Learning is a plus!

About Productive Edge

Productive Edge is a Chicago-based leader in digital transformation. As digital business consultants, we focus on digital strategy, customer experience, operations improvement, and product & services enablement. How do we do this? Through launching solutions for Data and Artificial Intelligence (AI), Intelligent Automation (IA), Internet of Things (IoT), and Cloud Native Solutions. Sounds fun, right? It gets better...and thats where you come in!

Productive Edge offers the dynamic opportunity to use your talents in a progressive, highly-collaborative environment that values innovation and creativity. We are a culture that stays on the cusp of todays developing and emerging technologies. Our passion, ingenuity, and dedication sets us apart from other consultants (as does our modern work atmosphere with fun outings, foosball, stocked fridge and other activities). Because we work with and develop solutions for some of the worlds most exciting brands, we are actively searching for individuals who are ready to change the way the world operates.

And if thats not enough, Productive Edge has been featured as one of Chicagos 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For, included in Crains Fast 50, and is a regular on Inc. 5000.

Being a part of a fast-paced solutions driven consulting team focused on delivering strategic asset management services to airports throughout the United States.Responsible for technical work development which includes; strategic plans, business process engineering, implementation plans, asset management plans, financial analysis, total cost of ownership analysis, etc.Expansion of existing clients, development of new clients and market growthOther duties as assigned

title: Financial Consultant
job_description:
The Financial Consultant will work to achieve and maintain bank goals by providing clients with information regarding financial planning.

Qualified candidates should have:

• A four-year college degree or equivalent work experience

• 3-5 years of successful proactive experience in the sale of investment and insurance products

• Active Life and Variable Insurance Licenses

• Active FINRA Series 7 and Series 63 Licenses

• Understanding of potential and existing client needs

• Personable, strong verbal, written and communication skills

• Honest team player who is adaptable to any environment

• Organized with ability to manage time wisely

• Ability to use General office equipment and computer software including Microsoft Office Word and Excel software

• Must have transportation and be able to accommodate appointments outside of bank at customer’s home or offices.

1. Accepts and conforms to the terms of the employment agreement(s) executed between the employee and the bank including a mutual employment agreement executed between the employee, the bank, and the securities brokerage services and insurance services companies. Ensures adherence to all policies, procedures and requirements of both Ridgewood Savings Bank and its partners.

2. Advises prospective clients through in-person and telephonic meetings with the goal of developing relationships and generating leads; follows through with tailored advice that meets client’s financial objections and risk tolerance.

3. Based on the investment consultant’s review of the customer needs, he or she will ensure that appropriate investment and/or insurance strategies are utilized. Provides guidance to customers on personal investment product purchases and sales/redemptions by informing them of current market trends and recommending appropriate investment strategies.

4. Responsible for the sales and distribution of personal investment products and services including retirement, education, and tax-advantaged planning services to individual and business customers to satisfy client needs while increasing the organization’s profitability by achieving revenue targets.

5. Maintains up-to-date awareness of client portfolios to ensure consistency with client goals and identify opportunities for additional business.

6. Advises branch personnel in assigned branches on referral generating activities.

7. Maintains a full working knowledge of various software packages to enhance business development, client service and operational processes.

8. Represents the bank by participating in community affairs, clubs and organizations to assess the needs of the community, enhance the bank’s visibility and increase new business opportunities.Requirements

- Four year College Degree or equivalent work experience.\n\n- Active FINRA Series 7 and Series 63 Licenses. \n\n- Active Life and Variable Insurance Licenses. \n\n- Must have transportation and be able to accommodate appointments outside of bank at customer’s home or offices.\n \n- Ability to use General office equipment and computer software including Microsoft Office Word and Excel software.\n\n- 3-5 years of successful proactive experience in the sale of investment and insurance products

title: Technical Solution Consultant / Cloud Specialist - Remote, US
job_description: Welcome to Guidewire! We make software that offers property and casualty insurance companies the solutions to take care of their customers when they need it the most, whether that’s a time of crisis, a natural disaster, an accident, or exposure to cyber risks. We’re searching for people who are as passionate about working together to represent our quality products and services to the market as we are. As a technology expert, you will be working closely with our Product and Services teams to understand our offerings, with the Sales team to communicate those offerings to prospective customers and most importantly with our prospects and customers to help them find solutions to their most challenging business imperatives. As a member of a team that is known for execution, you will excel in understanding a variety of technical and business process challenges, leading technical discussions with internal and prospective customer teams and presenting complex solution demonstrations. The position requires a unique blend of business process, listening, technical design, and communication skills. Important Note: 55 - 65% travel is required for this role, with some week-to-week variance.  Key activities for the Technical Solution Consultant include:help articulate cloud visions and SaaS offerings to new and existing clientssupporting the sales team as an expert on the technical and integration aspects of Guidewire solutions throughout the sales cycle:leading formal and informal architecture discussionspartnering with the Guidewire Functional Solution Consultants for application configuration for detailed product demonstrations. (eg: data model extensions, page configurations and rules creation).identifying new platform requirements and working with Product Management to design solutions for those requirements Necessary skills and expertise: Strong verbal and presentation skillsProficiency in one or more modern programming languagesDatabase systems and conceptsIntegration mechanisms and patternsProcesses and tools in the software development lifecycle (source control, build systems, testing)Familiarity with cloud computing and SaaS industry trends Helpful knowledge: RESTful architecture and developmentJava and related enterprise technologiesAWS technical ecosystemKubernetes and related technologiesAuthN and AuthZ conceptsModern JavaScript web toolkits and developmentAbout GuidewireGuidewire exists to deliver the industry platform that P&C insurers rely upon to adapt and succeed in a time of accelerating change—and to ensure that every customer succeeds in the journey. We provide the software, services, and partner ecosystem to enable our customers to run, differentiate, and grow their business.Guidewire InsurancePlatform is the P&C industry platform that unifies software, services, and partner ecosystem to power our customers’ business. InsurancePlatform provides the standard upon which insurers can engage their customers, optimize their operations, drive smart decisions, and innovate quickly. We are privileged to serve more than 380 P&C insurers in 32 countries. We invest heavily in R&D to build a technology platform that combines three elements—core processing, data and analytics, and digital engagement—to enhance insurers’ ability to engage and empower their customers and employees.See and hear from our employees at https://careers.guidewire.com/ About GuidewireGuidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. 380 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 700+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.Guidewire Software Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks where it's applicable to the position.

Have excellent communication and public speaking skills

Please email resume, with cover letter and references.

The position is full time with a combination of hourly wage compensation and commission based on sales.

title: ERP Solutions Consultant
job_description:
About Us:

As one of the largest electrical distributors in the United States, Crescent Electric stocks a broad line of electrical, lighting, automation and datacomm products from coast to coast at over 150 locations. Here, leaders inspire, build trust and empower employees to achieve their best. As a family owned business, Crescent offers a caring and supportive environment where employees are provided with the resources and support of a large company. At Crescent, you will have the opportunity to develop professionally, grow personally and have the flexibility to balance your life’s priorities.

Crescent is proud to offer their full-time team members competitive compensation packages and a first class benefits package, along with advancement opportunities. Some of our benefits include 401(k) Retirement Savings Plans with immediate vesting and company match, Paid Volunteer Time, Merchandise Discounts, Holiday and Vacation Pay, and Flexible Spending.

Positive Overview:

Employee will be a software and process champion. The individual will travel to branches and training sites to coach and train employees on software functionality as well as operational processes supported by our CEOPS and CETG’s. Employee will be responsible for supporting company goals to increase productivity and profits through improved use of software tools. Due to an emphasis to implement a distribution center structure and radio frequency warehousing platform in our DCs over the next few years, a willingness and ability to work in a warehouse

Primary Duties:

Proficient understanding of company processes explained in the Crescent Electric Operating Procedures (CEOP’s) and Crescent Eclipse Training Guides (CETG’s). Ability to offer suggestions for improvement in CEOP’s and may be asked to define, create and teach CEOP’s and CETG’s. Communicate branch concerns back to the Eclipse Core team for review.Prepare and teach classes to branch personnel on Crescent Electric Operating Procedures. This will include new processes, upgrades or bolt-on VAS’s. For acquisitions, lead, train, mentor and coach during conversion and go live activities.Conduct Branch Training Assessments at branch locations to discover opportunities to improve branch processes and procedures.Absorb, document, test and assist in assigned functional areas during a new release of the Epicor Eclipse ERP system. This activity should occur bi-annually and will involve interactions with several GO departments.Build onboarding tools for new hires, including curriculums, web based training tools and role-based training guides.•For acquisitions, lead, train, mentor and coach during conversion and go live activities.For Radio Frequency Warehousing Projects and migrations from a branch structure to a distribution center model, a willingness and ability to take an active role assisting with the physical implementation of the project will be required. This may include some warehouse activities to move, reposition and stock material.•Provide support to all responsible functional areas of a Crescent Electric Supply sales and distribution center during Go-live transition.

Qualifications:

Individual must possess strong PC skills and be comfortable with learning and teaching new technologies. Must have the ability to work quickly and accurately within time constraints and against deadlines. In addition, must possess strong interpersonal skills, organizational skills, be a self-starter, detail oriented, and have the ability to multitask and communicate effectively with diversified branch personnel.Must have the ability and interest to train and maintain patience and professionalism during stressful situations.Must be able to communicate effectively with all staff possessing varying levels of computer skill. Must be comfortable with public speaking.Must be comfortable with flying and travel. 25-30% travel required.Must meet company driving record requirements and have a valid driver's license.Associate’s degree or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Consultant - Connected Communications
job_description:
The Role:

The Spur Group is looking for a Consultant to join our Connected Communications service line. As a Consultant, you will work closely with our clients and with other team members to develop high-quality deliverables, leveraging your communication and project management skills. You’ll help clients make an impact on their organizations and in their target markets, and you’ll have ample opportunity for professional development through on-the-job learning, coaching, training, and mentoring. Best of all, you’ll be part of a team-centric culture where fellow consultants and managers support you and encourage you to grow every day.

What You'll Do:

Drive client workstreams and create deliverables (e.g. marketing collateral, sales enablement assets, executive presentations, etc.)


Quickly build an understanding of project purpose and contextResearch, organize and analyze information in a systematic way, identifying what’s relevant and drawing logical conclusionsDevelop ideas for deliverable structure, and create drafts that demonstrate an understanding of audience needs and objectivesDevelop a perspective and rationale for moving forward in a given directionOwn revisions and incorporate internal and client feedback


Take a consultative, team-oriented approach


Present context, questions, and recommendations clearly and efficientlyParticipate in working sessions, provide peer feedback, and assist others with deliverables as necessaryContribute suggestions and ideas to the teamProactively surface gaps and areas for improvement, along with suggestions for addressing them


Engage with clients to drive project progress


Draft day-to-day client communicationsDetermine goals and topics for client meetingsParticipate in client interviews and related fact-finding initatives - prepare, take notes, and follow up to ensure completion of next stepsParticipate in client reviews– listen carefully, ask appropriate questions, and make suggestions


Perform project management duties


Develop deliverable and project workback plansSet daily and weekly priorities, and manage personal progress against themComplete administrative duties (e.g. providing status updates, scheduling meetings)Track project details, like timelines and action items, and follow through on assigned tasksAssist in mitigating risks and resolving issues

Who You Are (What you’d bring to Spur):

You are curious and driven to learnYou take pride in ownership and enjoy seeing things through to completionYou thrive in a fast-paced environment and have a bias for actionYou identify required tasks and are resourceful in finding ways to complete themYou use good judgment in taking appropriate action and making logical decisionsYou listen carefully, and you seek to understand by asking clarifying questionsYou are a strategic thinker who can see how a work product fits into the big pictureYou are self-aware of what you don’t know, and aren’t afraid to ask for helpYou work collaboratively with other team members, and can also work well independentlyYou can handle ambiguity and drive work products forward in ambiguous situations

Requirements:

A bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, business administration, a liberal-arts discipline, or equivalent
2-4 years of relevant professional experience required (consulting or client-facing professional services experience is a plus)
Strong written and verbal communications skills, including the ability to write professional documents and to use appropriate communication methods
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact with people of all levels in a variety of situations
Strong organizational skills
Some experience building stories and creating content, including developing visual concepts
Experience taking ownership of projects and deliverables from beginning to end
Advanced experience with Microsoft productivity tools (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, Excel) and business communications platforms (e.g. WebEx, Skype, Teams)
Good business acumen and awareness of business and technology trends
Positive attitude and strong willingness to learn from mentors and peers

What We Offer 

Competitive salary and total rewards packageHealth, Dental, Vision benefits for you and your family (100% paid by the company)Life, Accidental Death& Dismemberment, and Disability insuranceOpportunity to participate in 401k with up to 4% optional company matchFlexible vacationCell phone and serviceA world-class community at Spur!

The Spur Group is an equal employment opportunity employer. We are committed to building diverse and inclusive culture that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We consider all candidates regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or characteristic protected by federal, state, and local law.

title: Digital Enterprise Agility Operating Model - Principal Consultant
job_description:
The challenge of today’s IT environment is to be able to rapidly develop and release new capabilities while keeping stability across core applications. Various layers of development pace require an understanding of how value is defined, services are architected and consumed, and how workflows across delivery to meet the needs of the business and consumer.

An Enterprise Agility Digital Operating Model Consultant helps our clients realize the future state, to define and adopt a product-based operating model. In this role, you will help clients develop their technology product model, define the right governance and strategic functions, and create a flexible model for product teams. You will help them operate in a way that allows them to achieve product-specific business value, learn how to continuously iterate and improve that value by incorporating real customer feedback and insights, and successfully define organizational change management strategies to lead the client through the significant culture change needed by both the IT and Business organizations.

You will use ISG core frameworks and delivery approaches for operating model discovery, analysis, design, and implementation. These frameworks and approaches are used to help the client successfully transform from function-based siloes using a short-lived “project” delivery approach to more Business and IT cross-functional teams delivering in a more perpetual “products” approach. This shift, from project to product, must contemplate all components of the operating model to succeed. For IT shared-services departments, this means helping them create a digital backbone and products that enable development and product teams to adopt and use these services quickly, mindfully and sustainably. For software development and DevOps teams and the business, this means helping to develop, operate and improve the digital products that engage their end customers.

Through deep professional services engagements, the Digital Operating Model practice helps our clients define their target product-based operating model, including defining requirements and changes to their existing products/capabilities, delivery models, processes, and people/workforce. We then coach and facilitate the execution, including the culture change, working with their leaders and teams to ensure that the model is successful and sustainable.

We need consultants who can utilize their experience in Agile, DevOps, Lean, Product Management and modern technology delivery models (as-a-Service, automation, etc.) along with ISG design methodologies to enable a client to transform their operating model to a flexible yet cost effective agile enterprise.

Typical engagements the Enterprise Agility Digital Operating Model Principal Consultant will be involved in are:

• Workshops to inform clients about digital, operating model, enterprise agility, sourcing / solution and organizational market trends and developments

• Assessment of existing operating model and delivery environment

• Target operating model design (capabilities/products, value streams, delivery models, shared service functions, partner ecosystem, organization / teams / skills, technology landscape (at a very high level), governance and performance management of the IT estate)

• IT and Digital Strategy development

• IT Governance and decision rights design & implementation

• Partner ecosystem strategies

• Skills assessment and gap mitigation strategies

• Organization change management and culture change

• Organization design

• Coaching and facilitation in transformation to the new target operating model

The Digital Operating Model Principal Consultant supports operating model engagements under the direction of a director or partner either for a specific engagement or with an agreed role in a specific area of an engagement, and also supports internal practice development activities.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

• 2+ years of digital operating model development and transformation

• 3+ years of Agile Development, Continuous Development in a DevOps environment, and/or Scrum consulting or delivery experience; developing or delivering complex operational solutions including shared and business services is a plus.

• Product Management disciplines, with scaled movement to product-orientation a plus.

• 5+ years in Information Technology, working in a technical delivery role (applications or infrastructure related roles).

• Competency in the following key disciplines is desirable:

o Application Development Lifecycle Management techniques (SDLCs such as Kanban, SCRUM, SAFe, etc.)

o DevOps practices and CI/CD automation and continuous delivery disciplines

o Cloud computing and cloud-native applications development and management

o Understanding of Service Lifecycle Management disciplines (Service Design, Service Transition, Service Operations, and Continual Improvement – ITIL, Cobit, IT4IT models)

o Modern architectures (microservices, APIs, integration layers, etc.) at a high level

o Knowledge of Automation areas (RPA, Cognitive, AI, autonomation)

• Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders.

• Knowledge or experience in maturing technologies such as APIs, Open Source, Containers, Version Control environments, AI / Cognitive, Data Analytics, Blockchain and other digital capabilities highly desirable

• Any experience with operating model design, organization design, organization change management or culture change is a plus

Education:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field or a business degree with relevant work experience.

• MBA/MS or other advanced degree(s) desirable

Certifications:

• Agile, SAFe, Lean/Six Sigma and/or Scrum certifications desirable

• DevOps and/or DevOps Architecture certifications desirable

• AWS, Azure Cloud or Solution Architecture certification desirable

Travel:

• 80% - 100% required

Computer Literacy:

• Demonstrates working knowledge with MS-Office suite of software applications and tools, including: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Teams and MS Outlook.

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Provides consultation services to clients.

• Gains an understanding of client’s current situation and environment by gathering needed information and using appropriate frameworks and models in the development of tailored material for decision-making purposes.

• Develops client specific operating model design materials.

• Participates as a principal or lead on engagements or as a key contributor on engagements in a given role and under the leadership of an engagement lead.

• Develops materials and conducts in both workshop and presentation style at all organizational levels.

• Uses expertise in collaboration with the team, including the client, to develop solutions specific to the client’s identified problem and/or objective.

• Participates in operating model design, organizational design, and education within the areas of Agile and DevOps practices and techniques in a product-oriented environment.

title: Business Technology Solutions Consultant
job_description:
Are you interested in a career where you aren't behind a computer in an office all day? Do you love to meet new people and provide technology solutions that help businesses succeed? Are you resilient, goal driven and prefer to be rewarded for your personal achievements? If this sounds like you, we are seeking high energy and highly motivated individuals to join our winning technology sales team. We offer full training, clearly defined expectations, a proven process and an award winning service team to support your success. We offer a lucrative and uncapped commission plan, multiple bonus opportunities, contests, trips, team events, a great benefits package and a rapid growth environment with opportunities for advancement in an amazing culture.

You will be responsible for promoting a diverse portfolio of cutting edge technology solutions including: managed IT services, cloud services, workflow solutions, VOIP phone systems, backup systems and IT support. This is a territory based sales position and requires local travel daily.


Promote all products and solutions to new and current clients through sales referrals, prospecting and cold calling, targeted accounts, and lead resources.
Manage accounts and achieve expected business results on a weekly and monthly basis.
Introduce new products, offer promotions, and assist customer service team to resolve customer issues.
Contract negotiation and submission, and account documentation.
Collaborate with Verticomm IT engineering and project team complete projects and continue building and leveraging relationships with existing accounts.

A proven track record of success working in sales, business development, customer service, account management or a related field that requires prospecting for new business and handling a high level of rejection. A combination of education and/or experience through athletics, internships or work experience that has focused on developing skills in business, competitiveness, and resilience. Competitive, positive and goal driven. Microsoft Office Proficiency IT sales experience or professional education in the IT field would be preferred Strong desire to work in a customer focused environment with excellent time management and problem solving skills.

We offer a $39k base, bonuses, a competitive commission structure, full benefits, sales contests, company trips, contests and events; happy hour events, company golf outings, sporting events and group charitable events as well as many other great perks.

Candidates must successfully pass a criminal background check prior to hire and candidates must have a valid Driver License and reliable transportation.

title: BUSINESS CONSULTANT I
job_description:
Requisition No: 201021

Agency: Department of Law Enforcement

Working Title: BUSINESS CONSULTANT I - 71000808

Position Number: 71000808

Salary: $32,696.82

Posting Closing Date: 07/14/2020

ABOUT OUR AGENCY:

The Florida Department of Law Enforcement (FDLE) employs more than 1,900 members statewide – either at headquarters in Tallahassee or in one of seven regional operations centers (ROCs). Services are delivered by five key areas: Executive Direction and Business Support; Investigations and Forensic Science; Florida Capitol Police; Criminal Justice Information Services; and Criminal Justice Professionalism. Click here for additional information about FDLE.

MISSION:

To promote public safety and strengthen domestic security by providing services in partnership with local, state, and federal criminal justice agencies to prevent, investigate, and solve crimes while protecting Florida citizen’s and visitors.

BUSINESS CONSULTANT I – 71000808

To be considered as a potential candidate, you must meet the minimum qualifications(s) listed below. Degrees must be from an accredited college or university as recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and two years of professional fiscal or administrative experience.A master’s degree from an accredited college or university in business or public administration can substitute for one year of the required experience.Professional or nonprofessional experience as described above can substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required college education.Any combination of professional or nonprofessional experience as described above and college education at the rate of 30 semester or 45 quarter hours per year can substitute for the required education.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position is responsible for the business and financial operations of the Office of General Counsel (OGC). Specific duties include:

Directing, planning, organizing, and participating in general business and accounting activities;Developing and auditing business procedures; Directing the procurement and distribution of goods and services; Researching and making recommendations for major purchases; Receiving and remitting monies to the Office of Financial Management (OFM) for public records requests and for Chapter 943 research and statistical requests for Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS); Managing renewals and payment for memberships and annual dues for the OGC; Maintaining records for equipment and license procurements which includes designing and implementing a tangible personal property inventory system, monitoring property inventory, and inspecting equipment; andProviding consultative and administrative support to the General Counsel, the Assistant General Counsel, and the Public Records Unit management.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:

Knowledge of basic management principles and practices; Knowledge of the methods of data collection and analysis; Ability to plan, organize and coordinate work assignments; Ability to understand and apply rules, regulations, policies and procedures relating to operational and management analysis activities; Ability to collect, evaluate and analyze data in order to develop alternative recommendations, solve problems, document work and other activities relating to the improvement of operational and management practices; Ability to identify criteria relevant to a subject of review; Ability to research, identify and critically analyze information and activities;Ability to organize data and information into logical formats for presentation in reports, documents and other written materials; Ability to write comprehensive reports based on analysis of issues; Ability to solve problems and make decisions independently; Ability to communicate verbally and in writing; Ability to work cooperatively in a group; andAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.

OUR SALARY & BENEFITS:

Starting salary will be the minimum of the class pay range, unless otherwise dictated by FDLE’s pay policy. FDLE is a State of Florida Employer and offers a comprehensive benefits package, including:Paid holidays, vacation and sick leave;HMO and PPO health insurance options with premiums starting as low as $50 per month;$25,000 in automatic life insurance coverage;Multiple supplemental insurance options including: dental, vision, disability and more;Pension and investment retirement plan options;Tax deferred medical and child care reimbursement accounts; andState of Florida Tuition Waiver Program.

HIRING PROCESS:

You will be evaluated for this job based on your previous knowledge and experience. Additional reviews may be performed to screen for preferred qualifications, experience and education. Your qualifications will be based on knowledge, skills, and abilities and other elements relevant to this position supported by the information in your application. Qualifying questions will only be credited if verifiable by the information provided on your application including specifically required software/computer skills. You may be contacted to participate in a selection process which may consist of written exercises, work samples, skills tests, and in-person interviews. You may be notified by email to participate in a selection process. Failure to reply within a designated timeframe may exclude you from further consideration. Future vacancies may be filled from this position advertisement.

BACKGROUND:

FDLE requires an extensive background process of all recommended applicants. The elements of a background include: financial credit check, criminal history of applicant and applicant’s immediate family or roommates, personal references, employment verifications, drug screen and fingerprinting. This information will be utilized to make the final hiring decision.

NOTES:

Preference will be given to current FDLE members who have satisfactorily completed their probationary period or served at least one year in their current position. Preference may be given to applicants in the State Personnel System who have satisfactorily completed their probationary period or served at least one year in their current position.

REMINDERS:

Male applicants born on or after October 1, 1962, will not be eligible for hire or promotion unless they are registered with the Selective Services System (SSS) before their 26th birthday, or have a Letter of Registration Exemption from the SSS. For more information, please visit the SSS website: http://www.sss.gov.If you are a retiree of the Florida Retirement System (FRS), please check with the FRS on how your current benefits will be affected if you are re-employed with the State of Florida. Your current retirement benefits may be cancelled, suspended, or deemed ineligible depending upon the date of your retirement.

The State of Florida hires only U.S. citizens and lawfully authorized alien workers.

The State of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer, and does not tolerate discrimination or violence in the workplace.

Candidates requiring a reasonable accommodation, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act, must notify the agency hiring authority and/or People First Service Center (1-866-663-4735). Notification to the hiring authority must be made in advance to allow sufficient time to provide the accommodation.

The State of Florida supports a Drug-Free workplace. All employees are subject to reasonable suspicion drug testing in accordance with Section 112.0455, F.S., Drug-Free Workplace Act.

VETERANS’ PREFERENCE. Pursuant to Chapter 295, Florida Statutes, candidates eligible for Veterans’ Preference will receive preference in employment for Career Service vacancies and are encouraged to apply. Candidates claiming Veterans’ Preference must attach supporting documentation with each submission that includes character of service (for example, DD Form 214 Member Copy #4) along with any other documentation as required by Rule 55A-7, Florida Administrative Code. Veterans’ Preference documentation requirements are available by clicking here. All documentation is due by the close of the vacancy announcement.

title: Credit Portfolio Consultant 3 (Credit and Debit Card Payment and Claim Analytics)
job_description:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as Personal Cell or Cellular in the contact information of your application.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

The Card Payment Analytics Team is seeking a highly self-motivated, investigative, curious and computer savvy professional with experience in predictive modeling and data analysis to join Card Payment Fraud Analytics team as a Credit Portfolio Consultant 3. This role is highly dynamic and will require critical thinking and a tactical approach to problem solving.

Major responsibilities:

Collaborate with other internal analyst / operational partners to track and analyze a variety of payment card claims. Deliver analytical insights to identify potential process optimization opportunities associated with card payment claims through the use of business intelligence, reporting solutions, dashboards, data-mining and advanced analytics. Identify and understand factors and trends driving card payment claim decisions, losses and customer experiences. Proficiently analyze large volume of customer, card and transaction level data and develop computer processes to assist loss reduction opportunities associated with payment card claims.

Other responsibilities:

Detection and mitigation of card fraud, investigate the root cause of fraud, create new or improve existing models or processes that mitigate the fraud risk to improve customer experience for the bank. Utilize advanced analytic capabilities to perform event-based and root cause analysis to effectively detect and mitigate fraud risk for the Wells Fargo Credit & Debit Card Portfolio. Research, develop, evaluate, and execute new and existing fraud detection and mitigation strategies. Drive new and improved fraud monitoring and detection capabilities including creating insightful dashboards / data visualization to track and monitor key business metrics. Translate complex data from multiple sources, formats, data structure into actionable and tangible strategies. Partner with other Analysts, Operations, Credit and Debit Card Product teams, and Strategy Implementation teams to understand and analyze all fraud mitigation processes including transaction decision, post-decision customer contact/analysis, and fraud claims processing. Establish and review appropriate business intelligence reports to detect the latest fraud trend and translate into actionable recommendations. Stay current with new and developing payment methods in the Credit or Debit card space and proactively identify the fraud risk that each method may create. Querying large data sources to support data driven risk detection/mitigation strategies without compromising customer experience.

Required Qualifications

6+ years of risk experience4+ years of risk management and mitigation experience4+ years of SQL or SAS experience4+ years of experience with analytical methods used in statistical analysis, modeling, and reporting

Desired Qualifications

Ability to analyze metrics and articulate data trends both visually and verballyExperience with predictive analysis software or applications such as Knowledge Studio or Knowledge SeekerPredictive modeling experience (including logistic regression)Experience designing and optimizing complex SQL queries involving table joins and correlated sub-queries on large scale data tablesOutstanding problem solving and analytical skills with ability to turn findings into strategic imperativesAbility to present to multiple levels of managementAdvanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skillsTableau experienceAbility to develop partnerships and collaborate with other business and functional areasExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

Other Desired Qualifications

Extensive knowledge and understanding of fraud risk and mitigation: strategies to reduce or mitigate loss and fraud exposures Ability to work in a fast paced deadline driven environment and learn quickly A Master's degree or higher in a quantitative discipline is desired Experience analyzing large data sets, identifying trends, with the ability to articulate findings when presenting to key business stakeholders Debit or Credit card payment risk experience Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively and learn quickly in a rapidly changing environment and function efficiently under short deadlines

Street AddressAZ-Chandler: 2700 S Price Rd - Chandler, AZ

AZ-PHX-Central Phoenix: 100 W Washington St - Phoenix, AZ

IA-Des Moines: 800 Walnut St - Des Moines, IA

NC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC

NC-Charlotte: 1525 W Wt Harris Blvd - Charlotte, NCDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

title: Sales Associate/ Eyewear Consultant
job_description:
Thursday, August 2, 2018

POSITION SUMMARY

The Eyewear Consultant analyzes prescriptions to make recommendations that provide the highest quality vision care to our patients. Additionally, the Eyewear Consultant fits, measures and adjusts eyeglasses under the direct supervision of an optician or optometrist to exceed the patients needs and expectations. Additionally, problem solves any difficulty a patient may experience regarding vision care.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Provide patients with exceptional customer service by understanding and assisting the patient’s needs.

• Guide and assist patients in the eyewear and frame/lens selection process, by using extensive knowledge of product lines and options to educate patient.

• Under the direct supervision of an optometrist or an optician, converse with patients to analyze and assess patient’s vision problems and needs.

• Maximize sales by using the company’s best, better, good sales concept, maximizing key areas; BOGOs, product of choice AR, poly, warranties, 2nd and backup eyeglasses etc.

• Provide patients with comprehensive explanation of their insurance benefits.

• Understand the company’s cost of goods and retail fee schedules. Be able to utilize knowledge of cost of goods to eliminate situations where cost-conscious patients might consider taking their Rx to a discount retailer (“walking Rx”).

• Capturing Exam Only.

• Educate patient on the adaptation of new Rx’s and care of lenses.

• Under the direct supervision of an optometrist or an optician, use pupillometer, PD ruler and other technical aids for proper fit and measurements.

• Complete lens & frame information, enter full information into POS software and ensure manager signs off.

• Promise accurate delivery & turnaround times meeting the patients’ needs. Immediately notify patient of any delays of delivery times.

• Understand all promotions, coupons and third party programs available through My Eye Dr.

• Conducts “Care Calls” on a daily basis to patients who received their eyewear one week prior.

• Under the direct supervision of an optometrist or an optician, use lensometer to neutralize, verify and make a final inspection of eyewear.

• Notify and re-notify patients when eyeglasses are complete for dispensing.

• Under the direct supervision of an optometrist or an optician, fit and adjust completed eyewear for each patient.

• Ensure product pricing is accurate.

• Monitor jobs waiting to be picked up. Inform management of any job held over 30 days.

• Clean and merchandise displays on a daily basis, displaying effective merchandise at all times.

• Place all returns in their proper bins.

• Under the direct supervision of an optometrist or an optician, perform preliminary testing for patients, as needed.

• Accurately process patient payment transactions.

• Help maintain the attractive appearance of the office.

• Attend all office meetings.

• Participate in all training opportunities offered by My Eye Dr.

• Other duties, as assigned.

EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

• AA or BA/BS in related field is desirable.

• 1-3 years of related eyewear experience within a similar office environment.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

• Demonstrated success in a retail, office environment addressing a broad spectrum of customer requirements and preferences.

• Demonstrated ability to establish positive patient rapport and build relationships to establish repeat customer-trends.

• Strong communication skills (oral and written) with the proven ability to manage priorities in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment.

• Ability to multi-task, set priorities and ensure that patient commitments/deadlines are met

• Proficiency in utilization of automated equipment and systems standard to the optometry industry

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

• This position requires the ability to communicate and exchange information, utilize equipment necessary to perform the job, and move about the office.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

• This position is performed in a traditional retail office environment.

Other details


 Pay Type

 Hourly

title: Management Consultant 03 - Boston Office
job_description:
COMPANY SUMMARY

Acquis Consulting Group is a consulting firm specializing in strategy and implementation. We partner with clients to enable growth that is both measurable and meaningful. We help our partners create new ways to think about their business, but we don’t stop there. We see projects through and help implement business ideas, turning them into lasting business value.

Acquis serves both domestic and international organizations from our headquarters in New York City and satellite offices in California, Massachusetts and New Jersey. Acquis supports industry leading enterprises through high profile projects that span strategy and execution.

COMPANY CULTURE

We sustain our culture through careful analysis of new and experienced hires and go to great lengths to hire individuals that will add to the experience of working at Acquis. Our core values at Acquis are People First, Advance Together and Think +Do.

People First:One of our greatest priorities is to attract, develop, and retain top talent. Accordingly, we have created a “second family” environment where each individual has an opportunity and obligation to contribute to our shared success. We measure this success not only through our delivery excellence but through the satisfaction of the people that work here. We believe that we have created a unique environment that balances autonomy with responsibility, offering the ability to learn by doing while providing a careful balance of oversight. Acquis is a learning organization that is built on the premise that our employees can add value from day one.

Advance Together: Acquis brings insight, passion, and intelligence to the lasting relationships we establish with leading enterprises. We measure ourselves through our clients’ success utilizing the agility, creativity, and focus of a smaller firm.

Think+Do: Acquis provides our clients with strategic insights and also helps deliver them. Acquis consultants can advise our clients on their critical business issues, develop creative ways to address their challenges, and help implement these solutions.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Acquis Consulting Group is seeking a few intelligent and skilled consultants with 2 – 4 years’ experience to act as Associates. A BS or BA is required for consideration, concentration in business preferred. Top schools, impressive GPAs and challenging curriculum will receive preference.

Candidates must be self-starters with proven positions of leadership. Mental agility and the ability to learn are paramount. The ability to take on new challenges and succeed beyond one’s comfort zone is required.

SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Acts as an incisive, effective creative thinker bringing business and consulting experience to client engagements and applies expert skills in communication, research, problem-solving, and analysis to the hands-on work that is the primary focus of these positions.
Takes on significant responsibilities, working closely with clients and making a major contribution to every engagement.
Leverages business context to analyze and improve complex business models.
Explains and reviews analysis/findings with team members and client personnel.
Assesses presenting problem with appropriate project scope and decomposes problem to identify root causes.
Manages client expectations and project scope actively with an approach designed to engender project success and extend goodwill.
Identifies implications of proposed solutions on people, processes, technology, strategy and structure.
Builds an effective business case for proposed solutions.
Thrives in an entrepreneurial, results-oriented, small business environment.

EDUCATION

BS or BA (Business, Finance, Engineering, Computer Sciences preferred)
MBA is not required, but MBAs from top schools preferred

SKILL SET AND EXPERIENCE

Preferred consulting backgrounds include but are not limited to:

Capability Development
Cost Management and Reduction
New Product and Service Development
Post-Merger Integration
Procurement
Shared Services
Travel, Expense and Meetings

Preferred skill sets include but are not limited to:

Analytics and Reporting
Change Management
Operational Strategy
Process Engineering
Program and Project Management
Systems Implementation

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

Well-rounded – You have a wide range of skills, interests, and an exceptional work ethic.
Positive – No job is too big or too small for you. You take your work seriously, but you don’t take yourself too seriously.
Adaptive – You enjoy being outside of your comfort zone. You tackle ambiguity, change, and new challenges with enthusiasm.
Quick-learning –You have the mental agility to self-start and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Analytical – You have a passion for data-driven problem solving.
Results-oriented – You do what it takes to get the job done right and have the fortitude to see it through.
Customer-focused – You are passionate about the success of your client.
Collaborative – You’re the consummate team player, and everyone wants to be on your team.
