title: Network Engineer Consultant SME - Cisco FTD (Cisco Firepower)
job_description:
Company SummaryFounded in 2004, NetBrain is the leader in transforming network operations thought automation. Its ground-breaking automation platform leverages the power of dynamic maps to provide CIOs and network teams with end-to-end network visibility while enabling adaptive automation across the organization’s physical, virtual and software-defined networks. Today, over 2,300 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.

“NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.” - Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrainOverviewWhat We Need

NetBrain is looking for Network Engineers who are interested in making extra money working as a part time consultant. The consultants we are looking for are Subject Matter Experts on deploying, operating and managing Cisco FTD (Cisco firepower). These consultants will create sample labs with best practice deployments and configurations. We are focused on finding SMEs on Cisco FTD (Cisco Firepower) and are open to Consultants located across the world.

The Impact You’ll Make

In this role, you will work with a worldwide workforce of passionate technologists who help our largest enterprise and service provider customers to drive their network automation capability.ResponsibilitiesWhat You’ll Do

Here are some sample tasks you will need to do:


You will create sample labs of a specific technology with sample best practice deployments and configurations.
You will produce documentation on what a helpful map of the technology looks like including but not limited to L2/L3 topology, service flows, overlay/underlay visualization etc.
You will create sample configurations of both key CLI commands and API outputs
You will create sample operational and troubleshooting best practices

QualificationsWho You Are

You are an expert in architecting, designing and operating Cisco FTD (Cisco Firepower)
You have hands on experience working with, configuring and troubleshooting Cisco FTD (Cisco Firepower)
You are experienced in documenting the technology architecture for operations handover


Please submit a cover letter to indicate which technology you have expertise and briefly explain your experience with the technology.

title: Sr. Strategy & Innovation Analyst
job_description:
Work Shift:Salary Exempt (United States of America)Altium Packaging, Our Culture Differentiates Us!

We are an essential business and still hiring during the COVID-19 pandemic!

We incorporate our Guiding Principles into all aspects and at all levels of the organization and use them as a framework for decision-making. We believe our Guiding Principles foster a culture of excellence that benefits both employees and customers.

Our Guiding Principles

Act with Integrity & in ComplianceDrive Value CreationBe Disciplined EntrepreneursFocus on the CustomerAct with HumilityTreat others with Dignity and RespectSeeking Fulfillment in your Work

Job Description

The Sr. Analyst, Strategy & Innovation will be responsible for reviewing, analyzing and executing on strategic initiatives and product and capability innovation. The Sr. Analyst will support the Director with a variety of workstreams, including: market point-of-view development, go-to-market strategy, long-range strategic planning, ad hoc analysis, execution of strategic recommendations, innovation pipeline management, strategic innovation analytics, business case development for new product and process innovation and support of the business unit leaders with commercialization of innovation.

Duties & Responsibilities

Primary resource defining scope and conducting market analysis of select customer end segments to provide leadership with improved insights and specific recommendations on ROI positive projects

Proactively review macro trends and identify resulting opportunities to generate new learnings and initiatives for Altium

Support and lead work streams for the annual long-range strategic planning cycle

Work closely with and provide market insights to the sales team to support commercial opportunities

Lead and support business units with the execution of stated strategic initiatives and the commercialization of new products

Partner with the innovation team to ensure the concept is viable, the product has market demand, projects are moving through the innovation pipeline, and business cases have been developed for work stream prioritization

Identify new external partners and cultivate relationships to help drive innovation opportunities

Prepare materials and ad hoc analysis for quarterly board meetings.

Key Requirements (skills, competencies, experiences, certifications)

Proven working experience conducting complex and ambiguous analyses, and the corresponding ability to present complex data sets in clear and concise formats

Strong history of managing projects, including interaction with variety of suppliers and internal customers i.e., marketing, sales, finance, operations etc.

Pragmatic and a quick learner, aptitude to learn state-of-the-art subjects, and customer centric.

A self-starter with enthusiasm and flexibility, able to think logically end-to-end.

Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Access) and reporting packages (Business Objects etc.)

Good written and verbal communication skills and ability to demonstrate analytical skills - need to challenge higher level of people and present complex data sets/situations in clear and concise ways

Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence.

We Believe in Rewarding our Most Important Resource – Our People!

We show our commitment to Total Rewards by providing a competitive, comprehensive benefits package. In addition to medical, dental and vision plans, company holidays and vacation days, tuition reimbursement, learning and training opportunities, bonus potential, and a 401(k) plan with company contributions, Altium Packaging locations offer rewards and recognition programs and opportunities to make a difference in the community.

Take your career to the next level at Altium Packaging!

Anniversary Bonuses
Research Opportunities

Full time salaried staff enjoy the following additional benefits:

Company subsidized Health Insurance
Access to company sponsored Dental Insurance
Company Laptop
Company Cell Phone
Company sponsored 401(k) Retirement Plan
Paid Conference and CEU attendance

If you want to make a difference in the life of a child while maximizing your potential as a behavioral health professional please consider joining Continuum! title: Registered Nurse (RN) - Lactation Consultant 0.8 FTE
job_description:
Love + medicine is who we are, it's what we do, it's why people want to work here.

If you’re looking for a job to love, apply today.

Schedule Weekly Hours:

32

Lactation Consultant position available

Part time 0.8 fte - 64 hours every two week

Days with weekend rotation

International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC) required

Lactation consultants provide breastfeeding guidance and support in the inpatient and outpatient setting

BASIC FUNCTION

Functions as an agent of the patient while providing the full scope of nursing care. Analyzes information, monitors patients, and takes action to facilitate wellness and healing. Delegates and supervises assistive personnel. Meets the expectations of a professional employee. Role is professional, specialized, and connected to an episode of nursing care. Provides the lactating patient with the information, education, skills and clinical treatments essential to the successful attainment of her breastfeeding goals. Responsible and accountable for the assessment, planning, implementation and documentation of treatment plans for the management of lactation problems. Acts as a breastfeeding resource for medical and nursing staff. Promotes breastfeeding as the preferred feeding methods for newborns and infants in the community.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Patient Information Analysis:

Collaborates with patient/family and prioritize patient needs, problems and goals; intervenes or refers.

Evaluates, compares and interprets ambiguous and changing patient data.

Explores patients understanding and knowledge of current health status.

Consistently and intuitively demonstrates and documents skills according to the ILCA Standards of Practice for Lactation Consultants for the assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of care in a variety of situation, both simple and complex.

Patient Observation and Monitoring:

Applies nursing judgment to determine level of care assigned or delegated.

Uses knowledge of complex physiology to monitor, detect, anticipate early and subtle health status changes.

Monitors, trends and records patient response to disease, illness, treatment.

Nursing Action:

Accountable for individualized plan of care and its delivery.

a) Applies specialized expertise to solve problems, generate ideas, plan care, teach and create new services.

b) Assigns Standards of Care

c) Uses scientific background, knowledge of change theory, ability to work with an interdisciplinary team and psychosocial skills to coordinate effective and efficient care for the patient.

d) Collaborates with patients about plan of care.

e) Guides development of multiple health care partnerships to achieve a positive health effect.

Maintains purposeful therapeutic presence with patient based on nursing judgment.

Provides care based on patient complexity and nursing judgment.

Uses patients' perspective to support informed decision-making.

The Lactation Consultant will:

a) Educate parents and families to encourage informed decision-making about infant and chile feeding.

b) Provide anticipatory teaching to promote ideal breastfeeding practices and minimize the potential for breastfeeding problems or complications.

c) Provide inpatient care in a complete, accurate and timely way to mothers/families who are experiencing breastfeeding problems or who are at risk for breastfeeding failure.

d) Communicate and collaborate with other health care professionals.

e) Provide outpatient consultations.

f) Develop and implement treatment plans in a manner appropriate to the situation and acceptable to the mother.

Promotes patient wellness and facilitates healing:

Anticipates future needs and educates or refers to valid sources of information.

Understands the patients unique perspective and assures right education, right time, right environment for learning.

Evaluates outcome of learning.

Delegation and supervision of assistive personnel:

Delegates care based on situation while assuming accountability for patient outcome.

Fosters teamwork and respect.

Assures effective use of staffing resources.

Supports assistive personnel: Serves as a resource and holds assistive personnel accountable to complete delegated tasks.

Provides counseling, education and support to Gundersen Lutheran employees who are returning to work after maternity leave and plan to continue to breastfeed.

Provides breastfeeding education to groups of patients through the New Life Education Department.

Educate other health care professional by sharing current research-based information and demonstrating skill, thereby empowering those professionals to provide informed and appropriate guidance to the breastfeeding family.

Professional expectations:

Ascribes to the ANA Code of Ethics for professional nursing practice.

Commits to culturally congruent care.

Commits to continuous learning.

Participates in education of nursing colleagues and students.

Commits to evidence-based practice and the conduct of nursing research.

Commits to mission, vision and values of organization and to the profession of nursing.

Assures compliance with JCAHO, Recommendations and Competencies for Lactation Consultant Practice, IBCLC Code of Ethics and the nurse practice act.

Participates in quality improvement activities in order to continuously improve patient care, health outcomes and unit operations. Functions as a leader in staff meeting.

Develops and updates written patient education material relating to breastfeeding.

Assist in the implementation of the Gundersen Lutheran Breast Feeding Policy. Monitors breastfeeding policies, standards of care and procedures as necessary.

Works to promote breastfeeding in the community.

Maintains and expands knowledge and skills for Lactation Consultant Practice by participating in continuing education programs and professional development activities and by reading current literature.

Patient agent responsibilities:

Creates an environment that assures patient safety.

Promotes healing by creating an environment that conserves patient energy.

Instills confidence in the patients own ability to regain/optimize their own health.

Partners with patient to help them integrate health status changes into their life

SCOPE OF THE JOB

Age Specific Population Served:

Unit/Department Specific

OSHA Category

Category I - All Employees in this job title have a reasonably anticipated risk of occupational exposure to blood and/or other potentially infectious materials.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Learning:

Required

Associate degree in Nursing. Registered nurses without a baccalaureate degree will be required to get a Bachelor's degree in Nursing within six years of hire date.

Consultants must be board certified through the International Board of Lactation Consultant Examiners and have a current nursing license with the State of Wisconsin.

Desired

Bachelor's degree in Nursing

Work Experience:

patient record systems

the business of healthcare

Current American Heart Association (AHA) Healthcare Provider CPR certification; Heart Saver, Rescue and Military training network CPR; or the American Red Cross CPR certification (CPR) except Citizen and Animal classes International Board Certified Lactation Consultant (IBCLC)

title: Lead Consultant – Data & Analytics Solutions
job_description:
Location: Greater Boston or New York Metro Areas

Position Summary:

The Lead Consultant of Data & Analytics Solutions is a project team lead and client-facing position within our organization. The Lead Consultant’s main responsibility is leading the day-to-day delivery and implementation of specified client projects. We are looking for someone who can be hands-on solving the most difficult technical aspects of data and analytics projects while also mentoring less experienced project team members. Strong communication skills are important, and ideal candidates should be comfortable being a main point of contact and consultative partner with our clients. There will also be opportunities to develop potential engagement opportunities by architecting creative streamlined solutions for data and advanced analytics projects while framing and demonstrating CTI solutions for potential client projects during the pre-sales discovery phase. Must be comfortable working individually and leading teams on projects with varying complexity and scope.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:

Lead the data and requirements analysis, design, implementation and planning process. Perform hands-on tasks as required, typically in areas of high complexity. Provide technical architecture guidance to CTI, including contractors and customer project staff.
Be the project focal point with client management and ensure successful delivery with high customer satisfaction
Develop an in-depth understanding of the client’s data, systems, business, and teams/people to frame the end-to-end project technical approach and plan.
Onboard the team and provide oversee all work, directing CTI and client staff as appropriate. Ensure work meets technical, financial, and schedule goals.
Perform hands-on design and implementation in crucial areas of the project.
Execute time/billing processes and customer approval/financial processes.
Develop an in-depth understanding of the client’s data, systems, business, and teams/people to frame the end-to-end project technical approach and plan.
Onboard the team and provide oversee all work, directing CTI and client staff as appropriate. Ensure work meets technical, financial, and schedule goals.
Perform hands-on design and implementation in crucial areas of the project.
Execute time/billing processes and customer approval/financial processes.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

Broad experience in data warehouse and business intelligence tools (BI, ETL, Data Quality and RDBMS tools/platforms)
Excellent understanding of data warehouses / data-marts and dimensional data models
Modern Data Science and Advanced Analytics skills are preferred including but not limited to: Python, R, Hadoop/Big Data, MDM, Machine Learning, AI, NLP
Depth in at least one business domain (supply-chain, CRM, etc.)
Mastery of data and advanced analytics solutions development methodologies and project management
Bachelor or Master’s Degree in: Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, or similar discipline
A minimum of 6 years of experience working with Business Intelligence/Data Analytics
Flexibility to travel locally and within the Northeast as business dictates
Strong communication skills

What We Offer:

25+ years of proven success within the IT systems and consulting industry
Competitive compensation packages that reward high performance
Exciting career growth paths and supportive culture that facilitates continuous learning
Collaborative team-based environment
Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, Flexible Spending, and 401(k) with match
Company paid Life insurance and Long-Term Disability
Generous PTO packages that reflect the importance of work/life balance
Gym Membership Reimbursement

About Us: CTI solves business problems, helping companies leverage data and transformational digital technologies to drive growth and enable innovation. We provide strategic guidance, business and technology solutions for clients wishing to solve their most complex challenges involving data analytics, cloud applications, big data, data discovery, and data protection. Simply put, your data is our passion.

title: Sr. Compensation Consultant - Wells Fargo Home Lending
job_description:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as Personal Cell or Cellular in the contact information of your application.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Human Resources develops and implements our team members, candidates, and operational strategies to support Wells Fargos business objectives. This group manages compensation and benefits, human resource service centers, systems and payroll, team member relations and assistance, talent management, learning and development, and recruiting. We work together as One HR to make Wells Fargo an employer of choice. Our foundational success is based on the ability to operate efficiently, attract, retain, develop HR team members, strengthen controls, and scale technology infrastructure.

We are seeking a highly motivated Compensation Sr. Consultant to join our Wells Fargo Home Lending Compensation Team. The Home Lending Production team supports team members through consultation, compensation design, program management, and effective risk governance. The Compensation Sr. Consultant will provide expert strategic and tactical consultation on total direct compensation in support of company and business needs.

Wells Fargo Home Lending (WFHL) is the leading mortgage lender in the United States with over 8,000 retail salespeople, 1,000 centralized salespeople, number one in lending volume, the number one mortgage servicer, 600+ retail locations and four centralized sales and processing centers. WFHL provides consultation to customers on traditional mortgage products and services as well as customized solutions for new home construction, renovation, condominium, jumbo mortgages, private banking customer lending services and low to moderate income and minority lending.

This position will be responsible for the following:

Developing, implementing, and monitoring compensation programs Project planning & management of compensation related projects Partnering with HR, Business Leaders and other partners as an internal consultant to strategize, develop and implement compensation programs that align with business needs and priorities Providing support for and managing the annual merit/focal review process Exercising independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criterion for obtaining result Participating in or conducting salary surveys, analyzing internal and external compensation data utilizing quantitative, financial and statistical tools, pricing jobs, recommendations on new or revised job classifications and managing special projects Reviewing existing and proposed statutory compensation requirements and recommending appropriate course of action Developing ad hoc reports to analyze specific compensation-related issues such as turnover and developing recommended course of action Leading and participating in other change management initiatives, projects, or comp processes as needed

Location: The preferred location(s) for this job opening are as listed in the job posting (Charlotte, NC, Minneapolis, MN, St. Louis, MO or Des Moines, IA). However, other Wells Fargo locations within the US Domestic footprint may be considered for this opportunity.Required Qualifications

4+ years of consulting experience in compensation, human resources, accounting, or finance

Desired Qualifications

4+ years of compensation design and consulting experienceExperience with variable and incentive compensationKnowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance requirements surrounding incentive compensation and risk managementCertified Compensation Professional (CCP)Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to manage complex projects in a large enterprise environmentStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyAbility to work and influence successfully within a matrix environment and build effective business partnerships with all levels of team members

Other Desired Qualifications

Experience with designing compensation programs with incentive components for sales or commission based positions Compensation experience with mortgage, lending, underwriting, financial advisors, insurance or equivalent type industries

title: Leasing Consultant - Marquis at the Parkway
job_description:
What’s Your Purpose?Connect | Engage | ServeWhat You Will Do

The Solution Consultant acts as the solution expert for the sales organization by assisting with delivering outcome-based messaging to customers at executive and management levels. The Solution Consultant has a broad understanding of all related products and delivery offerings from RA, partners and competitors in the designated solution area.

There are multiple positions available in the focus area of Machine Design, Safety & Safety Systems, and Mechatronics. Demonstrated Technical, Industry, or Application experience in one or more of these the areas (machine design, functional safety, robotics or mechatronics) is desired.

Key Responsibilities


Be the focal point in the defined geography for the specific solution(s), of which he/she has been designated as an expert. Participate in account planning and sales strategy focusing on new customer acquisition and existing customer expansion. Proactively facilitate and/or provide training to the sales force on the values and outcomes of specific solution(s). Co-operate with the sales force in promoting the solution to existing and new customers with presentations and/or demonstrations. Advise Technology Consultants and/or sales resources on proposal generation and validation. Assist sales at proposal presentations for executive level customers Define and articulate differentiators and values versus competition for the specific solution. Analyze competitive product lines, have knowledge of competitor’s strategy, further define competitive differentiators. Translate competitive solutions into a RA solution that meets or exceeds customer’s expectations. Actively seek out and participate in both formal and informal training opportunities to continuously develop technical skills. Provide product gap and development feedback for specific solutions to the appropriate organizations. Share insights with regional and global peers. Focus on opportunities that support Rockwell Automation’s strategy. EOE, M/F/Disable, Vet

#LI-MB2

#sponsored

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in an engineering/technical related field or equivalent experience.Legal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.


Preferred Qualifications


5+ years directly related experience Able to articulate value of the larger Rockwell Automation application solution, without the need to demonstrate individual products with hands-on demonstrations Strong solution and application expertise, and related demonstrated sales experience. Fluency in native language and strong command of English (written & spoken). Ability to work with and gain confidence of senior level personnel (internal and external) in a highly collaborative, matrixed stakeholder organization. Ability to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. Ability to align and influence critical stakeholders. Strong support of customer centricity. Understands the importance of demonstrating concern for satisfying customers. Passionate about developing goals to improve our customer experience. Ability to set, be accountable for and achieve challenging sales targets. Ability to influence, empower, coach and motivate others. Ability to adapt communication style and messaging to different audiences.

This is a summary of the position’s responsibilities and does not reflect the entire scope of work expectations.
Country(s)

United States

Rockwell Automation is an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.

If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7427.

Company Overview

Over centuries, the world has evolved and advanced. New innovations change how we work. How we live. How things get made.

The next industrial evolution is here — a new test of intelligence for humans and machines. Where breakthroughs are hard–won and success requires sifting through overwhelming data for insights, clarity and confidence.

Rather than fearing change, we embrace its possibilities. We know how to connect the imaginations of people with the potential of machines to make the world work better. More intelligent. More connected. More productive.

We stand with the problem solvers, the builders, the makers, the innovators because we belong to that community. And we stand ready to lead the way. At Rockwell Automation, we are expanding human possibility.

title: Digital Forensics Incident Response Consultant (New York City, NY)
job_description:
The Crypsis Group is searching for a Digital Forensics Incident Reponse (DFIR) Consultant to help support our New York City, NY office. The DFIR Consultant will help us support our clients in the event of a cyber security breach and will have to be proficient in both Digital Forensics and Incident Response.

Incident Response Consultant (Reactive)

Company background

The Crypsis Group is a respected security advisory firm with a vision to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is comprised of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics, and information security. With a highly successful track record of delivering mission-critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide an effective incident response, attack-readiness and remediation plans with a focus on providing long term support to improve our clients security posture.

Responsibilities for the Incident Response Security Consultant include:

• Perform reactive incident response functions including but not limited to host-based analysis functions through investigating Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X systems to identify Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).

• Examine firewall, web, database, and other log sources to identify evidence and artifacts of malicious and compromised activity.

• Investigate data breaches leveraging forensics tools including Encase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, and custom Crypsis investigation tools to determine the source of compromises and malicious activity that occurred in client environments.

• Provide support on incident response engagements to senior level team members to guide clients through forensic investigations, contain security incidents, and provide guidance on longer-term remediation recommendations.

• Ability to perform light travel requirements as needed to meet business demands (on average 20%).

Qualifications for the Incident Response Security Consultant include:

• 2+ years of incident response or digital forensics experience with a passion for cybersecurity

• Proficient with host-based forensics and data breach response

• Experienced with EnCase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, Redline, Volatility, Wireshark, TCPDump, and open source forensic tools

• Bachelors Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security or related field

Compensation for the Incident Response Security Consultant includes:

• Competitive salary plus quarterly bonus opportunity

• Approved certification and training reimbursements

• Open Paid Time Off

• Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits

• 401k Employer Matching

• Flexible work schedule

title: Sr Consulting Engineer - Cables
job_description:
About the Position:

Juniper Networks has an immediate opening for a collaborative, highly effective, and self-motivated individual to support the Sales Engineering in Service Provider segment. Sales Engineers (SE’s) are a critical component of the Juniper GTM Team and have a primary responsibility to partner with the sales organization on driving technical sales activities for both new and existing opportunities. SE’s possess in-depth, hands-on expertise with Juniper's products, solutions, and services as well as those of our competitors and can demonstrate the same to our customers and business partners.

The specific role is for Senior Consulting Engineer for Cable MSOs on America’s Service Provider architecture team and will be looked upon as an inspiring leader and a multi-domain specialist within the areas of distributed access architecture, SDN, Routing, Switching and Security solutions. The successful candidate will operate in an architect capacity for the sales engineering organization and will be responsible for the overall architecture and solutions being positioned to all the Cable MSOs in North America. The candidate will work closely with Juniper Product, Engineering, and strategy teams to make sure Juniper’s product roadmap is aligned to industry trends and customer’s evolving needs in emerging technologies. The candidate will also work closely with other SE architects in Americas and Global SP space and identify repeatable opportunities.

Location: Philadelphia, PA or New Jersey area

Minimum Qualifications:

A successful candidate will meet all of these requirements:

1. Experience working in a pre-sales role selling networking equipment OR end-user experience in design/architecture/vendor selection

Ability to communicate, both oral and written, on complex technical and sales issues to a variety of audiences, including executive-level technical decision-makers Ability to make and communicate relevant connections between proposed technical solutions and customers' business requirements. Strong understanding and knowledge of how to build successful relationships between an equipment manufacturer and a channel partner or reseller

2. 15+ years relevant proven experience in mobility, wireline, and SDN domains. Candidate should have experience in multiple of the following technical domains

Expertise in Distributed Access Architecture, Converged Interconnect Network, DOCSIS evolution Virtualization technologies on x86 and scaling using technologies such DPDK, SR-IOV, SmartNICs etc. Containers and Container related technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes and Container networking (Flannel, Calico, Canal, Weave etc.) Expert level and hands-on knowledge of SDN environments including Overlay protocols such as MP-BGP, EVPN and tunneling technologies such as VXLAN, MPLSoGRE, MPLSoUDP Data Center networking with deep understanding of large underlay Leaf and Spine based CLOS networks. Routing expertise in access, metro and core back-bone design, including hands-on knowledge on BGP, IGP, Multicast and MPLS technologies (SR, LDP, RSVP-TE etc.) Design and operate large scale MPLS enabled services such as Multicast-VPN, L3VPN, L2VPN, EVPN. Up to date knowledge on emerging protocols and technologies shaping up in standard bodies (SRv6, SRm6 Network slicing architecture etc.) Expert level and hands-on knowledge of software-hardware disaggregation and industry initiatives such as SONiC, SAI, P4 etc. Experience in designing managed services solutions to the enterprise including SD-WAN, AI based operations, WiFI solutions, Campus/branch routing and switching solutions etc. Experience in network automation including solutions for work flow automation, service provisioning, telemetry and close-loop automation solutions Experience in crafting high-performance security solutions for network infrastructure, cloud and mobility. Should have crafted sophisticated firewalls, private/public cloud virtual firewalls, threat prevention and aggregation, policy enforcements, SIEM solutions for service provider customers.

3. In-depth understanding of product features, use cases, positioning, and configuration in many of the following products or product categories:

Juniper Contrail Cloud, Contrail Edge Cloud, Contrail Enterprise Multicloud, Contrail Networking, Contrail Security Contrail Service Orchestration, Contrail Healthbot Data center automation: Contrail Fabric Manager, Cloudvision, ACI etc. Opensource activities like ONOS, ODL, ONAP etc. Linux operating system knowledge including KVM SDN overlay technologies including Nuage, or NSX Network Monitoring on Junos, Netconf/Rest APIs, YANG OSS/BSS/IT integration DevOPs capabilities, SLAX/Junos Automation, Perl,Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Cobbler Juniper QFX/EX switches, Cisco Nexus switches, or Arista switches Juniper MX Series routers, PTX Series Routers, Cisco ASR9000, CRS Juniper ACX Series routers for metro Juniper SRX series products, ATP, SecIntel, Contrail Security etc. Public cloud platform and services (AWS, Azure, GCP) Open Networking switch hardware (white box) and related software (Cumulus, BigSwitch, Pica8) Knowledge of merchant silicon technologies (Trident, Tomahawk, Jericho, etc.)

4. JNCIE, CCIE, RHCE, CKA/CKD or other expert-level industry certification is desired

5. Formal or informal technical sales leadership or mentoring is desired

Other Information:

Travel requirements for the position - 50%. This position will travel based on customer demand for sales activities

Juniper Networks is enrolled in E-Verify® and will be participating in E-Verify in addition to our Form I-9 process. www.dhs.gov/E-Verify

Juniper Networks is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: HCM PreSales, Solution Consultant
job_description:
Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Through interactive pre-sales discovery meetings, and by leveraging your deep Human Capital Management (HCM) and complex Enterprise Software product knowledge, Workday presales consultants provide discovery, core human capital expertise, Executive presentations, and Workday HCM product demonstrations, in partnership with our sales teams, to customers throughout the sales cycle.

7 or more years of experience including expertise in interactive discovery meetings, analysis of current operations and business needs; and development and presentation of cutting edge, cloud-based HCM solutions for Enterprise Customers.Depth of experience across full suite HCM, including expert knowledge of Enterprise (ERP) systems specifically Payroll and Time Tracking, as well as HR, Compensation, Benefits, and HR Finance. Pre-sales / Sales Consulting, deep practitioner and/or implementation with influencing skills with HCM enterprise business solutionsUnrivaled professional discovery, presentation, communication, and influencing skills to C-Level Executives, interfacing with and selling to the office of the CHRO and CFO specifically.Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently.Ability to travel ~40%.

title: Splunk Service Consultant
job_description:
Company SummaryFounded in 2004, NetBrain is the leader in transforming network operations thought automation. Its ground-breaking automation platform leverages the power of dynamic maps to provide CIOs and network teams with end-to-end network visibility while enabling adaptive automation across the organization’s physical, virtual and software-defined networks. Today, over 2,300 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.

“NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.” - Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrainOverviewWhat We Need

NetBrain is looking for Splunk SMEs who are interested in making extra money working as a part time consultant. The consultants we are looking for are Subject Matter Experts on deploying, operating and managing Splunk. These consultants will create sample labs with best practice deployments and configurations. We are focused on finding SMEs on Splunk and are open to Consultants located across the world.

The Impact You’ll Make

In this role, you will work with a worldwide workforce of passionate technologists who help our largest enterprise and service provider customers to drive their network automation capability.ResponsibilitiesWhat we are looking for

Top 10 real world use cases for Enterprise to use Splunk in the following fields: (50 is too much and it would be great if we can get 10 done at first)

Network Management
Security
IT Operation

For each use case, create a detail document to describe why it is import and how it is implemented with the sample input and output.

What You’ll Do

Here are some sample tasks you will need to do:


You will create sample labs of a specific technology with sample best practice deployments and configurations.
You will produce documentation on what a helpful map of the technology looks like including but not limited to L2/L3 topology, service flows, overlay/underlay visualization etc.
You will create sample configurations of both key CLI commands and API outputs
You will create sample operational and troubleshooting best practices

QualificationsWho You Are

3+ years professional experiences on network management, security or other IT operations.
Hands-on experience on administrator/management, design, architecture and development of Splunk system.
Expert on providing and documenting Splunk solution on IT operation.

Please submit a cover letter to indicate which technology you have expertise and briefly explain your experience with the technology.

title: Financial Consultant
job_description:
Overview:

UNIFY Financial Credit Union is one of the nations largest 100 credit unions with a reputation for being financially sound and growth-oriented. Were expanding rapidly to meet the needs of a growing member base. At UNIFY, our team members work together to strive toward a common goal, providing superior service to our members. In doing so, we promote a culture where your ideas matter, your growth matters, and you matter. We encourage all team members to challenge and encourage themselves and their teammates to work smarter and to be more successful

Summary:

Serves as a Financial Advisor to the customer, by collecting and analyzing information regarding the customer's current income, assets, investments or debts; determining which financial products best meet the customer's needs and financial circumstances; advising the customer regarding the advantages and disadvantages of different financial products; and marketing, servicing or promoting the applicable financial products and services for a fee or commission, as applicable, to meet the customers needs.

Responsibilities:

Identifies potential clients/customers using advertising campaigns, mailing lists, personal contacts, referrals, in-branch promotions, and seminars.
Interviews clients/customers to determine financial position, resources, assets available to invest, and financial goals.
Counsels clients on purchase or sale of securities, financial services, investment, and insurance plans.
Maintains strict adherence to regulatory rules of conduct and the highest ethical standards.
Understands, and stays current of, broker dealer operations and record keeping requirements.
Completes all required licensing and continuing education requirements.
Analyzes status reports and perform calculations to monitor client accounts and verify transactions.
Provides and/or refers quality, value-added financial products and services to our membership.
Refers clients/members to appropriate Credit Union personnel for other Credit Union products and services such as credit cards, auto loans, Term Share Certificates, etc.
Attends branch staff meetings.
Trains Credit Union staff on how to identify and refer prospects.
Maintains office hours consistent with branch hours and within regulatory guidelines.
Ensures that minimum established production standards are met.
Ensures full compliance with UNIFY Financial Credit Union Service Standards, the Bank Secrecy Act, and all applicable Regulations.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Requires a high school diploma or equivalent with a current Series 7 and 63 Securities Registration, a current Series 65 or equivalent Advisory license, and a current State Life and Health Insurance License.
Requires a minimum five years financial consultant or equivalent experience.
A current valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and preferred driving record are required.
Also requires effective communication skills, both written and verbal; and proficiency in word processing and spreadsheet software applications.

See the UNIFY Difference!

At UNIFY, we believe that each team member is a valued contributor. Through a teamwork approach, we strive to provide a positive and rewarding workplace that helps our team succeed. UNIFY provides a work environment which promotes learning, growth, and the opportunity for team members to challenge themselves.

Competitive Compensation and Excellent Benefits Package* Includes:

Medical (PPO/HMO), Prescription, Dental (PPO/DMO), Vision, Life, and Short- and Long-Term Disability Insurance

Dependent and Medical Care - Flexible Spending Accounts

Vacation, Sick, Personal and Holiday Pay

401(K) Plan with employer match

Education reimbursement for approved programs

UNIFY banking privileges for you and your family



All programs subject to review and change

UNIFY is proud to be a drug-free, equal-opportunity employer including disability/vets. For more information on UNIFY, visit us at www.unifyfcu.com

title: Consultant to Senior Consultant with Alternative Investments Operations Experience
job_description:
Company DescriptionSia Partners is a next generation consulting firm focused on delivering superior value and tangible results to its clients as they navigate the digital revolution. With over 1,650 consultants in 16 countries, we will generate an annual turnover of USD 300 million for the current fiscal year. Our global footprint and our expertise in more than 30 sectors and services allow us to enhance our clients' businesses worldwide. We guide their projects and initiatives in strategy, business transformation, IT & digital strategy, and Data Science. As the pioneer of Consulting 4.0, we develop consulting bots and integrate AI in our solutions.Job DescriptionSuccessful candidates will have 2+ years of experience in Alternative Investments Operations experience. This role is based out of our Baltimore office.

This individual will be responsible for: overseeing the client subscription and capital call process for various alternative investments including commercial real estate funds, middle market lending funds, private equity funds, venture capital funds, hedge funds, structured settlements, and private ad hoc deals/co-investments.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Wealth & Asset Management Practice, you will:

Deliver on a range of client assignments, usually as part of an on-site project team (some travel may be required) Assist in developing thought leadership and building solutions and methods Develop strong trusted advisor relationships with our clients Identify opportunities for new business and support bid teams with proposals Contribute to the development of high-quality technical offerings Support the Sia practice and our people development

Skills & Attributes for Success

A high level of drive and commitment to deliver high quality work under pressure to meet tight deadlines Act as a supportive team player who actively develops relationships and is eager to share knowledge with colleagues and our clients Experience with a structured approach to problem solving The ability to learn new subject matter rapidly and a desire to develop a deep understanding of the trends and challenges shaping Wealth & Asset Management Flexibility in approach with a willingness to adapt quickly and take initiative when working in unstructured environments with limited supervision

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of Management Consulting experience in Alternative Investment Operations.Previous experience with: overseeing the client subscription and capital call process for various alternative investments including commercial real estate funds, middle market lending funds, private equity funds, venture capital funds, hedge funds, structured settlements, and private ad hoc deals/co-investments.


Additional InformationThis is an opportunity to join a fast-growing team in Baltimore that serves some of the most exciting and highly respected companies in the world. You will have the opportunity to provide clients with original thinking,cutting-edge solutions and you’ll have the satisfaction of seeing the impact of your work on their business. We are committed to a healthy work-life balance. We serve our clients globally and if interested, there are opportunities for international mobility.

Benefits

PTO / Sick Days / Holidays, including paid family leave Healthcare that includes dental and vision, life insurance, and 401K matching Robust learning and development platform Participation in our North America Annual seminar Work directly with clients and colleagues who are subject matter experts in their areas

Still Interested? Tell us about your....

Standout academics Consulting experience Data supported success stories Growth from failure Innovation and initiative Tools and training Cross-functional experience  Pursuits outside work Goals, dreams, aspirations

We are an equal opportunity employer that cherishes our collective diversity.

title: IT Consultant (m/w/d) Cloud/Infrastructure (Leipzig)
job_description:

Die WBS IT-Service GmbH ist einer der führenden herstellerübergreifenden Serviceprovider Mitteldeutschlands. title: Business Support Consultant 1
job_description:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as Personal Cell or Cellular in the contact information of your application.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wealth and Investment Management (WIM) businesses build enduring client relationships through sound, thoughtful and objective advice. We help our clients by developing individualized plans for everything from retirement goals to business succession planning, to family legacy intentions. Services include comprehensive planning and advice, investment management, brokerage, private banking, estate planning strategies, trust, and both individual and institutional retirement.

Wells Fargo Investment Institute (WFII) is a business unit within WIM and consists of specialized investment teams combining some of the best talent and thinking in the industry under one umbrella. Our strategists and analysts offer unique insights into the capital markets and lead our efforts to provide financial professionals with the resources and information to serve their clients. WFIIs team of experienced strategists and analysts has an overriding mission: delivering timely, actionable investment expertise and advice financial professionals can use to help their clients pursue their financial goals.

Global Alternative Investments (GAI) is a division of WFII that administers and/or manages proprietary and non-proprietary alternative investment products and services including; option strategies, hedge funds, managed futures, commodities, private equity, private debt and private real estate offerings.

The primary responsibilities of the GAI Business Support Consultant 1 are to facilitate and manage the on-boarding process for new alternative investment (AI) products supported by the business, manage and coordinate receipt of ongoing reports and data from supported programs, and oversight of corresponding vendor engagements utilized to deliver alternative investment capabilities to Wells Fargo.

Additional duties include:

Facilitate and manage AI on-boarding for each firm supported product Manage firm-supported AI reporting Coordination with other business units (legal, risk, compliance, sales, operations) to address business support matters Liaise with distribution channel partners to accurately report alternative investments Assist with special projects related to business support initiatives Assist with onboarding and implementation of Funds and new products Manage a small team of Business Support Associates

As a Team Member Manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Specifically you will:

Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them. Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks.

Required Qualifications

3+ year of experience in one or a combination of the following: administrative support, project management, implementation, business operations or strategic planning demonstrated through work or military experience

Desired Qualifications

A BS/BA degree or higherAdvanced Microsoft Excel skillsKnowledge and understanding of financial industry alternative investment operationsKnowledge and understanding of database management, reporting, and analysis functionsAbility to manage a teamVendor management experience

Other Desired Qualifications

Experience in risk management, quality control checks. Experience with alternative investment (e.g., hedge fund, private equity and/or private real estate) administrative support Experience with data management Experience in onboarding new products

Street AddressNC-Charlotte: 401 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NCDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

title: ERP Public Sector (State & Local Govt) - HR Consultant - Contract
job_description:
ISG is seeking a senior ERP consulting professional with broad public sector (State and Local government) functional expertise in the following Human Resource/Payroll areas:

• Recruitment/Applicant Tracking

• Compensation/Classification

• Benefits/Insurance

• Payroll

• Personnel Administration

• Position Control

• Time Reporting and Leave Accounting

• Training

During the selection phase, the consultant will perform the following functions: documenting business processes, gathering requirements, developing the procurement document (RFP, RFQ, etc.), facilitating vendor evaluation, and negotiating the software and implementation vendor contract.

During the implementation phase, the consultant is responsible for providing oversight services. The consultant must work with the client lead, and implementation vendor lead. The primary responsibility is to provide oversight for planning, design, development, testing and implementation activities. The consultant will supply regular progress reports to the PMO.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

• Multi-module ERP experience (e.g., personnel administration, payroll administration, time reporting and employee leave accounting, applicant services)

• Public sector experience (State & Local government)

• Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders

• Possesses strong organizational and task management skills

• Possesses good analytical skills

• Exhibits effective team skills

• Ability to make decisions at the project team level and properly escalate those decisions that cannot be resolved on a timely basis

• 7-15 years recent experience with managing complex IT projects.

Education:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field desirable

• MBA or other advanced degree(s) desirable

• PMP desirable

Travel:

• 90% Travel

Computer Literacy:

• Demonstrates working knowledge with MS-Office suite of software applications and tools, including: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project, MS-Outlook

Duties & Responsibilities:

SELECTION DUTIES:

• Document business requirements and processes

• Write request for proposal document

• Write vendor demonstration scripts

• Facilitate vendor evaluation

• Negotiate contract

IMPLEMENTATION DUTIES:

• Overseeing project delivery from an agency and entity-wide perspective

• Monitoring that the project is effectively resourced and manages relationships with a wide range of groups

• Coordinating the development and maintenance of project documentation

• Checking that all required project management documents are developed, completed and signed off at the appropriate review gate

• Ensuring that all written deliverables provided by the Integration Services Vendor Project Manager are stored in the appropriate network folders and archived as necessary

• Drafting, reviewing and recommending approval of deliverables

• Holding Integration Services Vendor accountable through oversight and reporting for completing the Implementation Project on time, within scope, within budget and according to the required quality standard (with agreed specifications)

• Helping to resolve issues, risks and conflicts

• Managing project change request process and facilitates the approval process for requests submitted by the Integration Services Vendor Project Manager

• Monitoring potential implementation project risks, opportunities, and issues that may impact the project

• Facilitating resolution of issues with input from the client project managers

• Escalating unresolved issues to the PMO in accordance with policies, as appropriate

• Reporting project progress, budget and status to the appropriate levels (e.g., Executive Sponsor, Executive Council, Steering Committee) and recommending corrective action when necessary

• Reviewing the detailed Project Plan and supporting tracking schedules on an ongoing basis and documenting noted issues and concerns with project progress in accordance with the Project Plan. It is assumed that the client and/or the implementation services vendor will have data entry, reconciliation, and report generation responsibilities for the Project Plan and associated tracking schedules.

• Responsible for the independent management oversight of the ERP Project

title: BCBA Behavior Analyst/Behavior Consultant! Bonus and Incentive Plan!
job_description:

If you want to make a difference in the life of a child while maximizing your potential as a behavioral health professional please consider joining Continuum! Interested candidates must have a current certification as a Board Certified Behavior Analyst, a state license if applicable, a positive, can-do attitude and a desire to excel in their chosen field. Is this you? Please contact us today!

title: Behavioral Specialist Consultant - Berwick
job_description:
At Salisbury Behavioral Health, empowering individuals with behavioral health issues is key to promoting recovery with independence and dignity. Our goal is to work in partnership with individuals to empower them to make choices, attain life goals, build relationships, and participate within their community in the most integrated and independent manner possible. We focus on an individual’s strengths and values while providing person-centered services that are culturally competent, flexible, coordinated and accountable. While the recovery process is unique to everyone, we treat our clients with respect, dignity, courtesy and equality. For individuals facing serious and complex challenges, Salisbury Behavioral Health provides the supports individuals and their families need to reach success.

The Behavioral Specialist Consultant (BSC) is a lead member of a multi-disciplinary team responsible for the implementation of therapeutic skills acquisition and behavioral modification protocols. The BSC is responsible for the development of an individualized treatment plan and monitoring progress for assigned clients in partnership with family members, Mobile Therapists and Therapeutic Staff Support (TSS). The BSC provides clinical supervision to TSS. This position is required to work hours that coincide with client schedules, including day, evening and/or weekend hours.

The Behavioral Specialist Consultant is primarily responsible for:

- Developing individualized treatment plans based upon assessments and input from others involved with the child.

- Schedule and conduct consultations with the child and/or family using the treatment plan as a guide.

- Revise treatment plan based on assessment of treatment protocols, observation and other related data collected.

- Provide clinical group supervision to Therapeutic Staff Support as scheduled on a weekly basis.

Requirements

- BSL (Behavior Specialist License) or BSL eligible

OR Licensed Psychologist

OR Licensed Mental Health Professional with experience and trainig with ASD and behavior modification

OR

- other Master's level mental health clinician with documented training in the field of behavioral modification techniques who is BSL eligible

- Previous experience working with children and families in the implementation of therapeutic skills acquisition and behavior change protocols.

Benefits

Eligible Salisbury Behavioral Health Employees will receive:

Competitive pay/benefits Med/Dental/RX Reduced health care benefits with participation in Wellness Program Tuition Credit Program for eligible dependents Comprehensive Training Employee Discount Program (Access Perks) Employee Rewards Program (which allows you earn points to purchase items) 401K options after one year with company contribution and accrued time off

title: Business Development Consultant
job_description:
The Business Development Consultant sells Equity Institutional (EI) custodial services through three channels: broker dealers, registered investment advisors, and product sponsors who offer alternative investments and cross-sell other offerings of Equity Trust Company (ETC) in addition to custodial services.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

• Executes an existing sales plan utilizing a consultative sales approach with all leads within the three channels, utilizing the services of ETC

• Collaborates with the Marketing department to develop new lead opportunities

• Establishes and maintains lasting relationships with both prospective and existing clients

• Works with Relationship Managers to successfully onboard new clients

• Develops thorough understanding of the various audiences EI supports (sponsors, RIAs, Broker-Dealers, metals dealers, etc.)

• Develops thorough understanding of the most frequently invested-in asset types for institutional clients (REITs, private equity, private debt) and is able to discuss the asset review process for each with the financial professional (what is required for review, timeframe, etc.)

• Develops through understanding of the various EI account types (basic, flex ADR, flex retail, Key Accounts, metals, etc.) and is able to identify and discuss the appropriate fee schedule with the financial professional

• Fields inbound calls received through either the business development queue or the Client Advocate Specialist

• Conducts needs assessments with the advisor, sponsor, COI, or other financial professional to determine size/scope of opportunity

• Proceeds with guiding the financial professional through the process of asset review and account open documentation for all new opportunities (<5>

• Serves as the direct point of contact for receiving all new account documentation and ensures documentation is forwarded on to appropriate operational group as necessary

• Monitors account open and business development voicemail

OTHER FUNCTIONS:

• Attends industry trade shows in both the capacity as an attendee and at times an exhibitor representing Equity Trust Company

• Documents information regarding sales calls into a client relationship management system (CRM)

• Assists in refining of sales and marketing plan dictated by industry evolution

• Performs other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

• Associates Degree

• Minimum 3 years of experience selling directly to institutional clients, custody sales, or selling in the financial industry

• Knowledge and understanding of the financial industry including advisors, financial planning, and mutual funds

• Proven track record of consistent sales and closing success

PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION(S):

• None required

TECHNICAL SKILLS:

• Intermediate level proficiency in Microsoft Office

• Basic knowledge of the operation of CRM systems

title: Network Engineer Consultant SME - NSX-T
job_description:
Company SummaryFounded in 2004, NetBrain is the leader in transforming network operations thought automation. Its ground-breaking automation platform leverages the power of dynamic maps to provide CIOs and network teams with end-to-end network visibility while enabling adaptive automation across the organization’s physical, virtual and software-defined networks. Today, over 2,300 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.

“NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.” - Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrainOverviewWhat We Need

NetBrain is looking for Network Engineers who are interested in making extra money working as a part time consultant. The consultants we are looking for are Subject Matter Experts on deploying, operating and managing NSX-T. These consultants will create sample labs with best practice deployments and configurations. We are focused on finding SMEs on NSX-T and are open to Consultants located across the world.

The Impact You’ll Make

In this role, you will work with a worldwide workforce of passionate technologists who help our largest enterprise and service provider customers to drive their network automation capability.ResponsibilitiesWhat We Are Looking For
Sample labs of NSX-T solution with sample best practice deployments and configurations including but not limited to:

Edge Bridge
PNICs
HA
VRF Lite
NAT
DFW on SDDC
L2VPN
IPSec VPN
NSX Cloud

What You’ll Do

Here are some sample tasks you will need to do:


You will create sample labs of a specific technology with sample best practice deployments and configurations.
You will produce documentation on what a helpful map of the technology looks like including but not limited to L2/L3 topology, service flows, overlay/underlay visualization etc.
You will create sample configurations of both key CLI commands and API outputs
You will create sample operational and troubleshooting best practices

QualificationsWho You Are

You are an expert in architecting, designing and operating NSX-T
You have hands on experience working with, configuring and troubleshooting NSX-T
You are experienced in documenting the technology architecture for operations handover


Please submit a cover letter to indicate which technology you have expertise and briefly explain your experience with the technology.

title: Licensed Educational Consultant - Specialized Instruction Services
job_description:
As part of our mission to pave the way for children's success worldwide, Therapy Source is currently seeking a full-time Licensed Educational Consultant to provide services for public school students for the upcoming 2020/2021 school year. Expertise in specialized instruction is required, along with an Ohio Administrative license.

Licensed Educational Consultant Qualification(s):

Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree preferred Ohio Administrative license Teaching Certification in Ohio Possession of (or willingness to obtain) up-to-date clearances Proof of individual professional liability insurance (or willingness to obtain)

Licensed Educational Consultant Responsibilities May Include:

Implementing specially designed instruction to drive student achievement Conducting progress monitoring data and adjusting instruction based on the data Establishing a positive, structured, achievement-focused classroom Providing support to students, parents, and general education staff and supporting student learning Mentoring and coaching students on self-regulation and organizational skills Developing effective IEPs that translate into measurable results for students Participating in multidisciplinary meetings

Enjoy scheduling flexibility, impressive hourly rates, and amazing support from our dedicated account team!

Along with your resume, please be sure to include the best time of day and phone number to reach you. We will then reach out to discuss your qualifications, and answer any questions you may have about the position.

MF

title: Salesforce Pre-Sales Solution Consultant
job_description:
Join PolSource, one of the fastest growing global Salesforce Platinum Partners, with a reputation for industry innovation and delivering success. Known as the "global boutique" Systems Integrator, we focus 100% on the Salesforce platform, helping customers with digital transformation through advisory, implementation, and managed services.
About the Role:
The Pre-Sales Sultion Consultant is responsible for presenting product offerings and architecture in the best light to prospects and customers, to evoke confidence in PolSource’s technology infrastructure, and to remove all technical objections in the sales cycle. To accomplish this, the Pre-Sales Solution Consultant must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and/or sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value.
Responsibilities:

Understand the customer's needs, and establish PolSource as the best solution that solves the customer's challenges
Outline the customer’s needs and build the appropriate scope and LOE for the desired solution
Build and present customized demos of Salesforce products
Convey deep understanding of the customer's technology as it pertains to Salesforce's solutions
Participate in all appropriate product, sales, and procedural trainings and certifications to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position
Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by management
Respond effectively to RFPs

Education and Experience:

B.S. Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent work experience
Knowledge of related applications, relational database and web technology
Solid oral, written, presentation, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in varied political environments
Previous experience as a solution/sales engineer for a CRM company or similar technology
Basic programming experience in HTML and other web based technologies preferred
Salesforce Certifications preferred
Ability to travel
Must be authorized to work for any employer in the US

PolSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer
