title: Sustainability Consultant, Residential Buildings
job_description:
Sustainability Consultant, Residential Buildings

 Job DetailsLevel ExperiencedJob Location Norwalk, CT - Norwalk, CTPosition Type Full-timeEducation Level Bachelors DegreeTravel Percentage Estimated 25-50%Job Shift Full-time employeeThe Position and Team Steven Winter Associates, Inc. (SWA) is seeking an experienced professional to support green and high-performance Residential building design, construction and operations to join our Norwalk, CT office. The professional will perform ratings under green building certification programs including the Home Energy Rating System (HERS), ENERGY STAR, LEED, Enterprise Green Communities, National Green Building Standard, and the International Green Construction Code as well as local incentive programs. The position also entails analysis, reporting, and field verification to support net-zero-energy and low-carbon building science research initiatives for high performance housing. This position will have the opportunity to collaborate with industry experts and clients to deliver innovative solutions for sustainable residential buildings.

Our office offers limitless learning opportunities and exposure to a wide range of project types including lowrise and highrise multifamily, custom single family homes, new construction and retrofit projects, and both affordable and luxury housing. This position will work with project teams from design through construction stages to implement green building objectives and to meet a variety of existing and emerging green and energy program requirements.

This position reports to a Senior Consultant.

Primary Responsibilities:

Under the direction of a Senior Consultant


Manage multiple projects at once including scheduling, tracking milestones and reviewing compliance with green building criteria.
Articulate building science principles, sustainability best practices and green building program requirements to project teams.
Undertake plan and specification reviews to confirm sustainability measures and program compliance.
Perform takeoffs from construction drawings to accurately determine building geometry.
Perform energy modeling and analysis.
Review construction submittals for alignment with plans, specifications, sustainability best practices and program criteria.
Complete site inspections and diagnostic testing to confirm green program requirements.
Complete and submit project documentation to support green building certification.
Comply with SWA policies for quality assurance related to green building programs.
Educate project teams in high performance construction, healthy building, and building science principles.
Communicate effectively and promptly with colleagues, clients, and project teams via email and telephone.
Meet deadlines and maintain project schedules and budgets.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Below is a list of the minimum requirements for the position.

Required industry knowledge, and skills

Minimum 2 years of work experience with residential and multifamily construction and mechanical/electrical/plumbing systems.
Proven interest in and demonstrates an understanding of green building strategies.
Strong technical background with a solid working knowledge of residential and multifamily building systems.
Fluency reading and reviewing construction drawings and specifications.
Experience with onsite construction.

Required Technical Skills/Certifications

Bachelors degree in a built environment design or planning field i.e. architecture, construction management or building-related engineering disciplines.
Prefer previous experience as a HERS Rater, LEED for Homes Green Rater, and/or NGBS Green Verifier preferred.
Valid driving license with clean driving record.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs (in order of importance Excel, Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint).

Personal qualities

Excellent communicator and ability to explain complex concepts to a variety of stakeholders.
Attention to detail with strong oral and written communication skills.
Well-developed interpersonal skills, maturity, credibility, confidence and integrity.
Collaborative with strong focus on teamwork.

Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. The employee frequently is required to walk; use hands to type, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand.

When in the field the employee must frequently lift or move objects up to 40 pounds and carry 50 yards; must be able to climb stairs and endure typical construction site conditions. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.

Travel Required

Frequent local field visits to client offices and project sites in the Connecticut, New York and New Jersey area will be necessary (estimated 25-50%). Occasional overnight travel may also be required. A valid and clean driving license is required.

Working Environment

Many of the duties will be performed in the field, which will involve trips to projects sites for observation, testing, and training. Remaining duties will be performed in an office environment.

Performance Standards

Performance will be evaluated against this job description, competencies for this level, and mutually agreed goals.

About Steven Winter Associates, Inc.

Steven Winter Associates, Inc. (SWA) provides research, consulting and advisory services to improve commercial, residential and multifamily built environments for private and public- sector clients. We specialize in energy, sustainability and accessibility consulting as well as certification, research & development and compliance services. Our team of professionals has led the way since 1972 in the development of best practices to achieve high performance buildings.

For further information on Steven Winter Associates, please visit www.swinter.com.

SWA is an Equal Opportunity Employer – all qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or marital status.

We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Applications submitted without a cover letter will not be reviewed.

title: Procure-to-Pay Implementation Consultant
job_description:
A snapshot of what you would do:

The P2P Implementation Consultant facilitates the implementation and support of the apexportal solution to enhance the clients’ business functionality and overall performance, while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction. In addition, the consultant will partner with the client to analyze and define business requirements, processes and objectives to scope project and deliverables for same. The consultant will customize and test solutions on client system and develop client-specific enhancements to meet business requirements as needed. Ideal location is Greensboro, NC however we are open to hiring someone to work remote if you are unable to relocate to NC.

Specific Responsibilities:

Be actively involved in the preparation, conceptualization, realization and Go Live of customer implementation projectsPerform Implementation Planning Sessions (IPS) during pre-sales cycle.Analyze and map clients’ business requirements, processes and objectives; develop necessary product modification requirements to satisfy clients’ needs. Prepare statement of work, and estimate costs for professional services required during implementation.Provide consultation to clients and maintain documentation for best practices and lessons learnt from prior implementations.Provide consultation to clients and maintain documentation for global business rules including tax, banking, address, documents, validations, etc.Provide consultation to clients and maintain documentation for ERP specific business rules (SAP, Oracle, PeopleSoft, etc.)Provide consultation to clients and maintain documentation for Industry specific business rules (Healthcare, Airline, Entertainment, Manufacturing, Retail, etc.)Perform feasibility studies and process design reviewsDevelop detailed plan of process implementationDefine detailed blueprint for development requirementsLead industry /corporate process implementation across all related applicationsAssist in the development of the overall project plan (scoping process) as well as individual work plans; acting as liaison with client for troubleshooting (investigates, analyses, and solves software problems)Support the internal Project Management and Implementation Practice with pre-sales support, functional architecture work, spot consulting, solution reviews and internal projects and commit to the success of customers, partners, colleagues, and APEX.

Required Skills:

 7+ years consulting experience with multiple ERPs, specifically with MDM, Vendor Master, and P2P (SAP, Oracle, PeopleSoft, etc.)Strong knowledge of supplier information management processes and best practices.Expertise in the configuration and implementation of multiple modules in addition to Production PlanningExpertise in the integration of supplier information management systems with multiple ERPs.Understanding technical concepts and how integration works including but not limited to batch data processing, SOAP and REST APIs, Single Sign On (SAML 2.0), and emails.S4/HANA knowledge a plusWork requires meetings in multiple time zones during the dayAbility and willingness to travel ~40%.

Required Experience:

Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Marketing, or Management Information Systems or equivalent practical experience in a related field is required Financial Shared services experience a plus– but not required

About Us:

APEX Analytix is the leading provider of trusted supplier data; supplier portal software; controls, audit and analytics software; and AP recovery audit services. We protect over $5 trillion in spend and prevent or recover over $3 billion in overpayments annually, and our client portals actively support over 3 million suppliers. Our software and audit services are built on our SmartVM® database of over 20 million supplier records with contacts, scored for accuracy and age, based on integration with over 650 external data sources and over 10 million communications with suppliers each year. APEX Archimedes™, an advanced cognitive technology and innovation system, supported by IBM Watson®, is integrated into APEX Analytix software and services to harness the power of the future through smarter recoveries, controls, analytics, working capital and supplier data. We serve over 250 Fortune 500/Forbes Global 2000 clients around the world and are fluent in languages covering 98 percent of global trade.

Our Culture:

At APEX Analytix, our culture drives everything! We live our culture of performance, respect, candor and fun—in that order. Performance is measured by delivering value to our clients, generating goodwill, trust and partnership. Sincere respect for each other, our diverse backgrounds and our well-being are our cornerstones. We value open and honest relationships with each other, our clients and our communities. And, life is too short to not have fun! We look for team players who possess the qualities of being humble, hungry and smart. We recruit candidates who will strive for accountability in performance and career growth, serving our clients in long-term respectful relationships, and working in a diverse and caring environment.

The Perks:

We owe our growing success to our team of bright, passionate, and innovative individuals. We truly value our associates and strive to provide the highest quality benefits program, offering competitive compensation packages with tailored bonus plans and generous benefits. Our benefits include health and insurance plans (medical, dental, optical, life insurance, disability insurance, FSA, HSA employee assistance program, supplemental insurance options and pre-paid legal), a generous paid time off plan, 401k plan, flexible work schedules, wellness programs (company fitness and weight loss challenges, financial wellness software tool, and gym membership stipend), associate and customer referral bonus programs, and paid community hours. And here at APEX Analytix, you won’t get lost in the shuffle. Our focus on internal training, growth and development results in annually filling over a quarter of our open positions with internal promotions! With resources such as a strong Mentor Program, Internal Training Portal, plus Education, Tuition, and Certification Assistance, we provide tools for our associates to grow and develop. If you are looking for a place to shine, come join the team!

title: Job Search Consultant
job_description:
Randstad RiseSmart is hiring Job Search Consultants to join our Operations team. This is a part-time, remote role with flexible part-time hours (Virtual / Remote, Part-Time, Freelance).

The Job Search Consultant opportunity is a flexible remote role that is project-based. At times projects are extended by request of our customers, or Randstad RiseSmart may have a need for more coaches in other programs. While these are possibilities, they are not guaranteed. This approach would allow contractors to get their feet wet, experience the Randstad RiseSmart culture, and learn about our suite of coaching programs and where there could be a discussion on future interest.

The rate of pay is $25 per hour. We anticipate up to part time which could flex between 15-20 hours per week. This industry has ebbs and flows so we are looking for those interested and able to be flexible, who are not dependent on a certain number of hours from Randstad RiseSmart. This opportunity would begin as a three-month assignment with a strong possibility of extending indefinitely.

About the Job

As a Job Search Consultant, you will be a part of the of Randstad RiseSmarts transition management solution. You will focus on what transitioning professionals needs most: a new job.

What You Will Do

Responsible for supporting Participants via video conferencing, telephone and email
Act as liaison to other Randstad RiseSmart service providers including Resume Writers, Job Search Specialists and Technical Support
Responsible for expertly coaching Participants on their job search strategy and providing them services including mock interview, interview preparation, offer evaluation and salary negotiation coaching information on networking best practices and other support as needed

Skills You Will Need

3 to 5 years of experience coaching or recruiting
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
Diverse professional background including corporate experience
Bachelors degree a must, Masters degree strongly desired
Interest in obtaining coaching certifications strongly desired
Agency recruiting background strongly desired
Excellent communication (written and oral), listening, multi-tasking skills.
Excellent rapport building skills a natural ability to make clients feel cared about
Strong sense of empathy, positive outlook, ability to motivate others
High Speed internet access (Cable or DSL; no satellite or dial-up)
Windows 8/10, Mac OS Yosemite or above, Chrome or Firefox latest browsers
Ability to work part time hours (this is a W2 position)

About Randstad RiseSmart

At Randstad RiseSmart, our vision is to shape the world of work. We are a leading talent mobility provider and part of Randstad N.V., a 23.8 billion global provider of flexible work and human resources services that helps more than two million candidates find meaningful work every year. Our outplacement, career development, redeployment and contemporary Tech & Touch solutions strengthen employer brands, improve retention and re-engage talent. Every day we enable impacted employees to find fulfilling work, and we give our Fortune 1000 customers the peace of mind that comes from knowing that they are working with a compassionate, contemporary, outcome-driven team. Our innovative technology has helped us grow to become the nations fastest growing outplacement provider. Our expert coaching and professional branding teams have successful track records of empowering careers. And, ultimately our results speak for themselves: we have received enormous industry recognition, including Gartners Most Innovative Company, the Nations Best and Brightest Companies to Work For, Fortunes 100 Best Companies for Women, and Deloitte Fast 500 recognized as one of North Americas fastest growing technology companies. To learn more, visit www.randstadrisesmart.com.

What's In It For You?

Competitive compensation
Excellent work environment with an award-winning culture, Best Places to Work, Great Rated, Fortunes 100 Best Companies for Women, and check out our Glassdoor Rating of 4.0!
Opportunity to grow and contribute to Randstad RiseSmart's continued success in a highly visible role

Randstad RiseSmart is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: User Services Consultant
job_description:
What We Do:

The SEI helps advance software engineering principles and practices and serves as a national resource in software engineering, computer security, and process improvement. The SEI works closely with defense and government organizations, industry, and academia to continually improve software-intensive systems. Our core purpose is to help organizations improve software engineering capabilities and develop or acquire the right software, defect free, within budget and on time, every time.

Position Summary:

This includes within the SEI and CMU community, sponsor sites, conferences, and offsite meetings on occasion.You will be subject to a background check and will need to obtain and maintain a Department of Defense security clearance.

Diagnosing, troubleshooting and providing solutions for technical user problems.Install, configure and troubleshoot system and application software including email clients, office applications, and approved customer related requests.Areas of support include, but are not limited to Windows, Linux, Macs, mobile phones, tablets, audio and video teleconferencing, account management, printing and networking and a wide variety of technical issues that deal with the hardware and software.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Working knowledge of computer operating systems and common tools including networking, email clients, and web browsersExcellent troubleshooting, problem solving, interpersonal, and reasoning skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to work remotely on After Hours coverageAbility to organize work in order to meet deadlines and user demandsAbility to understand and follow directionsAbility to interact well with customers with varying needs from government, business, and education spectrumsAbility to assess support issues and either resolve or escalate to the appropriate resource for resolution Ability to communicate with users, including insuring that the user understands what the incumbent has communicatedBeing able to use our online tracking Service Desk System to track and document incidents and requests is required



Desired Experience:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field or equivalent combination of training and experienceCertifications from CompTIA A , CompTIA Networking , CompTIA Security Ability to create, develop and maintain documentation and training materialsAbility to assist users by consulting on how to apply new technology to perform their job more efficientlyAbility to handle new user training as needed Ability to answer help desk phone as neededAbility to work with other members of SEI Information Technology staff to resolve user problems and provide consistent and reliable help desk services

A listing of employee benefits is available at: www.cmu.edu/jobs/benefits-at-a-glance/.

title: Digital Transformation & Operating Model - Principal Consultant - REMOTE POSITION
job_description:
40% of ISG’s revenues come from our Go-Digital initiatives, and we have ambitious growth plans over the next three years. The Digital Strategy & Solutions Service Line spearheads our Digital solutions and offerings in the market is a key driver of this growth.

Our Digital Strategy & Solutions consist of 5 key domains:

a) Agility @ Enterprise Scale

b) Digital Backbone & Cloud Operating Models

c) Emerging Technology @ Enterprise Scale (Analytics, AI, Cybersecurity, Blockchain,…)

d) Business Model Value and Innovation

e) Digital Engineering & Manufacturing

To strengthen our Digital Practice, we are looking for seasoned Principal Consultants who will help ISG clients in defining, measuring and executing on how digital drives value and transforms their business models – and operating models.

You will play a key role in driving architectural decisions across projects with our clients, will help to shape our offering, and grow/lead a delivery/consulting team for application and solution architecture for business model innovation.

You will guide consulting teams in sales solutioning, delivery of ISG methodology and tools, and in market-facing content development / thought leadership. You will lead in the development of initial assessments, strategies, workload and/or portfolio analysis, project plans, market capabilities, and roadmap development for the Digital Transformation & Architecture – and run large programs across multiple clients within this discipline.

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Deliver & lead teams in complex Digital Strategy, Business Model Innovation & Operating Model Transformation engagements for ISG

• Authority & experience with implementing one or more of the following fields at Enterprise level in the G-500: digital operating models, next generation application technology, cloud operating models, future workplace design, predictive analytics, enterprise architecture, solution architecture

• Coach and guide client leadership (below C-level) on strategy and options

• Coach and mentor consulting teams within the Digital practice.

• Lead and guide the practice development of a key ISG Digital Domain.

• Work with Partners and Directors (and where needed Regional Sales teams and DG teams) on pursuits to lead effective client/project solution development that balances the use of repeatable/accredited practice solution components with industry context.

• Actively engage in highly visible internal and external client forums to drive Digital brand and image enhancement for ISG.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

• 7-14 years recent consulting experience in enterprise and application architecture in customer-facing roles, or suitable experience within a corporate IT department in a variety of leadership positions across IT Operations, Architecture and Security

• Expertise in defining target business capabilities and value maps/streams at enterprise level for the G500.

• Good understanding of platform business models.

• Strong understanding of organizational roles and responsibilities associated with enterprise IT and the nuances in B2B, B2C, asset-heavy and B2B2C industry segments.

• Good experience with IT service delivery and operations. Hands-on experience is a nice to have.

• Expert with Application delivery models (DevOps and multimodal delivery) and ability to understand application architectures for cloud modernization with working knowledge of architecture of public and on-premise hybrid-cloud solutions

• Broad enterprise application experience with leading ERP stacks such as SAP, Oracle, etc. and other platform such as HRIS, CRM, etc.

• Knowledge and experience with DevOps processes and tools highly desired

• Broad exposure to major SaaS solutions like Workday, Salesforce as well as iPaaS / managed PaaS trends and offerings in the market.

• Knowledge of workloads and patterns for cloud migration and architecting.

• Technical proficiency and comfort with variety of Operating System and Database platforms

• Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders and C-level executives.

Education:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field

• MBA/MS or other advanced degree(s) desirable

• ITIL Foundation Qualification desirable

• Cloud certifications desirable

Certifications:

• Agile, SAFe, Scrum, or Kanban certification(s) desirable

Travel:

• 80% - 100% required

Technical & Professional Traits:

• Fully understands, and has experience with the Consulting Lifecycle

• Has worked for Tier 1 consultancies at some point in their career at a Director or Associate Partner level or above for at least 3+ years across their overall professional career.

• The individual has led large, diverse, multi-disciplinary teams to solve complex technology related issues in real life industry relevant scenarios.

• Has hands on experience with specific Practice competencies & themes through client engagement work in Tier 1 consultancies, or through direct employment with large global enterprises in the specific industry.

• Has strong 3+ years of experience across multiple industry segments, and is knowledgeable of critical success factors/issues that are emerging due to the impact of the Digital Industrial Economy for those industries.

• Is comfortable with working within a matrix management operating model.

title: Principal Incident Response Consultant
job_description:
Company background

The Crypsis Group is a respected security advisory firm with a vision to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is comprised of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics and information security. With a highly-successful track record of delivering mission critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide effective incident response, attack-readiness and remediation plans with a focus on providing long term support to improve our clients security posture.

Responsibilities for the Principal Incident Response Security Consultant include:

Perform reactive incident response functions including but not limited to: host-based analysis functions through investigating Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X systems to identify Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).Examine firewall, web, database, and other log sources to identify evidence of malicious activity.Investigate data breaches leveraging forensics tools including Encase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, and custom Crypsis investigation tools to determine source of compromises and malicious activity that occurred in client environments.Manage incident response engagements to scope work, guide clients through forensic investigations, contain security incidents, and provide guidance on longer term remediation recommendations.Ability to perform travel requirements as need to meet business demands (on average 20%).Mentorship of team members in incident response and forensics best practices.

Qualifications for the Principal Incident Response Security Consultant include:

6+ years of incident response or digital forensics consulting experience with a passion for cyber securityStrong leadership skills including experience managing a team or individualsExperience with leading complicated engagements including scoping, interfacing with the client, and have executed on a technical frontProficient with host-based forensics and data breach responseExperienced with EnCase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, Redline, Volatility, WireShark, TCPDump, and open source forensic toolsIncident response consulting experience preferred Bachelors Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security or related field

Compensation for the Principal Incident Response Security Consultant includes:

Competitive base salary with quarterly bonus planFull Benefits: Competitive salary plus quarterly bonus opportunityCompany EquityApproved Certification and Training ReimbursementsOpen Paid Time Off PolicyMedical, Dental, and Vision Benefits401K Employer MatchingFlexible work schedule

title: Senior Workday Human Capital Management Analyst
job_description:
The Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago has an immediate opening for a Senior Workday HCM Analyst. If you are looking for a career with exciting assignments, continuous learning opportunities and diverse work environment, we encourage you to apply and learn more about this role.

Job Summary
 Reporting to the HR Operations Team Lead, you will oversee analysis, design and implementation of the Bank’s human capital management Workday system, policies and related processes. You will also work with and advise Bank users, technical staff, HR experts, HR business partners and leadership on system design decision, user experience, issue resolution and process design.Responsibilities


Lead business process and HR technology implementations based on understanding of associated technology from both the user experience and as a business enabler
Partner with HR and technology teams to lead Workday HCM system related projects, including system upgrades, enhancement packages, releases and process redesign
Conduct system and process analysis throughout implementation lifecycles and for ongoing support and scalability of Workday HCM and supporting integrations

Evaluate configuration requirements by evaluating needs and end-user experience and building system process flow maps for all HR system processes
Organize system and security configuration for the Workday HCM platform and other HR software tools with technology teams
Partner with information security team on HR technology efforts supporting data integrations and system authentication, ensuring system stability, security compliance and expeditious resolution for high impact issues
Develop and present HR Technology related communications and training
Provide best practice information with our control environment




Your Background

Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum five years of experience in a related field
Minimum two years of experience with HCM design, configuration, and reporting﻿﻿
Experience supporting enterprise class HCM solutions
Experience in Agile project management methodologies and application

What we offer

Comprehensive benefits package include medical, dental, vision, prescription drug coverage, 401k savings plan, retirement plan, paid time off, transit benefit, onsite gym and subsidized cafeteria
A learning environment with opportunities to gain new skills and develop your career


Requirements

As a condition of employment, Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago employees must comply with the Bank’s ethics rules, which generally prohibit employees, their spouses/domestic partners, and minor children from owning securities, such as stock, of banks or savings associations or their affiliates, such as bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies. If you or your spouse/domestic partner or minor child own such securities, and would not be willing or able to divest them if you accepted an offer of Bank employment, you should raise this issue with the recruiter for this posting, who can provide you contact information for our ethics official if necessary.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

title: Senior Consultant - DevOps - Global Telecommunications Practice
job_description: The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC, servicing multiple teams or organizations. The Senior Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the full DevOps spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations.Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. title: Analyst- Heidrick Consulting
job_description:
Heidrick & Struggles is a premier provider of executive search, leadership assessment and development, organization and team effectiveness, and culture shaping services globally. In our more than 60 year history, we have conducted some of the most high-profile C-suite and board-level searches in the world.

Today, we are working with our clients across 29 countries to help them accelerate their performance and respond with agility to new opportunities and challenges in every industry. We continue to raise the bar in serving our clients as trusted leadership advisors, and we are also providing an expanded range of data-driven, tech-enabled tools and platforms across our executive search and consulting businesses.

Managing top talent isn't just our business. It's our passion, and we are committed to investing in and developing the careers of our own people.

We look for people with experience from a variety of industries and diverse educational backgrounds who are passionate about partnering with innovative and influential organizations and share our commitment to our purpose - to help our clients change the world, one leadership team at a time.

If you're ready to start or grow your career with us, learn more about our available opportunities at our website.

Job Description:

The Analyst role is the first step on the consulting career path. In this role Analysts learn the consulting cycle and the critical role or empirical data and rigorous analysis. Your contributions will expose you to leaders across a variety of industries and geographies. This role provides the opportunity to grow with one of the fastest growing organization consultancies specializing in accelerating performance.

The purpose of the Analyst role is to support client engagements and product development by researching, gathering, interpreting and presenting complex data in an impactful and compelling way.

The role will support our exciting range of projects including capability assessment, leadership development, and team effectiveness. Ideally you will have strong interpersonal skills and have worked in a consulting firm or be able to demonstrate the capability to effectively work with clients.

Responsibilities:

Conduct research using a broad range of channels, presenting data in an easily digestible and concise format
Enter, organize and analyse client data using best practice data analytical Leadership Consulting - Analyst 4 techniques to identify key themes and insights
Prepare client and internal reports in Word or PowerPoint to convey data/research findings in a compelling way
Support Partners, Principals and Consultants to produce high quality deliverables for clients
Support the design of new products and tools, conduct and/or support client research, contribute ideas to design and development
Plan and manage own workload on multiple projects, prioritise own work to meet challenging deadlines
Build reusable, client-ready collateral, materials and presentations that clearly define the problem, summarize the analysis, outline potential solutions and lead to recommendation(s)
Organize and maintain libraries of knowledge collateral, ensuring easy access for users
Proactively develop own learning; build own expertise and experience to contribute across a range of client projects.


Qualifications & Experience



Deep interest in business, people, organizational behavior, ideally with a first, Masters, and/or PhD in either Business or Psychology (occupational or organization) coupled with strong analytical skills.
1 to 2 years of work experience with 2 years in a management or leadership consulting environment.
Research experience and strong analytical skills able to use multiple research channels.
Highly proficient in PowerPoint, Word and advanced Excel
Experience of advanced statistical modelling such as SPSS and other best practice predictive analytics
Highly numerate
Excellent writing skills; can prepare concise and compelling reports
High on attention to detail
Language skills as required
Willingness to travel locally and globally as required


Heidrick & Struggles is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring qualified protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, or citizenship status.

title: Salesforce Consultant (Pittsford, NY, McLean, VA)
job_description:
Salesforce Consultant 
Community Brands is a software company that helps organizations achieve social good. Through our technology, we assist more than 100,000 associations, nonprofits, K-12 schools, faith-based organizations, and partners grow stronger and achieve their missions. Like our clients, our nearly 2,200+ employees strive to improve the world in which they live, and we believe that technology plays an important role in that. We are techies and volunteers who dream big and are motivated by more than just a cool job (though thats a great perk). The Community Brands culture is one where employees can pursue this passion as part of their profession, and were looking for great employees to join us!

A Day in the life:

The Salesforce Consultant is a key player in an exciting, customer interfacing role that couples technical and client relationship skills to successfully implement our clients product offerings. The ideal candidate will work within defined project teams to perform the technical implementation and necessary application configuration and development outlined during customer requirements meetings. They will build-out custom declarative functionality and help to educate and train clients. Providing an excellent client experience is paramount to our success.
In this role you'll: 

Analyze and align current business process with product capabilities
Solid grasp on all technology used at Community Brands including Salesforce, Community Brands AMS, web servers, web tools, web services, other cloud solutions
Basic understanding of project management practices
Review business requirements and participate in requirement capture sessions with clients Implement and configure documented solutions or requirements Lead training and demonstration of standard product features as well as custom developed solutions
Develop and execute user acceptance test scripts
Create help documentation for client specific solutions
Develop declarative solutions using standard Salesforce functionality
Practice continuous improvement - contributing to the improvement of implementation and service team best practices and processes
Understand relational database structure as related to solution approach or configuration requirements
Balance multiple project or different work activities simultaneously
Work in a highly collaborative environment with dedicated teams that include Sr. Consultants, Technical Consultants, Product Owners, Data Specialists, and Scrum Masters

We are looking for someone who brings: 

Salesforce experience
Strong written and oral communication skills with clients and peers
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Team Player
Desire to Learn - must be willing to expand your skill set, be comfortable jumping in and learning as you go, and help to share what you have learned with the group
Consulting Experience Business Analyst Experience is highly desirable
Salesforce Certifications are highly desirable (Admin or Salesforce Certified App Builder)
Experience working with Agile methodology and SCRUM process is highly desirable

Good People, Doing Good Things:

Employees at Community Brands are techies and volunteers who strive to make the Company a great place to work. We dream big and are motivated to help our customers use the technology we create to improve the world around us. And, we look forward to you being part of our story!

title: Application Discovery Associate Consultant
job_description:
Requirements/Job Duties:Application Discovery Associate Consultant 

Why WWT?

Fueled by creativity and ideation, World Wide Technology strives to accelerate our growth and nurture future innovation. From our world class culture, to our generous benefits, to developing cutting edge technology solutions, WWT constantly works towards its mission of creating a profitable growth company that is a great place to work. We encourage our employees to embrace collaboration, get creative and think outside the box when it comes to delivering some of the most advanced technology solutions for our customers.

At a glance, WWT was founded in 1990 in St. Louis, Missouri. We employ over 6,500 individuals and closed nearly $12 Billion in revenue. We have an inclusive culture and believe our core values are the key to company and employee success. WWT is proud to announce that it has been named on the FORTUNE "100 Best Places to Work For®" list for the ninth consecutive year!

Want to work with highly motivated individuals that come together to form high performance team? Come join WWT today! We are looking for an Application Discovery Associate Consultant to join our Enterprise Solutions & Architecture team.

Why should you join the Enterprise Solutions team?

As an Associate Consultant, you will be working on exciting infrastructure driven projects for Fortune 500 customers across all verticals. Our global infrastructure planning and deployment services deliver thousands of projects each year. From employing our methodologies at hundreds of sites to leveraging complete enterprise design services, customers trust our infrastructure experts to assess the technology they have today and design the solutions they need for tomorrow.

What will you be doing?

Consultants will interpret, analyze, and report information about application dependencies with customers underlying infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

Work directly with customers in an interview-type setting to capture information about application function, app-to-app communication, and infrastructure dependencies
Aggregation, correlation, and interpretation of large data sets from multiple data sources
Operate Configuration Management Databases (CMDB) experience such as ServiceNow, BMC, and/or CA Service Management
25% travel to customer sites to directly engage stakeholders

Qualifications:

Preferred Requirements/Qualifications:

 The ideal candidate has 5 or more years of infrastructure operations experience, "n-tier" application, administration, or development - preferably in an enterprise-scale environment
 Candidates should be familiar with the different technology stacks that comprise an application and be able to ask questions that would help uncover additional dependencies and integrations
 Experience in Operational Technology (OT) environments would be a plus
 Candidates with similar backgrounds in Network Operations, Disaster Recovery, Incident, and Change Management may also be considered
 Experience in the global finance, manufacturing, pharmaceutical, health care, SLED, and/or public utility sectors is also desired
 Strong communication, both verbal and written, as well as presentation skills are desired

Want to learn more about Infrastructure Services? Check us out on our platform: https://www.wwt.com/infrastructure-services

The well-being of WWT employees is essential. So, when it comes to our benefits package, WWT has one of the best. We offer the following benefits to all full-time employees:


Health and Wellbeing: Heath, Dental, and Vision Care, Onsite Health Centers, Employee Assistance Program, Wellness program
Financial Benefits: Competitive pay, Profit Sharing, 401k Plan with Company Matching, Life and Disability Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Time Off: PTO & Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick Leave, Military Leave, Bereavement

title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Systems Stability and Support
job_description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; New York, NY, USA; Pittsburgh, PA, USAMinimum qualifications:

About the jobAt gTech’s Users and Products team (gUP), our mission is to help users get the most out of Google. We represent the voice of Google's users and many of our partners globally, sharing insights with the larger Google organization to enable exceptional customer and product experiences.

We are committed to building an ever more diverse, equitable, and inclusive gUP, and consider this the foundation upon which individual, team, and user success are built. We're also committed to innovation not only in the content of our work, but in the way we work.

gUP builds and maintains a large suite of applications and tools that allow us to support our customers and partners—apps that support everything from the localization of content for millions of users to our internal job mobility application. The team is responsible for the long-term support and stability of these apps. We are building up areas of expertise including monitoring/alerting, QA, software maintenance and migration, infrastructure and capacity planning. We build up our expertise through both hands-on ownership of software systems and processes.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.Responsibilities

Identify opportunities to optimize and automate workflows across a wide variety of projects.
Work closely with Product Managers and Software Engineers to improve or develop new Google tools and products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to write code and implement tools to improve troubleshooting efficiency and the end user experience.
Manage stakeholder expectations and communicate with internal teams and external consumers to provide technical and business feedback as well as deliver technical solutions.

title: Consultant Payroll Conversion
job_description:
Looking to make a real difference?

You belong right here.

Come build a rewarding career helping others achieve their financial dream at an organization that values your own long-term success. With your unique talents, you have what it takes to be bold and brilliant in everything you do and reach new heights for a company dedicated to diversity and inclusion, community and you.

If you share that belief, this is where you belong.

Join our team of nearly 6,000 associates across 40 different locations worldwide and start your future today.

The Consultant Payroll Conversion is responsible for supporting routine Implementation and Retirement Plan Services to achieve successful setup of payroll integration for new and existing retirement plan sales. Incumbent will act as project manager and consultant for payroll integration of conventional client groups. The Consultant Payroll Conversion will work side-by-side with the Implementation Consultant during the conversion process and will act as the point of contact with Plan Sponsors, Financial Advisors and Third Party Administrators for all payroll, online enrollment and automatic enrollment related matters for assigned client groups with standard plan set up.

Responsible for the successful setup of payroll integration and installation of standard/non-complex new transfer or start-up retirement plan sales.Act as the primary contact for Empower for all payroll related matters of assigned client groups.Coordinate the integration and mapping of payroll files/methods with conventional plan sponsors to Empower.Attend ongoing weekly conference calls on assigned projects and consults with various client contacts including plan sponsors, payroll vendors, financial advisors, third party administrators, relationship/client service managers, regional sales director’s and various internal departments with respect to the timing of conversion, outstanding items, critical tasks and overall project management.Discuss and gather required data to support high volume.Some travel may be requiredOther duties and projects as assigned

title: Senior Incident Response Consultant
job_description:
Company background

The Crypsis Group is a respected security advisory firm with a vision to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is comprised of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics and information security. With a highly-successful track record of delivering mission critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide effective incident response, attack-readiness and remediation plans with a focus on providing long term support to improve our clients security posture.

Responsibilities for the Senior Incident Response Security Consultant include:

· Perform reactive incident response functions including but not limited to: host-based analysis functions through investigating Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X systems to identify Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).

· Examine firewall, web, database, and other log sources to identify evidence and artifacts of malicious and compromised activity.

· Investigate data breaches leveraging forensics tools including Encase, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, and custom Crypsis investigation tools to determine source of compromises and malicious activity that occurred in client environments.

· Lead incident response engagements to guide clients through forensic investigations, contain security incidents, and provide guidance on longer term remediation recommendations.

· Lead/Mentor Incident Response Consultants in incident response and forensics best practices.

· Ability to perform light travel requirements as needed to meet business demands (on average 10 -20%).

Qualifications for the Senior Incident Response Security Consultant include:

· 5+ years of incident response or digital forensics experience with a passion for cyber security (consulting experience preferred)

· Proficient with host-based forensics and data breach response

· Experienced with EnCase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Redline, Volatility, WireShark, and open source forensic tools

· Bachelors Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security or related field

Compensation for the Senior Incident Response Security Consultant includes:

· Competitive salary plus quarterly bonus opportunity

· Company Equity

· Approved Certification and Training Reimbursements

· Open Paid Time Off Policy

· Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits

· 401K Employer Matching

· Flexible work schedule

title: IT Process Governance Specialist- Business Systems Consultant 5
job_description:
Job DescriptionImportant Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as Personal Cell or Cellular in the contact information of your application.

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure footprint; provides information security; and enables continuous banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels to Wells Fargos more than 70 million global customers.

The Enterprise Chief Technology Officer (ECTO) Business Services group plays a critical role in enabling our business partners through technology solutions. The organizational model of the ECTO team is designed to more effectively manage our portfolio of applications, govern enterprise IT, manage risk, simplify our technology offerings, and execute on our business partners priorities with enhanced time to market. The Enterprise CTO Business Services (ECBS) group is a critical component of the ECIO operating model and is focused on providing critical business services to the Enterprise CIO organization. Enterprise Application Portfolio Management is a team that is established to manage our Application assets, Application competency center and Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) to ensure robust portfolio management of more than 6000 applications. The application lifecycle consists of three phases; Sunrise, Maintenance, and Sunset. The ALM Sunrise Governance team is accountable to ensure all sunrise processes are operating effectively by tracking and monitoring metrics to key controls and procedures, ensuring proper alignment from policy to procedures to controls to governance of controls.

This position is a governance specialist role that is responsible for the tracking and oversight of key processes that impact the entire IT enterprise. Ideal candidates will have proven experience working in a process governance role, preferably aligning to IT Risk Management or IT Security. Daily responsibilities include working with process owners, application owners, enterprise security and risk consultants, and IT auditors to ensure that existing processes are operating effectively to ensure that applications meet all sunrise policy requirements prior to application deployment. Reviews and reports on metrics of key controls tied to processes and procedures. Establishes and executes on action plans as deficiencies are identified. Works to ensure alignment exists between policies, procedures, and controls.

The primary responsibilities within this position include:

Create and track control and Key Risk Indicator (KRI) metric dashboards Facilitate governance reviews with leadership to review process/control health/performance Execute on governance control processes to ensure established processes are performing as expected Create/maintain/execute on action plans when process/control deficiencies are identified Partner with first and second line risk consultants on risk related projects and deliverables

Required Qualifications

7+ years of business systems analysis experience, business systems design experience, or a combination of both4+ years of Governance and Compliance experience2+ years of experience managing information security or information technology risk management processes

Desired Qualifications

Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsKnowledge and understanding of Information Technology governance risk and compliance processes such as; policies, control standards, risk management concepts, or information securityKnowledge and understanding of technology software: lifecycle managementAbility to assess current processes/procedures and make recommendations for efficiency4+ years of financial industry experienceAbility to develop reports and metrics

Street AddressNC-Charlotte: 1525 W Wt Harris Blvd - Charlotte, NC

IA-Clive: 13733 University Ave - Clive, IA

MN-Minneapolis: 255 2nd Ave S - Minneapolis, MN

AZ-PHX-Northwest Phoenix: 2222 W Rose Garden Ln - Phoenix, AZDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

title: Advisory Services Consultant
job_description:
Advisory Services Consultant

Marketers can’t hide behind old-school metrics and gut feel any longer. The best ones are marrying technology, data, and strategic expertise to make the right marketing investments. That’s where MarketShare comes in. In the Advisory Services Consultant role, you’ll support multi-million dollar customer engagements, with responsibility for organizing internal teams and developing enduring, trusted, and effective relationships with your customers.

You’ll build your network with the top marketing leadership in major companies across virtually all industries. You’ll work to reveal the business drivers of the Fortune 500, while developing expertise at the intersection of big data, marketing, and consulting. Our work is not just about delivering a project and moving on to the next challenge. Instead, it’s about delivering an evolving stream of value and enabling fact-based decision making.

Ideal candidates will have the opportunity to grow in a number of areas:

Marketing: Strategically transform findings from modeling analyses to qualitative insights to help clients understand strategic marketing implicationsClient management: Communicate key findings; Participate in client interactions; Support account leads and engagement managers to strengthen and grow client relationshipsAnalytics: Manage data collection, processing, review and quality checks to ensure accurate information is used for modeling analyses; Develop findings and insights derived from modeling analysesProject management: Manage workstreams and priorities for distinct projects; Support development of client deliverables; Organize aspects of projects

What We Look For

As a company developing innovative and ground-breaking solutions for our clients, we recognize that candidates from distinct backgrounds may be a good potential fit. Our ideal candidates possess a combination of professional work experience in line marketing, media planning, marketing/media mix modeling, predictive analytics, financial analysis, or consulting.

Must haves:

A head for numbers, a heart for customers, and a passion for defining the standards of marketing effectiveness.Experience in the automotive vertical specifically on marketing analytics, inclusive of analytics companies, market research, agency and/or automotive OEM backgrounds is strongly preferred.Exceptional analytics and quantitative acumen with understanding of marketing mix models or close experience such as predictive analytics.You have measurement experience across multiple channels, and your passion is for data sources that are real time and audience addressable.Advanced proficiency with software tools such as Excel to gather, assess, and analyze data as well as PowerPoint to build presentations.Skilled in developing relationships and delivering on projects that have grown into long-term relationships.Resilient work ethic with the capability to adapt to the situation, flexibility and nimbleness in terms of work planning, and the ability to think quickly on your feet.Bachelor’s degree, preferably in marketing, applied science, statistics, mathematics or economics. MBA preferred.4-6 years’ experience in marketing analytics strategy or marketing consulting, in a client-facing role.Specific experience in the ad-tech industry, a digital marketing agency, a programmatic buying company or client side digital advertising is a plus.Big brand experience is a big plus.

About Us

MarketShare is an analytics company that enables businesses to grow more efficiently via cross-media attribution and marketing optimization through our platform of combined technology, data, modeling and business intelligence solutions.

MarketShare Culture -- What’s important to us… and ideally to you

Comfort with ambiguity: We embrace the complexity of our clients’ environments and believe that there are seldom easy answers.Embracing the high-wire act: We’re inventing the space where marketing meets math. This is a new category, and we have to innovate as we go.Pragmatically curious: We have never met a problem that we didn’t want to solve. That said, we recognize trade-offs are required due to client priorities.

We are reshaping the way companies think about advertising and marketing their products and services and delivers unprecedented recommendations and checkpoints to help them achieve the best possible ROI via marketing. The mathematics and modeling behind our work are globally recognized and respected as industry-leading.

Our solutions help marketing executives answer complicated questions such as:

What is the effectiveness of our marketing investments in generating sales, and where should our next dollar be spent?How do TV, radio and print media drive online behaviors and resulting sales, and how do we balance our online-offline mix?Within online channels, how can we continually optimize our digital marketing across publisher sites, keywords, etc.?

MarketShare team has grown worldwide across Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, London, Tokyo, and Bangalore.

Outside Recruiters: Please do not contact MarketShare employees with unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Consultant VMware with TS Clearance
job_description:

title: Project Manager (Consultant)
job_description:
Are you an energetic Project Manager with at least four years of experience and a demonstrated ability to quickly build rapport with others?
Can you work comfortably with challenging projects and ambiguity, defining the process as you go?
Do you have a relentless drive to produce exceptional results?
 
As a Project Manager for AG Consulting Partners, a typical day might include the following:

Working onsite at a Fortune 500 client to lead key business initiatives
Working with key stakeholders to understand project scope and objectives
Evaluating scope and objectives to establish timelines and resources required to achieve success
Collaborating across client business groups to translate requirements, understand impact and timelines, track requests, and ensure successful outcomes
Developing executive communications to inform business sponsors of project goals, performance and current status
Responding swiftly to requests from your client and stakeholders to maintain program velocity
Leveraging your project management framework to manage changes in project scope, schedule and associated costs
Discussing roadblocks, risks and issues, and challenges to your client and her or his leadership team

 
This job might be for you if:
You like helping people and don’t need to take credit for success. You’re patient and calm under pressure. You’re motivated and thrive in ambiguity. You know how to influence others without authority.
You’re humble. You view every experience as an opportunity for learning something new.
You enjoy solving problems. You love taking on difficult challenges and finding creative solutions. You don’t get easily discouraged. If you don’t know the answer, you’ll dig until you find it.
You pay attention to the details. As far as you’re concerned, anything worth doing is worth doing right, every single time. You stay focused, and nothing falls through the cracks on your watch.
You think on your feet. You like learning new things and you can learn quickly. When things change, you know how to roll with the punches.
You communicate clearly. You write well. You can explain just about anything to anyone and you’re comfortable communicating in writing and in meetings.
 
Requirements
You have:

An interest in belonging to a close-knit group of consultants who support one another to grow and share successes
At least 4 years of experience working as a Project Manager in a corporate environment
A Bachelor's degree (Business Administration, Marketing, or Communications preferred)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Project Management frameworks

You might also have:

Previous experience working as a consultant
CAPM, PMP and or/Six Sigma certifications
An interest in learning how to lead and grow a consulting firm
Experience with Visio, SharePoint, PowerBI, Microsoft Teams or Slack
Prior experience working at Microsoft, Amazon, or other Seattle-area Fortune 500 companies

 Benefits
AG Consulting Partners, Inc. is a Redmond-based boutique consulting firm. Our mission is to embrace the entrepreneurial spirit to relentlessly deliver an exceptional experience and results for our people and our clients.
We put our people first. Our excellent benefits to full-time employees include medical, dental, vision, PTO, education reimbursement, wellness allowances, community and philanthropic events and flexible career paths.
We’re humbled to be consistently acknowledged by local and national organizations for our success, including Consulting Magazine, Puget Sound Business Journal, and Inc. 5000.
We look forward to welcoming you to our team of amazing consultants and partners! Learn more about our firm at https://agconsultingpartners.com

title: Sales Consultant, Professional Services
job_description:
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.


JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW

The Sales Consultant is responsible for pursuing new prospects and selling TriNet’s comprehensive solution which includes premium benefits, payroll, and HR services. The primary targeted markets comprise companies with 10-200 employees within the specific industry sectors.

The Sales Consultant is responsible for prospecting and sourcing most of their opportunities. The Sales Consultant manages their sales process from prospecting, presenting, proposing and closing around our PEO services, interacting with C- level executives and owners of small and midsize business (SMBs).

The successful Sales Consultant demonstrates a thorough understanding of TriNet’s value proposition and has the ability to quantify this benefit for clients. The Sales Consultant hunts for opportunities, manages a disciplined calendar of activities to build pipeline, conducts sales meetings with prospective clients and writes proposals, gains appropriate approvals, and presents those proposals to prospective clients.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES

•	Prospect: Consistently work on building a pipeline of target prospects through traditional means of prospecting (cold calling, email, phone, LinkedIn) as well as building and leveraging a diverse group of ecosystem partners to provide referrals and business development opportunities.

•	Consultative Selling: Establish a trusted advisor relationship in order to determine the prospect's needs, sell value, create engagement, alignment, desire, and acceptance of TriNet’s solutions

•	Sell our Professional Employer Organization (PEO) services to C-level executives and business owners at prospective businesses by quantifying TriNet’s benefits and value proposition

•	Write proposals and present approved proposals to prospective clients

•	Managing multiple opportunities through sequential stages of sales process: initial prospect meeting, request for proposal data gathering, benefits comparison, technology demonstration, proposal presentation, and close

•	Achieve quota target by meeting sales metrics that drive business goals

•	Complete all administrative tasks and duties in a timely manner

•	Demonstrate TriNet’s core values daily

•	Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion.

JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Education: Bachelor’s degree is a plus; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Training Requirements (licenses, programs, or certificates): None

Experience:

•	Minimum 5 years’ experience in consultative sales

•	Minimum 5 years of B2B sales experience required

•	Previous experience with significant prospecting, sourcing most of their own sales, utilizing best practices in prospecting and establishing and leveraging network of partners and referrals

•	Human Capital Management industry experience a plus

•	Prior experience selling in one of the following industries is a plus: SaaS, HRO, BPO or PEO

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

•	Ability to communicate and collaborate with colleagues at all levels of the organization

•	Strong knowledge and understanding of both state and federal employment laws

•	Excellent interpersonal skills

•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills

•	Excellent presentation and facilitation skills

•	A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace

•	Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities

•	Ability to use technology and common software and web applications, including MS Office and Salesforce.com

WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)

•	Ability and willingness to travel to prospective clients’ sites within United States

•	Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office setting

•	Required to work at a TriNet office location

•	The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change

or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is

not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending

on business necessity.

TriNet is an Equal

Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on

race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic

information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status,

gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related

medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected

characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who

requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to

request such an accommodation.
