title: Senior Consultant, Data Manager
Implementation Consultant
job_description:
This Implementation Consultant role lives within the customer engagement arm of the Granicus’ govService product family and is a key member of the Professional Services (PS) team. This team helps customers (government agencies) transform the citizen experience.

As an Implementation Consultant you’ll be an expert on the govService platform, and a key partner in the successful rollout of projects across the United States. This role is the perfect combination of a business analyst with strong technical aptitude, and project management with a passion for helping customers reach their strategic objectives. Your role starts at project kick-off with discovery, and requirements gathering right through to training – where customers are both enabled and encouraged to utilize the system to its fullest potential. You’ll help customers update their processes – often weighing options that challenge the status quo. You are highly consultative, a trusted advisor.

What You'll Do:

Master the govService platform – you’ll be the internal expert on the product
Manage small to medium sized customer projects from start to finish
Serve as an advisor to the customer as they improve their online processes – keeping the citizen experience top-of-mind at every turn
Train and enable customers to utilize “off-the-shelf” MyServices and the govService Product
Work closely with Process Designers (internal “builders”) and Project Managers that interface with customers alongside you - to advise on progress and share ideas
Identify potential implementation risks and mitigation – as early as possible
Create test plans and facilitate testing of myServices
Documentation – everything you do is meant to be repeatable
Lead requirement gathering sessions, both internal and external
Participate in sprint planning, review, and retrospective meetings and provide feedback to the team
Ensure acceptance criteria are clearly defined and verify it matches the requirements
Collaborate and work closely with internal partners. You will be fostering relationships with coworkers across the company to support their efforts while delivering products
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies
Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users
Assess the needs of each client and recommend and document solutions
Interact with both internal technical team members and external customers (end-users)

Security Requirement:

Responsiblefor Granicus information security by appropriately preserving the Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) of Granicus information assets in accordance with the company's information security program.Who You Are:

You have 3 – 5 years of experience working in software/tech, specifically around project management, business analysis, consulting, customer onboarding and/or training
You can analyze a process, and easily see the “if/thens” in the logic. Familiarity with building online forms and/or workflow strongly preferred. You know which fields need to be displayed on a form, and which questions are context sensitive (e.g. children dates of birth to be requested only where number of children is greater than zero)
Solid understanding of Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Proven track record of developing and maintaining. Profitable and reference-able customer relationships
Demonstrate and ensure timely and thorough communication of strategy, deliverable status, and results
You have a proven ability to flex between the technical and business sides of your brain – engineers and cross-functional team members alike love to work with you
You are able to work with multiple cross-functional teams to build and evaluate business cases to support product investment decisions
You have a relentless commitment to doing the most valuable work first
You have excellent communications skills – listening, verbal, and written
You can work both independently and as a member of cross-functional teams, some remote
You have a track record of functioning well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with competing demands
You value the importance of user experience
You have a passion for customers



Granicus is committed to providing equal employment opportunities. All qualified applicants and employees will be considered for employment and advancement without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, physical or mental disability, age, genetic information, sexual or affectional orientation, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, familial status, military or veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.

If new development is needed work with internal teams to determine ROI on developmentWorks with existing advisors to ensure proper addendums and agreements are in place to continue to service themMaintains good standing to use for references and works to obtain referrals; tracks up to date status of reference availability; requests advisor helps Orion via social media and advisor reviews to help maintain Orion’s goods namePromotes Orion’s technology to advisors via distribution contentProvides guidance and consulting to advisors on how to best utilize Orion’s technologyParticipates and presents in regular regional Orion training meetingsAttends industry conferences to meet with clients, partners, and prospects; attends client support conferences to present and work additional opportunities

title: Plumbing Sales Consultant
job_description:
Build a thriving career, expand your experience, and earn top pay!
OVERVIEW: Are you an experienced Plumbing Sales Consultant looking to build a successful, satisfying career with the right company? At Caccia Plumbing, we’re looking for a skilled Plumbing Sales Consultant to become valued members of our team. You’ll have the opportunity to work on a variety of intricate plumbing systems with a teammate while increasing your technical abilities through on-the-job and specialized training programs.We take a particular interest in the career development of our employees and don’t hesitate to recognize hard work and excellent results. Our top performers are among the highest-paid in the industry and we offer generous benefits. Moreover, we’re strongly committed to promoting a healthy work-life balance. That means you won’t be on-call with us–ever.
WHO WE ARE: Caccia Plumbing, Inc. is the #1 plumbing company located in the heart of San Mateo County. We keep on growing because we only hire the best, and our customers love us for it. We are a team that trusts each other, bonded by mutual respect, empowered to take ownership, and living a healthy work life balance.
SUMMARY: Provide plumbing system estimates that are accurate and viable to ensure that we set our teams for success, exceed customer expectations through high quality installations that maximize our capacity, efficiency, safety and profitability.
This will be achieved by performing the following duties.
Essential Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Get customers excited about Caccia Plumbing and encourage them to spread the word through word of mouth and social media.
Expected to meet sales goals and expectations set out from the Sales Leader / Manager to achieve company goals.
Utilize Nexstar Service System / Sewer Sales process for complete customer experience
Maintains and establishes a professional customer rapport while encouraging repeat business; responding to customer requests and concerns and promote the Caccia Core Passion.
Consistently provide exceptional customer service
Become and expert on our market and product offerings
Convert opportunities to sales from technicians and field managers.
Perform outbound estimate follow up calls to secure work.
Perform plumbing needs analysis for all perspective customers.
Knowledgeable of drain systems and cleaning, capable to perform drain cleaning when required.
Utilize audio and video hardware and software to catalog, record and upload a detailed report to CRM.
Work with the Install Coordinator and Managers (Underground, Install and Service) to ensure details on the job are properly documented and explained by building implementation timing and action plans that define labor requirements by technical skill level that allow for profitable customer quotes and efficient scheduling of installations.
Quote projects that use industry approved installation methods, that meet local code compliance that will provide value to the customer by being leakproof and root proof at the completion of the work.
Present proposals in person at the time of first call, offer financing and warranties as well as addressing customer questions and concerns.
Responsible to promote James Caccia Plumbing Inc. value proposition and actively recruit experienced technicians that could provide value to the organization.
Follow up and return to completed jobs for quality checks and ask for referrals and reviews.
Relay accurate information to technicians, ensuing proficient, quality customer experiences.
Keep current on plumbing codes, city standards and requirements.
Build comprehensive summaries, project description and details through notes, drawings and videos capturing the installation criteria for the job, access points, safety concerns and customer responses
Participate in training to increase knowledge and skill set.
Perpetuate company culture through positive interactions with co-workers.
Generate own sales leads to meet goals.
Follow up on all open estimates that are logged into CRM and close all open / unsold estimates.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Ranked #1 nationally for employee engagement
Our top performers are among the highest paid in the industry
Company Pays 100 percent
Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance
Life insurance
Short term disability and long-term disability
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Pre-Tax Flexible Spending Account (FSA) - For health and dependent care
Paid vacation & sick leave - Paid holidays
Company funded 401K plan and other retirement contributions
Uniforms provided and laundered
Company vehicle

Company phone and tablet
Numerous training opportunities

title: Advanced Planning Consultant Team Lead
job_description:
How will your role impact First Command?

The Advanced Planning Consultant Team Lead will report directly to the VP, Financial Planning and performs a critical role leading a team of consultants providing advanced planning support to field advisors and home office advisors, and the Directors of Business Development. The Team Lead will conduct regular individual & team meetings to ensure team members continue to develop proficiencies in their role. Develops and maintains knowledge of advanced planning concepts, planning software, military and FEM benefits, and product solutions. Understand the complex relationship between retirement income planning and income taxation. Ensure quality control standards of financial plans to meet or exceed compliance with industry requirements. Provide support to field advisors related to the advanced planning process, software, and financial plan analysis of information in the plan creation process. Consult directly with Advisors and Clients on strategies and concepts.

What will you be doing?


Team Lead/Supervisor and lead contact for Advanced Planning Consultant team.
Acts as "player/coach", both leading the team and producing the work of the team.
Serves as the SME of advanced planning in support of Home Office committees and other departmental efforts.
Is primary Supervision review principal for advanced planning case work completed by team members.
Limited travel; 2-3 trips per year as business needs dictate.
Primary subject matter expert (SME) for Retirement Income Planning strategies. Responsible for keeping material current, coordinating changes, identifying changes that must be incorporated and communicated to the field.
Uses professional financial planning software to model various strategies and make initial recommendations to advisors. Models complex strategies for high-net-worth clients to help maximize long-term tax efficiency. Prepares preliminary forecasts and initial product solutions for advisor's review and use in client meetings as it relates to the financial plan.
Consults either over the phone or in person with Advisors and Clients on plan strategies and recommendations.
Assists in the development and expansion of the financial planning philosophy of First Command, as it relates to advanced retirement income planning concepts, strategies, and business practices.
Assist field advisors build clear implementation plans to maximize the penetration into their local identified markets and create new channels of marketing for the company.
Coordinates with the VP, Financial Planning along with other Directorates, as assigned, in the continuation of retirement income planning concepts and business practices.
Provides support to all Field Divisions and responds to questions from Field Advisors and their staff for information and guidance regarding advanced retirement case design.
Works closely with Financial Planning Consultant team, Division Principals, and and other departments to combine financial planning strategies and tax forecasts into a single comprehensive recommendation for clients.
Prepares documents on financial planning topics for dissemination to the field as well as conduct live presentations on utilizing software tools to support these concepts. Live presentations may include on-line presentations, classroom presentations, or seminars at field training events.
Reviews and provides input for Department publications.
Utilizing existing, approved documents, and software applications, assists the advisor with understanding charts, graphs, tables and other visual aids to be used in various meetings with their clients.
Develop product recommendations that will fit the client’s risk tolerance and time frame as well as develop appropriate product deliverables.
Interprets data obtained from advisors during client meetings for the development of a financial plan.
Coordinate with Product Management to perform portfolio analyses and prepare periodic investment performance reports.
Assist in the implementation and continuation of First Command's financial planning philosophy and policies to include processes, procedures, work flow, and the financial planning techniques and documents.
Assist the financial planning system application team in software testing/analysis to ensure the needs of the end user are
Timely production and delivery of financial planning documents developed for advisors
Maintain a high level of expertise regarding planning software and military/FEM benefits.
Timely identification and compliance with all regulatory, legal, and supervisory requirements.
High quality level of assistance provided to field advisors and home office staff.
Complete all required continuing education requirements within established timeframes.
Maintain positive and professional working relationships with advisors, field staff, and HO co-workers

Supervisory Responsibility

Leads Advanced Planning Consultants

What skills/qualifications do you need?


Bachelor's degree in Financial Planning or similar field of concentration required
Advanced credential of Certified Financial Planner (CFP®), Chartered Financial Consultant Certification, JD, CPA or MBA required
Five years relevant financial services industry experience, preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities


Requires extensive knowledge of retirement income planning procedures and income taxation.
Must possess/acquire detailed knowledge of the Written Supervisory Procedures (WSP), Compliance Manual (CM), and One Net.
Must exhibit excellent verbal and written communication skills and problem-solving skills.
Must be organized, energetic, driven self-starter, and work with a sense of urgency.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite software (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
Demonstrate First Command core values

title: ERP Higher Ed/HCM Sr. Consultant - Contract
job_description:
ISG is seeking a senior consulting professional with broad higher education or academic medical center ERP or operational experience in one or more of the following areas of expertise:

Human Resources and Payroll

• Recruitment/Applicant Tracking

• Compensation/Classification

• Benefits/Insurance

• Payroll

• Personnel Administration

• Position Control

• Time Reporting and Leave Accounting

• Training Procurement and Financials

• Budgeting

• Accounts Payable

• General Ledger and Reporting

• Contracts

• Projects

• Asset Management

• Inventory (optional)

Campus / Student Administration

• Shared Components

• Recruiting

• Admissions

• Student Records

• Registration

• Financial Aid

• Student Financials

• Student Advising

The consultant is expected to be well versed in “best practice” operations and processes in the respective area of expertise (e.g., human resources and payroll). The consultant is expected to be sufficiently versed in the respective area of expertise to analyze current state operations, design future state operations either independent of or in concert with implementation of enterprise applications, and provide oversight in connection with implementation of the future state design.

In connection with a software evaluation, the consultant is expected to: analyze current business processes, establish requirements supporting “best practice” processes, develop procurement documentation (RFP, RFQ, etc.), facilitate evaluation of enterprise software options, guide the client in negotiating software and implementation vendor contracts, and develop an implementation road map.

In connection with an operational review, the consultant is expected to: analyze current state operations and services, facilitate the development of a future state; and develop an implementation road map to achieve the future state. Future state operations may include shared services.

In connection with implementation, the consultant is responsible for providing guidance and/or oversight. The consultant will work with the client lead and, if a Systems Integration partner (SI) is involved, the SI lead. The consultant will provide insight and guidance to the project team, and assess and report progress to the project management office.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

REQUIRED:• Multi-module experience with enterprise application implementations (SAP, PeopleSoft, Workday) and/or experience with enterprise transformation or merger/integration projects

• Higher education and/or academic medical center experience

• Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders

• Strong organizational and task management skills

• Strong analytical skills ideally supported by demonstrated experience applying quantitative analytics in the development of recommendations and in problem solving

• Strong facilitation skills ideally with groups involving groups comprised of individuals with diverse backgrounds

• Demonstrated experience as an effective member of a professional services team

• Ability to make decisions at the project team level and properly escalate those decisions that cannot be resolved on a timely basis

• Complete transformation/systems implementation project life cycle experience

• 7-15 years recent experience with managing transformation projects in a complex university or academic medical center environment

Education:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field desirable

• Master of Business Administration (MBA) or other advanced degree(s) desirable

• Project Management Professional (PMP) certification desirable

Travel:

• Willingness to travel extensively to work on-site with clients as required by clients; typically 4 days per week

Computer Literacy:

• Demonstrates working knowledge with MS-Office suite of software applications and tools, including: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project, MS-Outlook

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Analyze current state operations

• Document business requirements and processes

• Prepare request for proposal document

• Prepare vendor demonstration scripts

• Facilitate vendor evaluation

• Guide client through contract negotiation

• Develop future state operating model

• Develop implementation road map

• Oversee project planning and delivery from an enterprise perspective

• Review or establish project management protocols (e.g., documentation) and, as appropriate to the project, review or execute the project consistent with those protocols

• Monitor effectiveness of project resourcing

• Manage relationships with a wide range of groups

• Review and recommend approval of or, as appropriate to the project, prepare deliverables

• Through oversight and reporting, guide client in holding the SI accountable for completing the project on time, within scope and within budget, consistent with quality standards

• Manage the project change request process and facilitate approval of change requests, including those submitted by the SI

• Monitor implementation project risks, opportunities and issues

• Guide mitigation of risks, realization of opportunities, and resolution of issues and conflicts

• Report project progress, budget and status to appropriate levels (e.g., Executive Sponsor, Executive Council, Steering Committee) and recommend corrective action when necessary

• Review the detailed project plan and supporting tracking schedules on an ongoing basis, and document issues and concerns with project progress. Data entry, reconciliation, and report generation of the project plan and associated tracking schedules are typically client and/or SI responsibilities.

• Provide independent project management oversight

title: SENIOR CONSULTANT- ENGINEERING
job_description:
SENIOR CONSULTANT- ENGINEERINGWhat we’re looking for:

Opinion Dynamics is seeking a senior engineer with experience in the building energy field to evaluate energy efficiency programs. The right person for this job has a mix of technical and interpersonal skills, and an interest in improving the effectiveness of energy efficiency programs throughout the U.S. Additionally, we are looking for an engineer who enjoys working with staff from different disciplines and wants to support the expansion of a strong and vibrant engineering team within the company.ResponsibilitiesEnergy program evaluation work requires a wide variety of skills, from the technical (energy calculations, monitoring & verification, energy modeling, and statistical analysis), to more communicative tasks (in-depth interviewing, working with clients and other staff, and reporting). The types of energy programs being evaluated also vary, and include commercial, industrial, and residential efficiency programs and renewable energy programs. As a Senior Consultant within our growing engineering team, your work will involve:


Evaluating and developing methodologies and algorithms to provide electric and gas savings for residential, commercial, and industrial energy efficient technologies and programs
Conducting building energy simulation modeling
Planning for, performing, and overseeing on-site M&V
Providing technical energy expertise to utilities to enhance the performance and participation in energy efficiency and renewable energy programs
Interacting in a positive and constructive fashion with clients, subcontractors, and vendors
Coordinating and working collaboratively with a team of engineers, project managers, statisticians, survey designers, programmers and other staff
Overseeing project execution and serving as a technical resource for staff
Managing the development of high quality, client-ready reports based on sound engineering methods and findings

QualificationsWhat you’ll need:

Minimum of 5 years of experience related to engineering in the building energy sector and energy consulting
Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) in Engineering (mechanical preferred) or related field required
E.M. and/or P.E. desired, but not required
At least 2 years managing energy-related engineering projects and overseeing engineering staff
Understanding of the engineering principles underlying building energy use, including thermodynamics, heat transfer, and electricity
Experience with energy modeling, bin data analysis, monitoring & verification, and data logging with several types of equipment (HVAC, lighting, refrigeration, etc.)
Proficient in building energy simulation modeling applications (Open Studio, eQuest, Energy Plus, etc.)
Familiarity with ASHRAE, IPMVP, IECC, and other residential and commercial building codes, standards, and protocols
Understanding of renewable energy technologies (photovoltaics, wind, distributed generation, etc.)
Familiarity with building science, sustainable practices, and emerging technologies
Detail oriented and strong attention to quality assurance
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and technical research abilities
Ability to manage multiple time-sensitive priorities without diminished effectiveness

Beyond these qualifications, we are looking for a leader with creativity, intellectual curiosity, and the desire to continue to learn about energy efficiency and the evaluation field. We are a growing company, offering competitive salaries and benefits.

About Opinion Dynamics Corporation

Opinion Dynamics advances knowledge to address emerging energy and social issues through sound and insightful research. Our inter-disciplinary team of consultants develops actionable and insightful research to support an array of clients, including electric and gas utilities, regulators, and stakeholders. Our research supports planning, assessment, and optimizing energy efficiency, demand response, and renewable energy programs. Our team uses a customized approach leveraging innovative methodologies to answer our client’s questions. Our company fosters innovative thought, collegiality and growth opportunities for our employees.

How to Apply

We want to know who you are and why you think you are a good fit! To be considered for this position, please email your cover letter (required), salary requirements, and resume to CareersMA@opiniondynamics.com with “Senior Consultant, Engineering” in the subject line.

No phone calls, please. Only those resumes accompanied by a cover letter will be considered. Opinion Dynamics will not provide sponsorship for work authorization for this position. Opinion Dynamics is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer.

To be considered for this position, please send your cover letter and resume to:

Careers: Senior Consultant- Engineering

CareersMA@opiniondynamics.com

title: Business Transformation Consultant
job_description:
Company DescriptionSia Partners is a next generation consulting firm focused on delivering superior value and tangible results to its clients as they navigate the digital revolution. With over 1,650 consultants in 16 countries, we will generate an annual turnover of USD 300 million for the current fiscal year. Our global footprint and our expertise in more than 30 sectors and services allow us to enhance our clients' businesses worldwide. We guide their projects and initiatives in strategy, business transformation, IT & digital strategy, and Data Science. As the pioneer of Consulting 4.0, we develop consulting bots and integrate AI in our solutions.Job DescriptionOur values have led us to two decades of global expansion. Our Greater Bay team is a key part of that story, supporting many of the biggest names in Technology with our expertise in growth marketing and business transformation. We are looking to meet talented candidates with at least five years of client-facing consulting experience in at least two of the following disciplines:

Program/Project ManagementBusiness AnalysisChange ManagementProcess Improvement & AutomationFinance/FintechB2B/B2C Marketing

We’re especially interested in speaking with candidates who have experience with Facebook, Amazon, Netflix and Google- the aptly named FANG companies - and their advanced technologies to acquire and retain users. Certifications in these areas are always preferred (PMP, Prosci, Lean Six Sigma, etc.).

This is an opportunity to join a rapidly growing team in the Bay Area that serves some of the most exciting and highly respected businesses in the world. You will have the opportunity to provide clients with original thinking and customized solutions and you’ll often have the satisfaction of seeing the impact of your work on the business. We are particularly committed to a healthy work-life integration.

Generous PTO, including paid Parental leaveHealthcare that includes dental and vision, life insurance and 401K matchingCareer advocacy program that supports achieving personal development goals through coaching, collaboration and real-time feedbackRobust learning and development platform through the Sia Institute, 360 Learning App, Sia Blend App, working groups, US Training sessions, and reimbursement for continuing education and certificationsWomen at Sia ClubAnnual Seminar/a value add experience to network with your colleagues across North America and other regionsOpportunities for geographic mobility if desiredWork directly with clients; perks often include flexibility, shuttle… endless snacks


QualificationsSTILL INTERESTED? TELL US ABOUT YOUR…

Consulting / Agency experienceAcademic successesData supported success storiesHigh impact work productCross-functional experienceGrowth from failureInnovation and initiativePowers of persuasionExtracurriculars

title: Principal Consultant - Financial Analysis - REMOTE
job_description:
The Financial Analysis Principal Consultant participates as a key contributor or team member of medium to large sourcing-related engagements including assessments, sourcing / services governance, financial transitions, business process development and overall business analysis.

He or she is an important part of an advisory team in the delivery of ISG Methodology and tools in support of client sourcing or other key financial initiatives. The Principal Consultant assists in the development of assessments, project plans, Service Provider research and selections, financial modeling and analysis, RFP creation, contract negotiations and post selection administrative actions including financial services management during a transaction and performing key financial staff augmentation / leadership roles.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

• 10+ years of recent experience with business process or technology sourcing / consulting engagements or experience focused on financial analysis, accounting, or other financial system / process transformation aspects including shared services and operational improvement.

• Work experience with top-tier outsourcing service providers is generally preferred. (e.g., coster / pricer, financial manager / executive, or financial contract specialist)

• “Hands-on” finance, accounting and/or systems consulting experience developing complex operation solutions with executive teams, and coaching and advising executives

• Experience focused on transformation aspects including shared services, operational improvement and outsourcing/offshoring.

• Comprehensive knowledge and experience (3+ years) in financial management of global outsourced Services and Service Providers.

• An understanding of global corporate financial practices and goals - including drivers of process costs, ability to work with Service Providers to ensure effective cost solutions and agreed upon service level agreements.

• Working knowledge of capabilities of Tier 1 and Tier 2 outsourcing providers.

• Practice development experience, including sales and marketing collateral development, IP development and solution development.

• Delivery management experience, including managing teams at all project phases, successful client relationship management and multi-project oversight.

• Ability to do both strategic assessment and transactional consulting at senior levels. Understands full sourcing lifecycle.

• Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders.

Travel:

• 80% - 100% required

Computer Literacy:

• Demonstrates working knowledge with MS-Office suite of software applications and tools, including: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Education:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field

• MBA or other advanced degree(s) desirable

• CPA desirable

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Provides consultation services to clients and suppliers in areas of outsourcing, project management, financial modeling, executive relationships, leadership, negotiation, administration and marketing.

• Gains an understanding of client’s current situation and environment by gathering needed information and using appropriate frameworks and models in the development of assessment material for decision-making purposes.

• Responsible for project management of small to medium sized engagements or major sub-project. Leads the planning and the development to all project deliverables and assumes overall responsibility for staffing, budget, work plans, scope, project milestones, issues management and risk management utilizing ISG’s project management methods, tools and templates.

• Develops medium to high complexity financial models utilizing ISG templates for comparative analysis of vendor proposals, client data and RFP proposals.

• Participates as a key contributor on engagements or as team member of medium to large engagements in a given business function.

• Participates as part of an advisory team in the delivery of ISG Methodology and tools in support of client sourcing initiatives.

• Assist and leads in the development of initial assessments, project plans, vendor research and selections, financial modeling, RFP creation, contract negotiations and post selection administrative actions.

• Assists in recruiting activities by identifying and interviewing candidates as well as informal mentoring and coaching of current staff.

title: Remote Senior Microsoft Consultant

title: Leasing Consultant-Lease Up
job_description:

At Indigo Real Estate, we attribute much of our properties successes to the strengths of our team members and we are seeking a Leasing Consultant who is passionate about customer service and driven to succeed in a fast paced environment of a lease-up.

They will also demonstrate a strong sense of initiative, a collaborative work style, and a strong work ethic, taking pride in accurate data-entry, accounting, reporting and administrative work product. This position may require weekend and holiday work. Physical aspects of the job include the abilities to lift and carry up to 35 pounds, standing/walking for long periods of time, bending, kneeling, stooping, climbing, and balancing.

Objectives of this Role

Experience in sales or administrative and accounting assistance. title: CONSULTING SAFETY OFFICER
job_description:
As a Consulting Safety Officer (CSO) you will have the continual opportunity to create, implement, and maintain EHS programs for our growing list of life science and high-tech clients. Most of your time will be spent with clients at their locations developing and implementing customized programs in hazard communication, biosafety, chemical safety, emergency preparedness, radiation safety, and facilities safety. You will have a significant opportunity to interact with visionaries, researchers, and senior management at leading firms in a fast-paced, highly varied environment. Being comfortable working with all different types of people in different corporate cultures is essential!
We take pride in our staff having a strong science background. Being able to speak peer-to-peer is critical to our clients. As former scientists with a continual passion for learning our consultants understand what EHS policies and procedures can mean to experiments, timelines, and new products and procedures.
If you are self-motivated, adaptable, willing to constantly learn, and want to be an “expert generalist” in EHS for life sciences, come join us!Job Responsibilities:

Hands-on development and implementation of client EHS programs, including: Biosafety, Chemical Safety, Radiation Safety, Hazard Communication, Emergency Preparedness, Additional OSHA specific safety programs as needed
Establishment and maintenance of EHS permits and licenses in compliance with Federal, State, and Local regulations.
Conduct Job Safety Analyses for hazardous materials processes.
Conduct Risk Assessments to analyze and evaluate the proper handling of biological materials.
Work with client staff to bring about a high-level match of EHS culture and worker safety activities to written policies, procedures, instructions and manuals.
Coordinate and facilitate safety committees.
Prepare and deliver training to fulfill regulatory requirements and ensure client employees are fully aware of the safety program.
Coordinate specialized training, such as RCRA, DOT, IATA, OSHA HAZWOPER, Wastewater Operator, CPR, First Aid, and AED.
Maintain complete documentation of all aspects of the EHS program.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Life Sciences; Biology or Chemistry degrees strongly preferred.
Master’s degree or PhD in Life Sciences preferred.
5+ years of experience in a laboratory setting (biotechnology, pharmaceutical research, academic science, or medical technology science preferred) or EHS related work experience.
Knowledge of two or more of the following: OSHA, DEP, EPA, RCRA, DOT, DPH, MWRA, NIH, NFPA, DEA, CDC regulations as they pertain to life science, nanotechnology or engineering companies.

Required Skills and Competencies:

Strong professional communication and written skills.
Able to positively interact both internally among the client staff and externally with regulatory agencies.
Must be highly organized with strong prioritization skills, and possess the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Must be able to drive into Cambridge/Boston, MA, up to 5 days per week.
Productivity and resiliency in a dynamic, fast paced consulting environment.
High level of professional judgment.
Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite.
Experience and comfort with public speaking.

What you need to be successful in this role:

Service oriented with personable positive attitude.
Ability to successfully negotiate and promote safety programs and services.
Strong initiative to dig into resources efficiently and effectively.
Ability to independently solve problems with little supervision, but recognize when help is needed.

Preferred Training:

OSHA HAZWOPER Operations Level or above.
Industrial Hygiene courses relevant to laboratory settings.
40 hour Principles and Practices of Biosafety or courses targeting biosafety in research labs.
40 hour Radiation Safety Officer Course.

title: Management Analyst
job_description: With the threat of transnational terrorism and ongoing development of weapons of mass destruction (WMD) by nations potentially hostile to the U.S., DHS has taken steps to integrate the full range of its radiological/nuclear, chemical, and biological threat detection programs. As the focal point for this effort, DHS Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction (CWMD) requires consulting and program management support that can reinforce and better enable a more dynamic and operationally-focused DHS strategy.  LMI is a private government consulting firm, dedicated exclusively to advancing the management of the government. Founded in 1961 as a not-for-profit company, we deliver the best value for the government dollar as all revenues are directed to our mission of advancing government rather than to delivering shareholder value. We operate completely free of political and commercial bias, and we are entirely aligned with the goals of our clients. Our clients value our Specialized services in logistics, intelligence, homeland security, health care, and energy and environment markets. We believe government can make a difference, and we seek talented, hardworking people who share that conviction.  LMI offers a generous compensation package with excellent benefits that start the first day of employment. Business casual dress, flex time, and tuition reimbursement are a few of our many work-life benefits available to our employees. Please note: Candidates must be able to pass a DHS Suitability Check and obtain a Secret clearance. Provides technical and managerial direction for problem definition, analysis, requirements development, and implementation for complex to extremely complex systems in the homeland security area.   Performs the functions of an expert in the relevant Chemical Defense field in support of major programs or system development.   Applies expertise in defining and resolving system issues, performing analysis, and developing plans and requirements in the subject-matter area for complex systems.   Works independently or leads a project team in the development and delivery of guidance documents, exercises, and training in support of program objectives.   Leads the development of a variety of analytic decision support products that meet National decisionmakers’ and stakeholders’ requirements.   More broadly, performs the functions of an expert in execution of Chemical Defense projects.   Applies scientific expertise in defining and resolving system issues, performing analysis, and developing plans and requirements for further analysis.   Coordinates and manages the preparation of analysis, evaluations, and recommendations within Chemical Defense projects in support of federal personnel. Provides technical expertise and analysis in the mission space related to chemical threats and CBRN incidents. Supports CWMD/Chemical Defense in developing reports, analyses and other internal and external-facing products in support of the aforementioned tasks. Bachelor’s degree in direct or related fields of national security, emergency management, environmental health, or similar.  2-3 years of experience in the fields of national security, emergency management, public health disaster management, chemical defense, or similar areas.

title: IT Consultant (m/w/d) Storage & Backup Solution (Leipzig)
job_description:
Wir wachsen - wachse mit uns!

Die WBS IT-Service GmbH ist einer der führenden herstellerübergreifenden Serviceprovider Mitteldeutschlands. Mit unserer Beratungs- und Serviceleistungen unterstützen wir unsere Kunden bei der Etablierung und Optimierung IT-gestützter Geschäftsprozesse und der Absicherung des Systembetriebes in Leipzig und Mitteldeutschland.

Wenn Du konkrete Lösungen für abstrakte Probleme entwickeln kannst/möchtest und Du den Zusammenhang zwischen Storage/Backup und Datacenter verstehst, dann lerne unsere Spezialisten als potenzielle neue Kollegen in Leipzig kennen!

Dein neuer Aufgabenbereich:

Unterstützung im Rahmen des Presales und Aftersales

Du bist für die Definierung, Konzeptionierung sowie die Weiterentwicklung der Storage- und Backup-Infrastruktur tätig

Du unterstützt und leitest verschiedene IT Projekte als technischer Lösungsarchitekt bzw. analysierst und bewertest vollumfänglich zum Thema Backup Management sowie Rund um das Thema Datacenter

Erstellung von Leistungsbeschreibungen sowie Aufwandeinschätzungen

Erarbeitung von Konzepten zu komplexen Fachthemen sowie Installation, Konfiguration und Dokumentation von IT-Lösungen

Proaktives Erkennen von Schwachstellen und potentiellen Fehlerquellen steht ebenfalls im Fokus deiner täglichen Arbeit

Als Storage & Backup Spezialist erkennst du Trends und übernimmst die Projektsteuerung von der Umsetzungsphase bis zum Endergebnis

Als Ideengeber (Consultant) transferierst du dein Know-how und überführst diese auch in andere Geschäftsprozesse

Das bringst Du mit:

Eine abgeschlossene technische Berufsausbildung oder ein Studium aus den Bereich Informatik, Fachinformatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Technologie oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation (z.B. Engineering)

Du bringst eine gute Basis aus den Bereichen Virtualisierung- und Backupinfrastruktur mit

Darüber hinaus konntest du schon bei der Konzeptionierung, Integration, Support und des Betriebes von Storage & Backup entsprechende Erfahrungen sammeln

Zu deinen Stärken zählt eine strukturierte Denk -und Arbeitsweise sowie eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe

Solltest du schon einmal mit Commvault, Symantec, VMware und/oder HPE, Microsoft gearbeitet haben, dann fühlst du dich bei uns zuhause

In deiner Tätigkeit bist Du nicht nur im Office, sondern selbstverständlich auch beim Kunden vor Ort.

Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab

Gute Kenntnisse in einem oder mehreren Lösungsbereichen:

Virtualisierungstechnologien (Schwerpunkt VMware)

Storagemanagement (Schwerpunkt HP, Overland, Datacore)

Backuplösungen (Schwerpunkt CommVault)

Ein professionelles Auftreten, ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten sowie gute Präsentationstechniken

Eine kundenorientierte, sorgfältige und selbstständige Arbeitsweise

Hohe Teamfähigkeit und Flexibilität

Führerschein Klasse B bzw. 3 sowie Reisebereitschaft

Wir bieten Dir:

Eine offene Unternehmenskultur, die Freiräume für Ideen und hohe Eigenverantwortung bietet

Neben einem herausfordernden und spannenden Arbeitsumfeld in einem engagierten Team, erhältst Du eine attraktive und leistungsorientierte Vergütung sowie die Möglichkeit auf Sabbatical und betriebliche Altersvorsorge

Ein festgelegtes Einarbeitungsprogramm, betreut durch einen erfahrenen Mitarbeiter, flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie zielgerichtete Weiterbildungen.

Einen Entwicklungsplan mit deiner konkreten Weiterbildung/Zertifizierung

Mehr als 170 nette Kollegen (m/w/d), die Dir bei der Bewältigung deiner neuen Aufgaben helfen

Zentrale Lage

Dienstwagen,auch zur privaten Nutzung

Option auf Umwandlung von VWL und Betrieblicher Altersvorsorge

Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag

Vertrauensarbeitszeit

Anstellungsmöglichkeit in Teilzeit oder Vollzeit

Gestalte mit uns die digitale Arbeitswelt von morgen und bewirb Dich unter bewerbungen@wbs-it.de Für erste Fragen steht Dir Nicole Knorr unter 0341/98271142 oder unter 0160/6527211 gern zur Verfügung.

Personenbezogene Formulierungen sind geschlechtsneutral zu betrachten und gelten für (m/w/d).

title: Sr Sales Consulting Engineer - T2 Service Providers
job_description:
About the Position:

Juniper Networks has an immediate opening for a team-oriented, highly effective and self-motivated individual to support the Sales Engineering in Service Provider segment. Sales Engineers (SE’s) are a critical component of the Juniper GTM Team and have a primary responsibility to partner with the sales organization on driving technical sales activities for both new and existing opportunities. SE’s possess in-depth, hands-on expertise with Juniper's products, solutions and services as well as those of our competitors’ and can demonstrate the same to our customers and business partners.

The specific role is for Senior Consulting Engineer for Tier-2 SPs on the America’s Service Provider architecture team and will be looked upon as a thought leader and a multi-domain expert within the areas of Mobility, Telco Cloud, SDN, Routing, Switching and Security solutions. The successful candidate will operate in an architect capacity for the sales engineering organization and will be responsible for the overall architecture and solutions being positioned to all the Tier-2/Tier-3 Service Providers in North America. The candidate will work closely with Juniper Product, Engineering and strategy teams to make sure Juniper’s product roadmap is aligned to industry trends and customer’s evolving needs in emerging technologies. The candidate will also work closely with other SE architects in Americas and Global SP space and identify repeatable opportunities.

Location: Denver, CO or Any Major US Metro (flexible)

Minimum Qualifications:

A successful candidate will meet all of these requirements:

Experience working in a pre-sale’s role selling networking equipment OR end-user experience in design / architecture / vendor selection


Ability to communicate, both oral and written, on complex technical and sales issues to a variety of audiences, including executive level technical decision-makers Ability to make and communicate relevant connections between proposed technical solutions and customers' business requirements. Strong understanding and knowledge of how to build successful relationships between an equipment manufacturer and a channel partner or reseller 
15+ years relevant industry experience in mobility, wireline and SDN domains. Candidate should have experience in multiple of the following technical domains


Mobile wireless architecture, 4G Evolved Packet Core (EPC), and 5G O-RAN evolution, 5G NGC and SBA, Network Slicing etc. Virtualization technologies on x86 and scaling using technologies such DPDK, SR-IOV, SmartNICs etc. Containers and Container related technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes and Container networking (Flannel, Calico, Canal, Weave etc.) Expert level and hands-on knowledge of SDN environments including Overlay protocols such as MP-BGP, EVPN and tunneling technologies such as VXLAN, MPLSoGRE, MPLSoUDP Data Center networking with deep understanding of large underlay Leaf and Spine based CLOS networks. Routing expertise in access, metro and core back-bone design, including hands-on knowledge on BGP, IGP and MPLS technologies (SR, LDP, RSVP-TE etc.) Design and operate large scale MPLS enabled services such as Multicast-VPN, L3VPN, L2VPN, EVPN. Up to date knowledge on emerging protocols and technologies shaping up in standard bodies (SRv6, SRm6 Network slicing architecture etc.) Expert level and hands-on knowledge of software-hardware disaggregation and industry initiatives such as SONiC, SAI, P4 etc. Experience in designing managed services solutions to the enterprise including SD-WAN, AI based operations, WiFI solutions, Campus/branch routing and switching solutions etc. Experience in network automation including solutions for work flow automation, service provisioning, telemetry and close-loop automation solutions Experience in designing high-performance security solutions for network infrastructure, cloud and mobility. Should have designed advanced firewalls, private/public cloud virtual firewalls, threat prevention and aggregation, policy enforcements, SIEM solutions for service provider customers. 
In-depth understanding of product features, use cases, positioning, and configuration in many of the following products or product categories:


Juniper Contrail Cloud, Contrail Edge Cloud, Contrail Enterprise Multicloud, Contrail Networking, Contrail Security Contrail Service Orchestration, Contrail Healthbot Data center automation: Contrail Fabric Manager, Cloudvision, ACI etc. Openstack distributions (Redhat, Mirantis etc.) Opensource activities like OPNFV, Tungsten Fabric, ODL, ONAP etc. Linux operating system knowledge including KVM SDN overlay technologies including Nuage, or NSX Network Monitoring on Junos, Netconf/Rest APIs, YANG OSS/BSS/IT integration DevOPs capabilities, SLAX/Junos Automation, Perl,Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Cobbler Juniper QFX switches, Cisco Nexus switches, or Arista switches Juniper MX Series routers, PTX Series routers, Cisco ASR9000, CRS Juniper ACX Series routers for metro Juniper SRX series products, ATP, SecIntel, Contrail Security etc. Public cloud platform and services (AWS, Azure, GCP) Open Networking switch hardware (white box) and related software (Cumulus, BigSwitch, Pica8) Knowledge of merchant silicon technologies (Trident, Tomahawk, Jericho, etc.) 
JNCIE, CCIE, RHCE, CKA/CKD or other expert-level industry certification is desired Formal or informal technical sales leadership or mentoring is desired

Other Information:

Travel requirements for the position - 50%. This position will travel based on customer demand for sales activities

Juniper Networks is enrolled in E-Verify® and will be participating in E-Verify in addition to our Form I-9 process. www.dhs.gov/E-Verify

Juniper Networks is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Digital Strategy and Solutions - Digital Backbone, IT Modernization and Cloud Consulting Manager REMOTE
job_description:
40% of ISG’s revenues come from our Go-Digital initiatives, and we have ambitious growth plans over the next three years. The Digital Strategy & Solutions Service Line spearheads our Digital solutions and offerings in the market is a key driver of this growth.

We are looking for an experienced consultant to help lead projects and guide consultants in our “Digital Backbone, IT Modernization and Cloud” practice.

You will assist the Digital Backbone Lead in delivering and managing a consulting team for Cloud and other related IT modernization and digital transformation engagements.

You will lead Cloud and IT Modernization Projects including initial assessments, strategies, workload and/or portfolio analysis, project plans, market capabilities, and roadmap development for the Digital Backbone – and run large programs across multiple clients within this discipline.

Duties & Responsibilities:

• Practice

o Leads the delivery of ISG methodology and tools in support of client cloud computing and IT Modernization initiatives

o Assists in recruiting activities by identifying and interviewing candidates as well as informal mentoring and coaching of current staff

o Contributes to the creation and refinement of ISG methodologies, tools, processes, and IP for cloud and other digital offerings

o Participates in thought leadership for the formation and build of additional value-added consulting offerings and partnership opportunities to help drive the ISG Digital Backbone, IT Modernization and Cloud services business including the development of external content development and thought leadership

• Client

o Provides consultation services to clients and suppliers in areas of cloud computing trends, architectures, project management, modeling/business case development, migrations, management, cost transparency, service models and supplier transactions

o Gains an understanding of client’s current situation and environment by gathering needed information and using appropriate frameworks and models in the development of assessment material for decision-making purposes

o Participates as a key contributor or engagement leader on client engagements SME focus area

o Responsible for project management of small to medium sized engagements or major sub-project Leads the planning and the development to all project deliverables and assumes overall responsibility for staffing, budget, work plans, scope, project milestones, issues management and risk management utilizing ISG’s project management methods, tools and templates

Knowledge, Skills and Experience Qualifications:

• Required

o 3-6 years recent consulting experience in customer-facing roles, or suitable experience within a corporate IT department in a variety of leadership positions across IT Operations, Architecture and Security

o Advanced knowledge of Cloud delivery models and ability to understand application architectures for cloud modernization with working knowledge of architecture of public and on-premise hybrid-cloud solutions

o Knowledge of security risks and best practices for implementing Cloud architectures for enterprise customers; experience in a regulated industry is a plus

o Experience with market Cloud providers and provider enablers, and ability to work with and lead customer IT and managed services partners in the migration of workloads to the cloud

o Experience with Cloud management platforms and cloud automation tools

o Strong presentation, verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to all levels of management including senior leaders and C-level executives

• Desired

o Strong understanding of organizational roles and responsibilities associated with enterprise agility, IT service delivery and operations

o Broad enterprise application experience with leading ERP stacks such as SAP, Oracle, etc. and other platform such as HRIS, CRM, etc.

o Recent, hands-on experience designing, building and operating complex, global IT infrastructures

o Technical proficiency and comfort with variety of Operating System and Database platforms

o Knowledge and experience with DevOps processes and tools highly desired (Puppet, Chef, Docker, etc.)

Professional Traits:

• Fully understands, and has experience with the Consulting Lifecycle

• Has worked for Tier 1 consultancies for at least 3+ years across their overall professional career

• The individual has led large, diverse, multi-disciplinary teams to solve complex technology related issues in real life industry relevant scenarios

• Has hands on experience with specific Practice competencies & themes through client engagement work in Tier 1 consultancies, or through direct employment with large global enterprises in the specific industry

• Has strong 3+ years of experience across multiple industry segments and is knowledgeable of critical success factors/issues that are emerging due to the impact of the Digital Industrial Economy for those industries

• Is comfortable with working within a matrix management operating model

Education / Certifications:

• Bachelor of Arts or Science degree in a technical or scientific field

• MBA/MS or other advanced degree(s) desirable

• ITIL Foundation Qualification desirable

• Cloud certifications desirable

Travel:

• 80% - 100% required

Internal: ITMCCM001

title: POWERBI CONSULTANT
job_description:
POWERBI CONSULTANT
Type: Full-time, Salary
Location: Denver, CO
Tilson is a high growth team of driven professionals with a national practice. We are on a mission to build Americas information infrastructure. We accomplish this with a team of experts working collaboratively on meaningful, impactful projects for great clients. Our team environment fosters intellectual curiosity, motivates employees, and cultivates talented people who work with purpose, mastery and autonomy. We strive to listen to our clients, partner with them as a team, and accept their goals as our own.

Tilson has been recognized on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies in the U.S. for nine years in a row.
The PowerBI Consultant collaborates with other team members on implementing targeted data strategies for our clients. The primary concentration is on data preparation for analytic consumption and presentation. While the current focus is on the Microsoft SQL Server and PowerBI toolsets, they will continue to build technical skills with a focus on broadening awareness of additional value we can bring to our clients. This job will reside in our Denver, Colorado office.
Responsibilities:


Self-manage and perform each assigned project through its entire lifecycle, including research, design, development, testing, implementation, and documentation
Interview subject matter experts to fully understand the requirements, document business needs, and convert them to technical specifications
Develop complex business logic using advanced tools to transform and cleanse data
Verify data integrity and report accuracy ensuring clients satisfaction
Design solutions to provide optimal product performance and follow established best practices for development
Provide excellent customer service, empathy, and build relationships with the Client
Bring new ideas to the Client and to the rest of the consulting team
Active support of Tilsons business practices and company values
Some travel required

Qualifications:


5+ years of experience within BI/DW development methodologies
2+ years of PowerBI/Microsoft toolset experience (PowerBI, Transact SQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)
Strong understanding of construction accounting data
Business sense
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Collaborative approach to problem solving
Highly organized and detail-oriented

Successful candidates will be required to submit to a criminal background check.
Tilson offers a competitive benefits package, including:

Paid time off
Healthcare, disability, dental and life insurance benefits
401(k) retirement savings plan with automatic company contribution
Entrepreneurial, highly technical and customer-focused work environment

Our mission is to serve our customers by building, integrating, and maintaining the information technology and communications infrastructure that enables great organizations to innovate and deliver.
Tilson is a world leader in executing information and communications technology projects to build a more connected world. We accomplish this with a team of experts working collaboratively on meaningful, impactful projects for great clients. Our team environment fosters intellectual curiosity, motivates employees, and cultivates talented people who work with purpose, mastery, and autonomy. We strive to listen to our clients, partner with them as a team, and accept their goals as our own.
We will run our business sustainably, for its financial health, its people and the public good. We believe in:

Safety- above bottom line. Cutting corners is never an option.
Integrity- we do what is right, even if doing so puts us at a temporary disadvantage.
Accountability- everyone at Tilson is accountable for the work we do as a whole.
Professionalism- be trusted by our clients to be their get it done team.
Respect- for our employees, clients, and partners.
Composure- we are comfortable in chaos and trust that we will always find a way through any challenge.

Tilson is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action employer
Tilson provides equal opportunity to all employees on the basis of individual qualification without regard to race, sex, religion, color, age, national origin, physical and mental disability, genetic information and history, sexual orientation, or other category protected by state or federal law. Tilson does not discriminate in the recruitment, hiring, compensation, promotion, transfer, benefits, or any other condition of employment.

Principals only. Recruiters should not contact Tilson.
No phone calls please.

title: Consultant, Sales and Use Tax
job_description:
The Sales and Use Tax Consultant (“Consultant”) works with a team to identify tax savings opportunities for clients and to gain an understanding of how the client computes each component of the sales and use tax. This includes researching issues, reconciling databases, and completing detailed calculations. The taxing authority verifies the issues, and the Consultant assists the team with this process.Duties and responsibilities, as they align to Ryan’s Key Results

People:

Create a positive team experience.

Client:

Responds to client inquiries and requests from tax authorities.Travels to client locations to gather and copy tax returns, invoices, purchase orders, and other documentation to use in the audit refund process.

Value:

Reviews documentation and researches issues.Works with raw data to complete calculations.Drafts filings, such as petitions for redetermination, refund claims, and various other administrative replies.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance (with minimum 12 accounting hours with GPA of 3.0 or higher)Strong academic credentials (minimum Overall 2.8+ GPA)Relevant work experience preferred (e.g. internships, summer positions, school jobs)

or

Bachelor's degree and one to three years audit or tax related experienceDesire to perform in a high-energy team environmentDemonstrated leadership, problem solving, and strong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments, and manage ambiguityAbility to work both independently and as part of a team with professionals at all levels.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must have intermediate knowledge of Microsoft® Word, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Internet navigation and research.

Valid driver’s license required.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment:

Standard indoor working environment.Occasional long periods of sitting while working at computer.Occasional long periods of standing while copying.Position requires regular interaction with employees and clients both in person and via e-mail and telephone.Independent travel requirement: 30 to 40%.

Equal Opportunity Employer: disability/veteran

title: Sr. Incident Response Consultant
job_description:
The Crypsis Group is a respected security advisory firm with a vision to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is comprised of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics and information security. With a highly-successful track record of delivering mission critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide effective incident response, attack-readiness and remediation plans with a focus on providing long term support to improve our clients security posture.

Responsibilities for the Senior Incident Response Security Consultant include:

Perform reactive incident response functions including but not limited to: host-based analysis functions through investigating Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X systems to identify Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).Examine firewall, web, database, and other log sources to identify evidence and artifacts of malicious and compromised activity.Investigate data breaches leveraging forensics tools including Encase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, and custom Crypsis investigation tools to determine source of compromises and malicious activity that occurred in client environments.Lead incident response engagements to guide clients through forensic investigations, contain security incidents, and provide guidance on longer term remediation recommendations.Mentorship of Incident Response Consultants in incident response and forensics best practices.Ability to perform light travel requirements as needed to meet business demands (on average 20%).

Qualifications for the Senior Incident Response Security Consultant include:

4+ years of incident response or digital forensics experience with a passion for cyber security (consulting experience preferred)Proficient with host-based forensics and data breach responseExperienced with EnCase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, Redline, Volatility, WireShark, TCPDump, and open source forensic toolsBachelors Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security or related field

Compensation for the Incident Response Security Consultant includes:

Competitive salary plus quarterly bonus opportunityCompany Equity Approved Certification and Training Reimbursements Open Paid Time Off PolicyMedical, Dental, and Vision Benefits401K Employer MatchingFlexible work schedule

title: Associate Customer Support Consultant
job_description: Are you interested in a career opportunity with a growing software company? We are currently developing our solutions on mobile and in the cloud! More than 1,600 companies from around the world use P2 solutions every day to manage their land assets, measure and process financial information, optimize production, and manage their reserves. Documents work. Attention to detail. Digs in and makes progress on work.Decision Making Level: Initiates conversations to get the support/clarity necessary to carry out a task.Proactively assists in accomplishing team-level technical goals.Shares knowledge with other team members and wider P2 organization during internal meetings.Project Size & Level of Complexity: Able to diagnose issues and provide solutions for a few functional and technical areas within a product.Can independently frame problems and perform relevant research for small or targeted effort.Qualifications:0-2 years of relevant experience(Oil & Gas Industry preferred, knowledge of O & G Accounting & Production Concepts)BA/BS required, preferred in Computer Science, Accounting, or Engineering degree. ADA:While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific Always be learning.When in doubt, talk it out.Show up and follow up.Create positive energy.Think beyond… Please note: Assessment testing may be required for this position.We offer a casual work environment, comprehensive benefits plan, generous PTO, and a competitive compensation structure. We have a positive culture designed around the philosophy of mutual respect and the challenge of contributing to the continued success of our organization. P2 is dedicated to individual and corporate growth opportunities, and we would love to talk to you further! title: Lighting Consultant
