results oriented•Ability to multi-task and adjust schedules to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment•Proficient in computer systems and personal computer use.•Flexible to learning a broad range of topics outside of their comfort zoneTravel Required:•Up to 80% depending on project assignment and the client. At times, travel can be 80% and other times no travel.Work Environment:•Fast paced•Multifaceted role with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities•An environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect •This position can be remote.

title: Adjunct Faculty- Advanced Pathophysiology
job_description: Keypath Education is supporting Wilkes University's search for qualified online faculty for their Graduate Nursing Programs. We are inviting applicants for an Advanced Pathophysiology Adjunct Faculty Position in the Passan School of Nursing Graduate Nursing Program. The purpose of the Nurse Practitioner program in the Passan School of Nursing at Wilkes University is to prepare Nurse Practitioners for providing direct patient care of health promotion, health protection, disease prevention, and treatment.  The successful candidate is responsible for teaching a Graduate Nursing Advanced Pathophysiology course online for Nurse Practitioner programs and has an excellent understanding of pathophysiology as it relates to disease processes and management. Key duties include:  Teach online courses for Graduate Nursing, with emphasis on Nurse Practitioner program courses. Provide subject matter expertise to support the Nurse Practitioner programs, ensuring that industry standards are embedded in courses and that student learning outcomes are achieved. Apply PSON graduate nursing policies in the online classroom as outlined during orientation. Support student learning and development through academic rigor, coaching, and mentoring efforts. Provide prompt and meaningful feedback to students as per PSON academic policy in a fair, objective, and consistent manner, using established rubrics and clear grading criteria. Submit assignment and course grades by imparted timelines. Complete the required online faculty orientation prior to teaching. Collaborate effectively with graduate nursing faculty and staff in the PSON for ensuring quality course and program outcomes. Demonstrate professionalism, integrity, and ethics of the academic process in the online classroom. Desired Qualifications:  Unencumbered RN and CRNP licenses in state of residence Master's degree in nursing required; PhD in nursing or DNP degree preferred Board-certified NP or CNS with 2 years minimum experience in clinical practice A minimum of 1 year of successful online teaching experience for an accredited university, preferably in nursing at the graduate level Proven ability to engage students in active learning to meet required course and program outcomes Experience with learning management systems (LMSs); D2L / Brightspace preferred   Wilkes University is an independent, comprehensive university dedicated to academic excellence in the liberal arts, sciences, and selected professional programs. The University has approximately 2,450 students at the undergraduate level and over 1,500 full time equivalent students at the graduate and first professional levels.  Its institutional focus is on developing strong mentoring relationships with each of its students and contributing vitally to economic development of Northeastern Pennsylvania. The University is located in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania, a revitalized city that is located on the lovely Susquehanna River and is within two and one-half hours driving distance of New York City and Philadelphia.  Required Documents:  Please include the following in your resume:current unencumbered RN license, APRN license, national board certification, as appropriate  Wilkes University is constantly seeking to become a more diverse community and to enhance its capacity to value and capitalize on the cultural richness that diversity brings. The University strongly encourages applications from persons with diverse backgrounds.

title: Investment Consultant, Fiduciary Consulting Services
job_description:
Who We Are:

Newport helps companies offer their associates a more secure financial future through retirement plans, insurance and consulting services. Newport offers comprehensive plan solutions and consulting expertise to plan sponsors and the advisors who serve them. As a provider and partner, Newport is independent, experienced and responsive.

Job Description:

Newport has a great opportunity for an Investment Consultant. The Investment Consultant is an integral part of the Fiduciary Consulting Services team and will work with various team members and other areas of the firm to facilitate the delivery of investment consulting services to the firm’s institutional clients. Fiduciary Consulting Services provides governance and investment support to qualified and non-qualified plan sponsors.

Your Responsibilities will include:

Proactively advising corporate plan sponsors on menu construction, asset allocation and manager selection for investment alternatives in their retirement plansDevelopment of investment policy statements and the delivery of quarterly investment reviewsFormulating target return and risk-based portfolios utilizing internal asset allocation framework and the development of hedging strategies for the purposes of asset-liability management

 BS/BA Degree from an accredited university and/or hold the CFA designation, Master’s Degree is a plus 5+ years’ experience working in a related position focusing on providing investment advice and services to retirement plan clients Must have excellent written and oral communication skills, as interaction with clients, the team and other areas of the firm is critical to success Ideal candidates will be able to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment and will be a“self starter” working continuously under tight deadlines Willing to pursue securities licenses ( FINRA Series 6 or 7, 66, etc.) and the CFA designation

title: Digital Insights Consultant III
job_description: Valorem Reply is seeking a senior level Data & Analytics professional with a passion for utilizing the Microsoft BI Stack to provide value and insights to a business. The preferred candidate will have demonstrated leadership in the field of advanced analytics, data sciences, and data analysis.  The Digital Insights Consultant will lead the creation of high-value analytics solutions leveraging Valorem Reply’s proven implementation methodology and solutions while leading and managing enterprise and mid-market projects, as well as technical pre-sales support activities as required. You will be responsible for designing solution architecture, assisting with solution requirement definition, and ensuring processes are followed by all members of the project team. You will have the opportunity to work with and learn the latest Microsoft solutions in a fun work environment. This position will work collaboratively across all Valorem Reply’s sales, service delivery and account management organizations in service to Valorem Reply’s customers.  This position will represent Valorem Reply’s approach to advanced analytics solutions and as such must demonstrate proficiency at the architecture level. This position will require an understanding of how advanced analytics are positioned to meet business objectives, how advanced analytics relates to business and enterprise architectures, and how to implement advanced analytic solutions through people, process and technology.  The ideal candidate will have extensive Microsoft and Open Source technology experience implementing Big Data with Advanced Analytics solutions including data ingestion, data storage, data shaping, machine learning, predictive analytics and data visualization. Additionally the successful candidate will have demonstrated leadership in the field of advanced analytics, data sciences, and data analysis, and will also have a commitment to working across enterprises (both within Valorem Reply and our customers), be familiar with the market challenges in multiple industry verticals, have experience with emerging technologies in advanced analytics and experience with non-Microsoft technologies. Minimum Qualifications10+ years’ experience in a predictive and decision support analytics function 6+ years quantitative analysis experience 6+ years of consulting leadership or management experience 3+ years of advanced analytics development experience 3+ years technical team leadership or management experience Ability to travel to customer locations in US and Canada Strong foundation in statistics Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, MIS, or related field   Required Technical SkillsGeneral architecture 	Designing large-scale analytical systems 	Being able to interpret business requirements into functional and then technical requirements 	Understanding of designing workflow/process-based systems 	Experience solutioning Cloud based enterprise data architectures Information architecture 	Data Modeling principles for relational and dimensional data structures 	Data Warehouse design principles (e.g. Kimball, Inmon) 	Data Lake design principles 	Hybrid enterprise data architecture 	Expertise using various open source or dedicated analytics tools – Matlab, R, Python, Scala Microsoft Stack 	SQL Server core database engine (T-SQL code development) 	SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) 	SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) 	SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) Microsoft O365 technologies Microsoft Azure 	Cortana Intelligence Suite 	Azure PaaS 	Azure Data Services 	ADF, Cosmos db, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL, Azure Storage, Azure Data Explorer, etc., etc. Desired Technical SkillsBig Data technologies / Languages: 	Databricks 	Snowflake 	Spark SQL, Spark MLlib, Spark Streaming 	MapReduce, 	Pig, Hive Information architecture 	Taxonomies, Metadata Management and Master Data Management principles 	Data Stewardship, Ownership and Quality Management principles Data Science application experience 	Languages: R, Python, SAS, Alteryx, JSON, XML 	Platforms: R Studio, Azure ML Studio, etc. General DBMS experience 	RDBMS - Oracle, DB2, MySQL, etc. 	NoSQL – Hbase, Casandra, DataStax, MongoDB, CouchDB, etc. General Reporting capabilities 	Power BI, Qlik, Cognos, Microstrategy, etc. 	Azure Dev Ops (ADO) Microsoft SQL Server technologies: 	SQL Server Analysis Services (MDX code development) 	SQL Server 2012 Required Non-Technical SkillsBusiness Engagement: 	Demonstrated experience…  Providing thought leadership and business strategy acumen around advanced analytics and business information life cycle  Leading customers through a value-based decision making cycle  Developing functional, non-functional and technical requirements based on business imperatives  Presenting to customer executive teams with authority and purpose Project Leadership: 	Demonstrated experience…  Directing business analysts and developers in the execution of project tasks  Leading consultants in various project work streams   Estimating, planning and executing advanced analytics solutions  Managing multi-site project teams

title: Inside Sales Residential Consultant
job_description:
POSITION SUMMARY: As an Inside Sales Consultant for Residential Business, you have an opportunity to exude customer zeal in the growth and retention of residential customers by selling new products and services, retaining customers, and delivering superior customer service.

At Republic Services, We Work for Earth! When it comes to serving our communities, were devoted to providing the most effective, safe and environmentally- friendly waste management solutions. At Republic Services, were guided by five essential core values to be Respectful, Responsible, Reliable, Resourceful, and Relentless in all we do, every day. Its what makes us who we are, reminding us to keep our employees and customers at the heart of it all. We make sure your voices are heard and are recognized for their contributions.

Associate or Bachelors Degree.Self-starter and a strong work ethic.Strong research, investigation and problem resolution skills.Strong verbal, written, typing and interpersonal communication skills.Spanish bilingual fluency, in a business environment.

High school diploma or GED.Experience in call center or sales environment.

title: Leasing Consultant
job_description:
How would you like to join a nationally-recognized, award-winning team in one of the fastest-growing industries in the nation? We are a leading real estate development and management firm that manages multi-family residential communities and commercial retail and office spaces. We are searching for an exceptional, energetic, and experienced Leasing Consultant to join our team.
Job Purpose:
The Leasing Consultant will show and lease apartments to prospective residents and assist with renewals for current residents.
Responsibilities:

Welcome and show property to prospective residents.
Answer internet and telephone inquiries about the property.
Leasing Consultant will participate in a follow up program to maintain timely and effective communication with prospects.
Coordinate and prepare communications to residents, including any necessary to target residents throughout their lease period.
Complete all lease paperwork, including related addendums.
Maintain and supervise a lease renewal program following the property and management company guidelines and goals.
Update daily reports on occupancy and provide information to Community Manager.
Leasing Consultant will assist with the market outreach program in the community.
To know and adhere to all federal, state and local laws, as well as all policies and procedures contained in the manuals issued by the property management company or as otherwise communicated (verbally or in writing) to on-site employees.

Skills/Qualifications:

College degree preferred, high school education required
Leasing, real estate, sales, or retail experience a plus
Leasing Consultant must be a team player with a positive outgoing personality and strong commitment to employer.
Professional manner, honest character and work at fast pace while maintaining accuracy.
Detail oriented with strong organizational and computer skills.
Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation

Benefits:

Health, dental, and vision insurance
401K matching plan
Paid leave time
Participation in bonus program

title: Regional Environmental Practice Consultant - Seller/Doer l
job_description:
Great that you're thinking about a career with BSI!

Are you looking to join a dynamic global industry leader that can boast nearly 120 years of excellence, growth, and continuing innovation? Do you hold yourself to the highest of standards? If yes, then we would love to hear from you

.

BSI is currently seeking an innovative Regional Environmental Practice Seller/Doer with 10+ years of demonstrated ability to identify and deliver environmental consulting services to make a positive impact to workers worldwide.

This significant role will be located in the Houston, Austin, or Dallas Texas area and will responsible for developing sales opportunities and engagements for the Environmental Practice. In addition, this role will participate in the continued growth of the Region in support of the National Environmental Practice and Key Accounts.

The successful candidate will have direct experience in consultative business development within EHS consulting in a matrix organization, a strong business acumen, and be highly motivated in the cultivation of long-term and mutually-rewarding relationships with clients, coworkers, and strategic business partners.

Essential Responsibilities:

Possess a strong business development acumen, with deep industry relationships and innovative approachesParticipate in thought leadership activities (committees, conferences, industry associations) to identify and capture opportunities with both new and existing clientsConduct market trend(s) assessment and needs analysisMeet new clients and develop long-lasting relationshipsGenerate proposal and RFP opportunitiesDevelop draft cost estimates proposals with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs)Support sales functions such as providing input on sales and marketing strategy, collaborating on sales efforts, managing a book of business, and impacting client growthDeliver an excellent level of technical services to clients, particularly with regards to initiating services with new clientsBe a team collaborator, builder and multiple

BSI’s most successful individuals in this role are:

Enthusiastic about networking with the ability to identify opportunities for BSI in a variety of markets Have interest in and passion for environmental servicesEager to learn, likes to be challenged, and open to expanding skill setsIndependent self-starter with willingness to jump in and take on new assignments and to be innovativeOutgoing, energetic, friendly, hard-working, and industrious towards building effective working relationships with teams of consultant and clients

Experience/Education

Undergraduate degree, Master’s degree preferred, as a Chemical Engineer, Civil Engineer, Environmental Engineering, Environmental Studies, Environmental Science, Geology or equivalentProfessional Engineering Certification, or Professional Geologist Certification preferredConsulting experience in Air, Water, Wastes, EPCRA, ESA, and Training preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skills including presentations, report generation and analysis, and market trend analysisAbility to research gather, organize interpret data from multiple sourcesAbility to plan and implement projectsAbility to network with clients around their designated office and periodically travel within the United States

Our ambition is to be recognized and valued globally as a best-in-class company; a client-driven, efficiently-run, growing business. BSI has come a long way since being founded in 1901. Today, we're a global business services organization, respected world over for the development of standards; assessment of management systems; testing and certification of products and services; providing software solutions; and the delivery of training courses. We offer diverse career paths from auditing to sales, product development to finance, and from IT to marketing.

With around 4,000 employees working with over 80,000 clients in 172 countries it means that career opportunities are vast. BSI challenges mediocrity and complacency to help embed excellence into the way people and products work. That means showing businesses how to improve performance, reduce risk and achieve sustainable growth.

What we offer:

BSI offers a competitive salary, group-sponsored health and dental, short-term and long-term disability, a company-matched 401k plan, company paid life insurance, 11 paid holidays and 4 weeks paid time off.
Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. These three behaviours represent how we do things at BSI. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business.BSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to diversity.

To protect our candidates and BSI employees during the Covid-19 outbreak, all interviews will take place remotely.

title: Payment Consultant
job_description:
FATTMERCHANT

Orlando’s fastest growing payment technology company!

Why You’ll Love Fattmerchant:

First and foremost, Fattmerchant exists to provide the Best Damn Experience to both our customers AND our people. We do this through building an exceptional product that our customers need to grow their business, the highest customer satisfaction rating in the industry, and three strong core values that we live and breathe every day.

One Team:

We all possess a “team over self” attitude and are all aligned towards the overall mission of the company

Get Shit Done:

We believe in being the best version of yourself within a results-focused work environment

Create Joy:

It’s one thing to just be polite and enjoyable (permission to play), but we take it a step further by sparking joy and happiness across our team members and our customers

These are the values that define who we are, and which have empowered our staggering growth since our founding in 2014. It’s exciting to be Central Florida’s 3rd Fastest Growing Company!

Fattmerchant has seen exceptional year-over-year growth because of our dedication to building powerful integrated payment solutions for SMBs, and for our partners who serve SMBs. We started with the idea that businesses deserve better, and Fattmerchant employees are committed to bringing a truly exceptional payments experience to business owners across America.

We’re redefining an industry that is known for excessive fees, being difficult to understand, and for having subpar technology. It’s not always easy, but we’ve seen the fruits of our efforts through our 99% customer retention rate, NPS score that breaks industry records, and employees who are always happy to step through the door and tackle the day with the best team out there. We’re proud to be recognized for our excellence in technology, work environment, and entrepreneurial spirit, with such honors as 2018 and 2019 Best Fintech to Work For from PaymentSource, Coolest Office Space from Orlando Business Journal, and one of Entrepreneur Magazine’s 2018 Top Company Cultures. Not to mention countless acknowledgements in technology, innovation, and leadership from publications across the industry.

*As part of our interview process, we will be using a video interviewing platform, Spark Hire. The video interviewing platform will allow our hiring team and candidates to connect more quickly without the pressure of synchronizing calendars for our initial phase of candidate assessments. Our goal with the video interviewing portion of our hiring process is to learn more about your personality and previous work experience.

What You’ll Do:

Job Summary

As a Fattmerchant Inside Sales, Payment Consultant, you are a critical part in fulfilling our mission to help small business owners make smarter business decisions through our world-class platform, award-winning customer service, and transparent easy-to-understand pricing.

As an Inside Sales Payment Consultant, you are the first point of contact that every merchant will engage with, and serve as experts in this industry. The top performing PCs will have a keen understanding of:

The payment processing industry The Fattmerchant solution and offerings The Underwriting process Processing statements CRM operations and task management

Your responsibilities as a PC will include, but not be limited to, understanding general operations around the merchant’s industry, how they’re currently processing, and prescribing solutions based on Fattmerchant’s offerings and the prospect’s needs, all while efficiently and effectively navigating through our systems.

In return, we are committed to supporting you in your daily activities, providing you continuous and ongoing training & coaching, supplying you with the right tools & solutions to streamline your efforts, and propelling your career to the next level!

Key Responsibilities & Objectives

Educate, consult, and navigate business owners (merchants) towards the appropriate Fattmerchant solutions, product offerings, and plans Respond immediately to inbound calls and inquiries regarding Fattmerchant Have a keen understanding of the payment processing industry Properly maintain follow up tasks and stay on top of all your active contacts and opportunities Effectively navigate through the sales cycle from the initial discovery call all the way to the close Source new contacts and opportunities from areas outside of marketing leads; have a “hunter mentality” Keep up with industry trends, competitive landscape and specific verticals that can benefit from Fattmerchant’s solution Collaborate with the Customer Success team and Underwriting team to ensure that the customer journey is positive and flawless Effectively navigate through your internal systems, including HubSpot, Google Apps, and Voxtell phone Be a brand ambassador in the community through event presence including, but not limited to, Chamber Events, O-Tech, OBJ, Meet ups, Associations, and others

Requirements

2+ years of Consultative Sales experience selling a technical solution with around a 30-45 day sales cycle Collaborative attitude with a focus on “We” and not on “Me” Innate curiosity. Must be able to ask the right questions to understand the merchant’s business, pain points, existing infrastructure, and needs Highly empathetic. Be a champion of both Fattmerchant and the Merchant Strong attention to detail, work ethic, and communication skills. Strong Interdepartmental Relationships. Ability to collaborate within the Sales department as well as the Underwriting department, and Customer Success department. Ability to work under pressure in fast-paced environment with aggressive company and individual goals Knowledge and proficiency with CRM systems, preferably Salesforce and/or HubSpot Effective use of Google Apps (Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Sheets) Solution-oriented with the ability to think strategically and creatively in decision-making Coachable and able to take direction and feedback well, yet being forward-thinking to challenge the status quo Experience/Desire to contribute to the broader goals of the organization beyond your immediate job description Culture Fit: someone who is positive, optimistic, ambitious, proactive, honest, charismatic, well-rounded, articulate, autonomous, innovative, and has an insatiable appetite for success and snacks.

Benefits

Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision) Competitive Base Salary + Uncapped Commission 4% 401K Match  Conference & Continuing Education Coverage  Team Building Events/Opportunities  Downtown Parking  Performance & Incentive Bonuses  Unlimited PTO  Free snacks + Coffee

Fattmerchant is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
